headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
At Semcon, we believe that the one who understands the end-user best, will create the best solutions. Therefore for us, it’s always people first. Then technology. We create value and impact, innovating sustainable products, services and business models for our customers, enabled by digital capabilities.

Now we are looking for a DevOps Engineer with drive and warmth to join us. A person who thrive in a setting where a lot of things are going on. You will focus on facilitate coordination and collaboration among operations, development and testing functions.

You will be part of our growing Digital Services team in the Uppsala area and work together with kind and skilled individuals in challenging assignments and with exciting customers. In our team we all come from different areas of expertise and our ambition is to build a large team with skills ranging from digital strategy, project management and UX/service design to software development and emerging tech. We also have a long history of working with embedded software to create connected and smart products.

Want to learn more about our offerings and projects within the Digital Services area? Click here. (https://semcon.com/sv/digital-hubb/)

What you’ll do

- Support in-house teams and customers improving their SW development workflow and getting the most out of their CI/CD environment
- Bridge the gap and improve collaboration between operations, developers and testing functions
- Troubleshoot issues with tools, processes, applications and/or infrastructure
- Evaluate current development and operations procedures, recommend and implements tools and practices to increase efficiency and reliability
- Having fun!


We’ll look beyond your resume, but here is a starting point.

- Solid experience developing, testing and deploying software systems
- Previous experience from working with some of the tools that make a state-of-the-art CI/CD environment (e.g. Azure/AWS, Jenkins, Python, Ansible, Kubernetes, Docker, Linux, Gitlab, Bitbucket).
- Enjoy working with new technology
- Excellent knowledge of agile methods
- Great communication skills in Swedish and English.


We strongly believe that diversity of background, experience and perspectives is important to create excellent user experiences and to make Semcon a great place to work.





Area Manager Digital Services

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Vårt erbjudande

ELITS kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.

Hos  får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med Openstack, Kubernetes, containertekniker och cloud native i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.

Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik



Som anställd på ELITS får du ett antal fördelar som:

- En trygg och säker anställning
- Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
- Friskvårdsbidrag
- Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
- Privat pensionsrådgivning
- Förmånsportal
- Extremt kompetenta och skickliga kollegor


Om rollen:

För långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser till våra kunder letar vi nu efter flera DevOps kollegor för att vara en del av vårt skickliga och snabbt växande Devops-team!

Som anställd på ELITS får du upplevaia av det bästa från två världar; delvis kundmiljöerna, men också ELITS som arbetsgivare där du är med och formar vår stora företagskultur och delar kunskap och erfarenheter med andra likasinnade.

Du kommer också att erbjudas utbildning, kompetensutveckling och certifieringar tillsammans med våra tekniska partners där vi arbetar tätt tillsammans med Redhat, Suse/Rancher, Hashicorp och Styra .

Våra konsultuppdrag innebär ofta att vi hjälper våra kunder i modernisera deras IT-miljöer, att hjälpa dem arbeta mer agilt och på ett modernt sätt med rätt typ av verktyg för att på bästa sätt stötta deras nuvarande och framtida behov. Detta gör vi enligt en metodik vi på ELITS kallar Journey to Agile.



För att passa in i rollen tror vi att du har erfarenhet av följande:

- Systemadministration i en Linux-baserad produktions-miljö
- Container-infrastruktur (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Scriptning/programmering i språk som Bash, Python, Go
- Versionshantering - Git
- Automatisering


Meriterande om du även har kunskap inom:

- IaC - Ansible, Terraform
- CI / CD
- Openstack
- Publika clouds
- Openshift och/eller Rancher
- Hasicorp: Vault, Consul, mfl




För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.

Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!

För denna position utförs även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.



Om du har frågor om rollen eller våra uppdrag, tveka inte att kontakta mig på det sätt som passar dig bäst, chatta, maila eller ring!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Oneflow is a rapidly growing tech startup located in the heart of Stockholm. We have created a platform that automates the entire contract process from start to finish, all in one place. Turning clunky, static contracts into helpful, smart contracts. Processes are faster, decisions are better, and deals are quicker. It’s an easier, smoother, and smarter way for teams of all shapes and sizes to handle their contracts - just like magic. Come and work wonders with us!
We are now looking for a new DevOps Engineer. If you are dedicated and like to work in a collaborative environment, where we make progress together, both when it comes to our product and our growth as individuals, this is something for you! We are currently 100+ people representing 20 nationalities. We believe our diversity, both when it comes to our different backgrounds and our gender equality, is a strength in our organisation.

You will be working with the Oneflow Platform Team, who continuously scale, secure and improve our infrastructure, which enables our developers to make several deployments each day. We have multiple self-organizing teams that you will support by improving the core infrastructure across the entire platform. We want our developers to feel a strong sense of ownership and that their work really matters. We also want them to be involved in all steps of product development, from feature planning to release.
What's in it for you?
You get to work with modern technologies with very low amounts of technical debt. We have embraced containerization, cloud services and modern development methodologies and we know that making our developers happy will make our customers happy. You will get to define, set up, configure and maintain an infrastructure of products and services used by thousands of companies every day together with experienced colleagues. We value security, stability, redundancy and uptime, and you will absolutely feel that what you do matters.
Who you are
As a DevOps Engineer at Oneflow, you have an interest in distributed systems and their scalability. You think of encryption, "defense in depth" concepts and the privacy of our customers data. You will be working with infrastructure development and will both improve existing flows and create new ones as our platform evolves. We see that you have at least a few years of experience working with cloud infrastructure, container orchestration, encryption and information security.
Your background:
Having worked a few years with cloud infrastructure and container orchestration
Experience working with tools such as Terraform and cloud platforms
You have created and maintained Kubernetes clusters, both locally and through cloud offerings such as EKS or GKE
You are familiar with CI/CD pipelines and like to optimize deployment processes

Comfortable securing high volumes of data

Technologies and concepts to work with:
Kubernetes and Docker
AWS
Terraform (or similar)
CI/CD
Distributed logging, tracing and monitoring
Docker and containerization in general
KMS / HSM

We also value if you have an interest in any of these areas:
Performance and scalability of distributed systems
MySQL / Elasticsearch / RabbitMQ
An understanding of SaaS product development

 Come work with us
We value gender equality and diversity in our organisation and strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we encourage and welcome applicants who are people of colour, LGBTQ+, people with disabilities and those without college degrees. We follow a competence based recruitment process. If you feel the above description seems like a good fit for you - we would love to hear from you! Get in touch to start a journey you won’t forget!

Apply by submitting your resume and a personal letter telling us more about why the role is interesting and why you would be a good fit. We will get back to you as soon as possible!
Öppen för alla
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

headline: DevOps Developer
description.text:
Be the magician of engineering enablers!
Imagine you have a 4-meter-high black beast of a truck in front of you, a Volvo FH loaded with over 100 tons of gods. There is no driver in the cab, the truck will drive autonomously to its destination. It has driven down that track before and knows the way.
During the assignment an emergency brake is triggered but the logs shows that this hard of a brake wasn’t necessary. 





So who are we?
We are Build, Measure and Learn Technology, a part of Electrical and Electronics Architecture at Volvo Group Trucks Technology in Gothenburg!


We have the goal ensure that we have the structure, framework and knowledge to build and verify the EE system, from single component up to full system. This by creating the development pipelines for our embedded code, simulations and test structures that enables continuous integration and delivery.


Why do we do that?
Our vision is to be the most desired and successful transport solution provider in the world. We need to work with the mentality that we develop to learn, learn to reach further than our goals.


We see that the most important key to this learning is automation of everything and it’s in this that you’re going to help us!






Software development it’s all about testing and instant feedback. In this we have a set of tools and tool chains to enable this on unit level, full system and everything in between.


Your mission together with the team is to design, develop and maintain our continuous integration and deployment toolchain to match the need of developers and testers. It’s a big scope with always new challenges and technologies waiting a head.


It doesn’t matter if you have long experience and looking for a leading developer role or junior want to join a team that can help you learn. If you are the right person for this team, you get the role and challenges that inspires you.




So who are you?
Team player that iterate solutions and share knowledge with your teammates.
Theories of agile, DevOps and test-driven development comes natural for you, most important is to put it in to action.

Always eager to learn new stuff to help you grow and excel.

Welcome to join our world full of possibilities!


Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.

headline: Senior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Just nu letar vi efter en person som vill hjälpa kunder i egenskap av konsult. Vi tror att du antingen har en specialiserad kompetens inom ett område eller en bred kunskap inom DevOps. Vill du få vara med och bli en del av ett spännande företag och samtidigt bestämma över din egen framtid? Välkommen med din ansökan redan i dag!

Arbetsuppgifter

Som en del av AutomationEight så kommer du få vara med och hjälpa våra kunder att utvecklas. Du kommer ha möjlighet att använda dina kunskaper och ditt driv till att lyfta kundens agila processer till nästa nivå. Du hjälper till med att sänka kostnader, automatisera flöden och i slutändan öka kvaliteten på kundens produkt. Samtidigt så kommer du få möjligheten att bli en del av ett kompetenscentrum för DevOps, där alla strävar efter samma mål, att leverera lösningar i världsklass.

Det här är några av de tekniker vi arbetar med:


 Docker / Kubernetes / Docker Swarm
 Microservices
 Puppet / Ansible



 Elastic Stack

Utbildning/Erfarenhet

Vi tror att du har ett antal års erfarenhet in DevOps med erfarenhet från tekniker och koncept som continuous integration och agila processer. Det är även en fördel om du har jobbat med verktyg för uppsättning och konfigurering av virtuella miljöer.

Förmodligen så har du ett driv att utvecklas och en vilja att ständigt bli bättre och lära dig nya saker. Du trivs bra att jobba i team tillsammans med andra, både med de med samma bakgrund som dig själv men även de i andra roller. Som konsult är det en fördel om du är flexibel då rollen ger dig möjlighet att prova på många olika situationer.

headline: Senior DevOps Specialist – Stockholm heltid
description.text:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en senior DevOps specialist. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 50-tal medarbetare.
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag.
Du har:
Utbildning på kandidatnivå
Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom utveckling (som C#/.NET, Java)
CI/CD pipeline (som Jenkins, Bamboo, Tekton)
Versionshantering (som Git, SVN, BitBucket)

Meriterande:
Docker
Kubernetes
Terraform
OpenShift

Python
Shell
C++
Configuration as code
Infrastructure as code
Du får:
Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant
Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där certifieringar är en självklarhet
Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak
Åka på spännande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter
Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionsersättning, ett ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och andra generösa förmåner
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
Skriv ”Senior DevOps Specialist – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

headline: Junior backend utvecklare
description.text:
Vi söker dig som har två års erfarenhet av rollen backend utvecklare alternativt DevOps till kund i centrala Stockholm. IT-avdelningen ansvarar för utveckling och design av IT-lösningar baserade på behov från verksamheten med mål att kunden blir bäst inom digitalisering. Den agila transformationen med implementering av agila arbetssätt och processer fortsätter och du kommer ingå i ett team med ca 20 utvecklare både seniora och juniora. Du kommer arbeta med den senaste tekniken där cloud-baserade tjänster är en central del.
Dataplattformen är byggd på AWS, den ska hantera stora mängder data och integrerar med andra system och lösningar för både inläsning och konsumtion av data. Kunden är i ett tidigt stadium i utvecklingen och fokus är på att bygga vidare plattformen, genom att ta in nya dataflöden och tillgängliggöra data för konsumtion på flera sätt.
Vi söker dig som har intresse för teknik och programmering, gärna med kunskaper och erfarenheter i Python eller Java. Teamets ansvar omfattar även uppsättning av infrastruktur via kod, teknisk implementation, CI/CD och drift med DevOps-ansvar för produkterna och deras livscykel. Det är därför en fördel om ditt intresse är att vilja utvecklas brett inom teknik och kan delta i arbetet inom flera av ovanstående områden.
Vi söker dig:
- Som har högskolexamen inom relevant område inom data
- Arbetat två år inom backend eller DevOps
- Utvecklat med Java och/eller Python i ett års tid
- Arbetat med AWS eller motsvarande molntjänst

Som person är du kommunikativ, nyfiken och har viljan att lära dig mera. Arbetsspråket är Svenska.
Uppdraget är på heltid, tillsvidare, arbetet sker på distans och på plats på kontoret i centrala Stockholm.

Din ansökan

Låter rollen intressant och passande? Ansök i så fall omgående för vi intervjuar löpande och rollen kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. 

Vi kan enbart ta emot och bearbeta din ansökan genom att du registrerar ditt CV i vår portal. Med avseende på GDPR kan vi ej ta emot ansökningar via e-post. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Uppdraget är en del av Quest Consulting personaluthyrning.

Du kommer att vara anställd av Quest Consulting och arbeta som konsult hos vår kund. Kunden godkänner underleverantörer

Om oss

Quest Consulting är ett auktoriserat konsultbolag med kollektivavtal, försäkringar, friskvård och tjänstepension. Vi är specialiserade inom IT, Teknik, HR, Administration och Ekonomi. Vår målsättning är att vara din personliga samarbetspartner och just därför är det så viktigt för oss att arbeta efter våra kärnvärden där våra ledord är att vara Personliga, Nyskapande och Professionella.

DWT Consulting är ett mindre konsultbolag som just nu expanderar. DWT har sina kunder främst i Stockholm, men även i Göteborg och Malmö. Vi arbetar både mot myndigheter och privata aktörer. Som anställd hos oss så arbetar man främst ute hos kund, men även inhouse projekt förekommer.
Pipelines och generell DevOps med Azure i Team Pavarotti i ett av bankens SAFe-tåg (DIVA-tåget - digitalisering av kundmötesplatsen) på Handelsbanken IT Hög kompetens och längre erfarenhet.

headline: DevOps
description.text:
DWT Consulting är ett mindre konsultbolag som just nu expanderar. DWT har sina kunder främst i Stockholm, men även i Göteborg och Malmö. Vi arbetar både mot myndigheter och privata aktörer.
Du kommer bli en del av ett av teamen som ansvarar för den utvecklingspipeline som används av våra SW Engineering Teams. Du kommer inom ditt team att drifthålla, förvalta och vidareutveckla vår pipeline för utveckling av militära ledningssystem. Våra produkter är omfattande och komplicerade, och innehåller inbyggda realtidsdelar, stora datamängder från kvalificerade sensorer, snabba beslutsprocesser i svåra operatörsmiljöer, ett ständigt närvarande IT-säkerhetshot, utvecklat på flera kontinenter – och vi bygger en pipeline för att understödja allt detta.
Vidmakthållande:
Automatisering och säkra uniforma tjänster
Uppgradering av byggprocess orkestrering i en molnmiljö – ”on-prem”
Spårbarhet, sekretesskydd och integritet i utvecklingsmiljöer
Utvecklingsstöd för en bred palett av programmeringsspråk



Operativt:
Definition och integration av Linux-konfiguration för utveckling och exekvering i målsystemet
Övervakning av byggprocess samt identifiering av fel för kortsiktig och långsiktig lösning
Stöttning av utveckling i en kvalificerad ”branch”-strategi
Automatisering av tester i virtuella och fysiska referenssystem
Felsökning, rotorsaksanalys och involvering av berörda delar i organisationen
Backupp och återställande av historisk data över lång tid typ 7 år



Vi söker dig som är stolt och har passion i ditt arbete samt är kommunikativ i dialog med användare och internt i teamet. Du agerar inkluderande och lösningsorienterat på fler nivåer så att vårt ekosystem fungerar. Du delar transparent ditt lärande och kunskap så att du med teamet kan växa i din roll.
Om teamen:
Vi är idag två team med 5 personer vardera där det ena teamet har fokus på utvecklingsverktyg och byggpipeline, och det andra på återkoppling med automatiserad test, monitorering och återmatning. Teamen jobbar både enskilt men även över team gränsen med vår gemensamma uppgift ”Rapid, repeatable reliable developing and operating our development environments”. Metodiken för teamarbetet är ”scrum/kanban”.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real-time and at a high scale.
We are now looking for a talented Senior DevOps Engineer that wants to participate in building our success story.
At our office, located in the center of Stockholm. We promote self-organizing cross-functional teams, a flat hierarchy and flexible working hours to give all our employees a good work/life balance. Because of our large customer base, each with a different set of requirements, there is always a new challenge and you will most certainly find projects that align with your passions.
What you'll do
Perform daily operations for all our hosted solutions

Design, build and maintain DevOps specific tools


Maintain and manage CI/CD pipelines

Proactively work with life cycle management and outage prevention
Serve, Educate, and share knowledge with our local and distributed development teams so they can own their infra and code changes

What you'll bring
Have proven DevOps experience
Have ability to code, test, build, deploy, etc.
A solid experience in terms of building and running scalable solutions in the Cloud. (Kubernetes expertise and AWS)
Have experience and worked with related tools, ie Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform, Helm, Jenkins, DataDog, Jira, Confluence
Have set up and operated services by measuring and monitoring availability and performance
A team player mindset, comfortable with collaboration, open communication and reaching across the functional borders

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We are now looking for a senior DevOps Engineer to join our E-commerce & Customer Digital Development team. As a DevOps Engineer – you will be part of a growing team consisting of DevOps Engineers, tech lead, backend and frontend developers, testers and product owners in a close collaboration with the business. Everyone working to provide our guests with a personal, interactive, and seamless experience.

Together with our development teams you will be focusing on creating modern and flexible digital solutions with high availability, excellent platform stability, optimized performance and high security. You will play a key role in the continuous work to optimize our production platforms, build and manage CI/CD pipelines, monitoring, automation, and ways of working with security integrated from development to deployment. We believe that you have already worked in a SecDevOps setup and have great ideas for how to automate security further in the deployment pipeline.

Our ideal candidate has a minimum of 5-7 years of experience in DevOps and Operations in a cloud based environment. You are curios, self-driven and have a great interest in learning and adopting to new technology and trends within digital development. From your previous positions you have experience in agile ways of working, Scrum or Kanban, have an understanding of different design patterns and concepts like Micro Services, Configuration as Code, Infrastructure as Code and container technology like Docker and Kubernetes.

About us

Scandic is the largest hotel company in the Nordic countries with more than 280 hotels, in operation and under development, in more than 130 destinations. 

Well loved by guests and employees, the Scandic Friends loyalty program is the largest in the Nordic hotel industry and the company is one of the most attractive employers in the region. Scandic Hotels is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.
Responsibilities:

 - Responsibility for the daily operations of our Web, App and API platforms and cloud environments
 - Designing, developing and maintaining highly available and secure hosting solutions
 - Performance improvements
 - Monitoring
 - Capacity planning
 - Designing and developing CI/CD pipelines
 - Drive automation of processes
 - Security in the deployment pipeline

A few examples of technologies and tools you will be working with:

 - Azure and Application Insights
 - CI/CD: Octopus Deploy, Azure DevOps, TeamCity, BitBucket
 - Windows, Linux, SQL Server, Powershell
 - CDN
 - Identity Access Management
 - Log handling and static code analysis tools

Who are you?

We believe that your personal qualities are crucial to how well you will thrive in the role.

 - You are self-driven and have a great interest in learning and adopting to new technology and trends within digital development
 - You are proactive with a passion and drive for continuous improvements
 - Have an automation and improvement mindset
 - Analytic and a problem solver
 - Interest in increasing the quality and efficiency for product development
 - A great collaborator with a positive attitude

Information about the position

This is a full-time employment.

We only accept applications through our website. All applications will be processed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible. 

If you have ambitions to develop, we will give you the opportunity to grow in your role. We are looking forward to welcoming you to Scandic.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package - as well as the opportunity to join our company that fosters a vibrant environment based on our guiding principles.

We know that we reach further when we assent to our differences. At Scandic we want you to be yourself and develop in the direction you want to go, with the foundation of safe conditions and fair agreements. Welcome to Scandic.



BE A PRO

BE YOU

BE CARING

BE BOLD

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Vårt erbjudande

ELITS kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.

Hos  får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med Openstack, Kubernetes, containertekniker och cloud native i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.

Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik



Som anställd på ELITS får du ett antal fördelar som:

- En trygg och säker anställning
- Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
- Friskvårdsbidrag
- Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
- Privat pensionsrådgivning
- Förmånsportal
- Extremt kompetenta och skickliga kollegor


Om rollen:

För långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser till våra kunder letar vi nu efter flera DevOps kollegor för att vara en del av vårt skickliga och snabbt växande Devops-team!

Som anställd på ELITS får du uppleva det bästa från två världar; delvis kundmiljöerna, men också ELITS som arbetsgivare där du är med och formar vår stora företagskultur och delar kunskap och erfarenheter med andra likasinnade.

Du kommer också att erbjudas utbildning, kompetensutveckling och certifieringar tillsammans med våra tekniska partners där vi arbetar tätt tillsammans med Redhat, Suse/Rancher, Hashicorp och Styra .

Våra konsultuppdrag innebär ofta att vi hjälper våra kunder i modernisera deras IT-miljöer, att hjälpa dem arbeta mer agilt och på ett modernt sätt med rätt typ av verktyg för att på bästa sätt stötta deras nuvarande och framtida behov. Detta gör vi enligt en metodik vi på ELITS kallar Journey to Agile.



För att passa in i rollen tror vi att du har erfarenhet av följande:

- Systemadministration i en Linux-baserad produktions-miljö
- Container-infrastruktur (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Scriptning/programmering i språk som Bash, Python, Go
- Versionshantering - Git
- Automatisering


Meriterande om du även har kunskap inom:

- IaC - Ansible, Terraform
- CI / CD
- Openstack
- Publika clouds
- Openshift och/eller Rancher
- Hashicorp: Vault, Consul, mfl




För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.

Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!

För denna position utförs även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.



Om du har frågor om rollen eller våra uppdrag, tveka inte att kontakta mig på det sätt som passar dig bäst, chatta, maila eller ring!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real-time and at a high scale.
We are now looking for a talented Senior DevOps Engineer that wants to participate in building our success story.
At our office, located in the center of Stockholm. We promote self-organizing cross-functional teams, a flat hierarchy and flexible working hours to give all our employees a good work/life balance. Because of our large customer base, each with a different set of requirements, there is always a new challenge and you will most certainly find projects that align with your passions.
What you'll do
Perform daily operations for all our hosted solutions

Design, build and maintain DevOps specific tools


Maintain and manage CI/CD pipelines

Proactively work with life cycle management and outage prevention
Serve, Educate, and share knowledge with our local and distributed development teams so they can own their infra and code changes

What you'll bring
Have proven DevOps experience
Have ability to code, test, build, deploy, etc.
A solid experience in terms of building and running scalable solutions in the Cloud. (Kubernetes expertise and AWS)
Have experience and worked with related tools, ie Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform, Helm, Jenkins, DataDog, Jira, Confluence
Have set up and operated services by measuring and monitoring availability and performance
A team player mindset, comfortable with collaboration, open communication and reaching across the functional borders

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Description
We develop a cloud communication platform that’s already used by 8 out of 10 leading tech giants in the US, with over 145 billion transactions every year. A platform which can reach virtually every mobile phone on the planet in seconds or less? We are looking to add a DevOps Engineer to join our team.

You will work with our communications platform which is a distributed system, both in the geographical sense, where we provide globally distributed points of presence and access to our platform, and in its internal service-oriented architecture. 
You will work in an agile environment with a strong focus on automation, reliability and continuous improvement. This role involves a lot of responsibility in designing, taking our technical platform to the next level, and being a part of the product chain.
As our new DevOps Engineer you will:
Define and implement modern containerization and cloud solutions
Developing and improving our CI/CD pipelines
Work close to the developers and operations in designing systems that are secure and highly scalable with fast deliveries to production
Working with all teams to ensure that our services are always up and running smoothly
Make the lives of our developers easier!

Who are you?
For this role we preferably see that you have a few years of DevOps experience or from a similar software engineering role. You have in a previous job been taking ownership of a project or operated parts of it. As a person you have strong knowledge about your work to be able to contribute to technical discussions, you see the importance in close communication and setting clear directives to both the development teams as to your own team members.

In order to contribute in this role we believe you are good at:
Optimizing existing systems for scalability and building large-scale infrastructure
Containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) and cloud platforms
Building and improving CI/CD pipelines
Infrastructure as Code with tools such as Terraform


Big plus!
You’ll stand out from the crowd if you have experience in
AWS
Gitlab

Join us on our journey!
About the recruitment process:
We follow a competence-based, structured interview process where your skills, experience and attributes relevant to the role and Sinch will be assessed. As part of our recruitment process, pre-employment testing is used to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role. We acknowledge that there are two parties making a decision in this process and welcome you to ask any questions you may have at any stage of the process.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Är du en DevOps Engineer som vill jobba i ett möjliggörande plattformsteam som förser våra övriga utvecklingsteam med utvecklingsplattformar för cloud native-applikationer? Då vill vi att du läser färdigt den här annonsen.

Team DevEx (Developer Experience) ansvarar för att livet som systemutvecklare på Migrationsverket ska vara så friktionsfritt som möjligt. Våra systemutvecklare ska kunna fokusera på att utveckla en viss verksamhet på Migrationsverket, därför tar Team DevEx ansvar för att utveckla plattformar som hjälper dem fokusera på just det. Vi levererar delar av det man kan kalla "IT for IT".

Vårt team utvecklar och underhåller Migrationsverkets interna Cloudplattform som baseras på Rancher, Kubernetes och Docker. Vi utvecklar även plattformar för continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) samt plattformar för övervakning och telemetri. Vi ansvarar också för underhållet av plattformar som möjliggör drift av äldre applikationer i Red Hat Jboss.

Vi jobbar med agila arbetssätt och fokus på automation samt går mot en löst kopplad, eventbaserad systemarkitektur. Allt detta med en modern, cloud native-plattform baserat på Kubernetes och Docker i botten. Vi möjliggör ett DevOps-arbetssätt för våra utvecklingsteam.

Hos oss kan du jobba både på distans och på arbetsplatsen, vi tillämpar en hybridmodell för distansarbete.

Som vår kollega på Migrationsverket kan du förvänta dig ett givande arbete i en föränderlig miljö som präglas av ett fokus på ständiga förbättringar, samarbete och respekt för människan. Hos oss gör du skillnad och bidrar till samhällsnyttan, samtidigt som du får en trygg och stabil anställning.

Vem är du?

Du har möjligen en bakgrund där du har arbetat som systemutvecklare ett tag och har utvecklat ett intresse för just teknik- och utvecklingsplattformar. Du vill bidra till att ge andra systemutvecklare en lättare vardag. Just nu jobbar du kanske som systemutvecklare men vill switcha över till utveckling av just teknik- och utvecklingsplattformar. Eller så arbetar du redan med sådan utveckling.

Eller, så har du en bakgrund som sysadmin eller nätverksingenjör inom Linuxmiljöer, med en stark kunskap om Linuxplattformar, nätverk och infrastruktur. Du har tillämpat den kunskapen inom drift-och infrastruktur med just inriktning på teknik- och utvecklingsplattformar. Du förstår att infrastruktur måste anpassas för behoven inom systemutveckling.

Som person värdesätter du samarbete med andra framför isolerat arbete och du har lätt för att se andras utmaningar i sitt arbete. Du är en äkta team player. Du tar ansvar för dina uppgifter och har lätt för att strukturera ditt eget arbete. Du har en hög fackmässig kunskap inom området och underhåller din specialistkunskap genom ständig omvärldsbevakning och ett nyfiket sätt. Du har lätt för att lyfta blicken för att se helheten och möta andras behov.

I och med att vi jobbar i team, så behöver ingen person vara expert på alla våra ansvarsområden. Du bidrar med din expertis, och är följsam och intresserad av att lära dig från andra i deras expertis. Ingen enskild person kan allt, men tillsammans kan vi allt vi behöver.

Krav

 - Högskole- eller universitetsstudier inom datavetenskap, programvaruteknik, nätverksteknik eller datateknik med kandidat- eller masterexamen, eller motsvarande tidigare examen, eller annan relevant utbildningsbakgrund och yrkeserfarenhet
 - Minst 3 års yrkeserfarenhet inom IT-utveckling
 - Erfarenhet av containerplattformar (Kubernetes/Docker)
 - Du har god kommunikativ förmåga och kan uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
 - Då tjänsten kommer bli placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs även svenskt medborgarskap. Inför anställning kommer en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll genomföras

Meriter

 - Yrkeserfarenhet inom Linuxplattformar, nätverksteknik och infrastruktur
 - Yrkeserfarenhet av DevOps och agila metoder
 - Yrkeserfarenhet inom utveckling av mikrotjänster i en mikrotjänstarkitektur
 - Yrkeserfarenhet inom utveckling av plattformsprodukter och utvecklingsverktyg
 - Yrkeserfarenhet av Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment

Upplysningar
Anställningsform: Tillsvidare
Arbetstider: Kontorsarbetstider
Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning.
Placering: Flexibel ort bland Migrationsverkets orter, förtur kan dock komma att ges sökande som kan arbeta med Norrköping som placeringsort då resterande medarbetare i teamet finns där. Möjlighet till distansarbete finns enligt en hybridprincip.
Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse

Då tjänsten kommer bli placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs även svenskt medborgarskap. Inför anställning kommer en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll genomföras

Vill du veta mer
Vill du veta mer om den aktuella rollen och enheten finns kontaktuppgifter till ansvarig enhetschef längre ned.

Ansökan
Välkommen med dina ansökningshandlingar. Vi tar emot din ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem.

Migrationsverket finns för människor som söker skydd i Sverige och för dem som vill arbeta, studera eller bo här. Detta gör vi inom asylrättens och den reglerade invandringens gränser. Vi tar emot ansökningar, prövar dem och fattar beslut om vilka som har rätt att komma hit eller stanna här, och vilka som måste lämna landet.


I vårt arbete som statstjänstemän handlar vi i enlighet med fattade beslut och visar omdöme vid uttalanden och agerande. Det krävs en hög säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet hos oss och vi vägleds av den statliga värdegrunden och av mod, empati och tydlighet.


Vi använder urvalsfrågor i ansökningsförfarandet. Besvara dessa så utförligt du kan eftersom dina svar avgör om du är kvalificerad att gå vidare i rekryteringen eller inte. Vi använder också ofta tester för att vidare bedöma din skicklighet för den sökta tjänsten. Kallas du till intervju kan du behöva besvara frågor kopplat till säkerhet.


För oss är det viktigt att all kompetens på arbetsmarknaden tillvaratas. Vi välkomnar alla sökande och eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och mångfald.


Önskar du komma i kontakt med fackliga företrädare finns kontaktuppgifter till Saco-S, Seko och ST längst ned på vår Lediga jobb-sida på webben https://www.migrationsverket.se/Om-Migrationsverket/Jobba-hos-oss/Lediga-jobb.html

headline: DevOps Manager
description.text:
DevOps Manager
Location: Stockholm
Infor is one of the leading cloud ERP vendors in the world with 18 000 employees globally and 600+ employees in Sweden.
We have an exciting newly established position inhouse where we are looking for a hands-on DevOps Manager to lead a team of 8 skilled Engineers and Architects. If you are working in a similar type of role or are working as a Technical Lead and would like to move your career to the next step with more responsibility, then this might be the right position for you!
We can offer an exciting position in a company experiencing a lot of growth.
If you are currently not living in Stockholm, relocation will be a requirement.
This Manager role will also mean that you mentor, guide and help other engineers and act as a technical leader to manage the team and work towards the vision set for the product and organization.
We enjoy working on challenging problems and great solutions. We try, learn and iterate to deliver better results and improve our skills. Our team and organization values knowledge and contribution regardless of age, gender or number of years in experience. Everyone is welcome to help the team move forward and we encourage each other to do so.
We reward and recognize the employees based on results and engage with everyone to focus on the career that they want to build and have. We believe by using this approach we can bring individuals closer to their own goals and help them be most productive and satisfied at work.
Role Overview
We are looking for a DevOps Manager for the core microservices who would like to help us on our multi-cloud journey.
You will be working in a team consisting of highly driven and talented team members who are comfortable in working and collaborating both together and individually towards a team goal. You will also be working on the cutting edge solution for our future products and will be driving and owning parts of it.
In addition, you will also have the opportunity to learn the products from multiple angles and have the chance to work with multiple teams outside your organization. This will let you to both expand your knowledge horizontally and get a broad understanding of architecture as well as a deep technical knowledge of the solution you will be working on.
As a DevOps Manager in the team, you will be working on our containerized solution and help us building support containerization. You will be working with latest technologies run on multiple cloud platforms. Sounds exciting? Keep reading
Responsibilities
·      Provide direction (both technical and people-focused) for the team including full HR responsibility
·      Responsible for recruitment of new team members to the team when required
·      Build containerization and orchestration solution and architecture for multiple application and services
·      Analyze, develop and test orchestration solution on multiple platforms with on-premise and cloud solutions
·      Collaborate with others and deliver results in an agile team
·      Build automation for installation, provisioning and deployment of solution in multiple platforms
·      Help other developers in the team and projects
Requirements
·      Bachelor/Master of Computer Science or related field
·      5 years of experience with Python/Java/Go programming
·      5+ years of experience in DevOps area working with many different tools
·      Interested in building, testing and presenting solutions
·      2-3 years of experience with SaaS with one or more cloud providers AWS/Azure/GCP
·      1-2 years of experience with Docker and Kubernetes
·      Leadership skills either with previous direct reports or indirect leadership of teams and resources

Preferred Skills
· Background in Python development or similar is a merit
Infor values:
Our Guiding Principles set the standard for how we work with one another. They define who we are as an organization and guide everything we do. By applying the same shared values that unleash prosperity in free societies—such as value creation, integrity, responsibility, free speech, and toleration—we encourage one another to take initiative and to challenge the status quo.
We have a relentless commitment to a culture based on a business philosophy called Market Based Management® (MBM®). Informed by the principles that allow a free and open society to flourish, MBM® prepares individuals to innovate, improve, and transform while fostering a healthy, growing organization that creates long-term value for its clients and supporters and fulfillment for its employees.

headline: DevOps engineer
description.text:
About Elastisys
Elastisys provides cloud native solutions and managed services that empower our customers to run their applications and services in a scalable, resilient way in public or on-prem clouds. 
We are currently 35 full-time employees from 11 nations. We are marathon runners, vegans, devoted fathers and mothers, board and video game enthusiasts, coffee drinkers, pilots, black-belt wearers, dog walkers and quiet evening likers. Our 30 engineers cover the entire experience spectrum from juniors, to senior engineers with PhD degrees in cloud computing.
What we do
We develop and maintain our own open source Kubernetes distribution, Elastisys Compliant Kubernetes, that allows companies to be agile even in highly regulated environments, such as EdTech, FinTech and MedTech. Elastisys Compliant Kubernetes is also available as a Managed Service, where we operate the platform on selected cloud providers. In addition, we offer additional managed services such as PostgreSQL, Redis, and RabbitMQ.
We regularly work across most of the cloud native ecosystem and with projects and tools like:

Security and compliance tools such as Falco, Harbor and OPA
Observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and Opensearch
CI/CD tools such as ArgoCD
Programming, scripting, and templating languages such as go, bash, mustache, and yaml

Our managed service offering is growing and we are now looking for talented engineers to join our DevOps team.
Who we are looking for
As DevOps engineer you will work together with the team in developing Compliant Kubernetes, and operating it as a managed service, including being part of the on-call rotation. With Elastisys being a lean and agile company that works closely with its customers, you also have the opportunity to get rapid product feedback through technical account management and support.
MUST HAVEs:
Experience or willingness to learn cloud native technologies

Solid programming skills and strong systems understanding
Willingness to work in a team, caring about customers and other team members.

NICE TO HAVEs:
System administrator experience (*nix)
Experience with customer support or technical account management
Experience from contributing to open source projects
Experience with relational databases, message queues, and distributed caches
Experience with OpenStack and VMWare

At Elastisys we strive for an open and inclusive culture, where everybody's voice is heard. We work as a team and support each other, always aiming to better ourselves and our offerings. In addition to salary we offer stock options and a competitive pension scheme, wellness grant and a wellness hour each week plus the ability to study for certifications during working time. We strive for a healthy work/life balance and while we like to work together at the office, working remotely a few days a week is not a problem.
We are looking for both junior and senior engineers and attach great importance to equal opportunities for people of all genders and ethnicity. We have open positions at both the head office in Umeå and our office in Lund. Join us if you share our passion for working with cutting-edge technology and enable worry-free managed services!
Contact and questions:
Mark your application with “DevOps”. Recruitment is ongoing.
We welcome direct applications from applicants, but no solicitation from recruiters.
Questions? Feel free to reach out!
Öppen för alla
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Vårt erbjudande

ELITS kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.

Hos  får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med Openstack, Kubernetes, containertekniker och cloud native i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.

Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik



Som anställd på ELITS får du ett antal fördelar som:

- En trygg och säker anställning
- Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
- Friskvårdsbidrag
- Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
- Privat pensionsrådgivning
- Förmånsportal
- Extremt kompetenta och skickliga kollegor


Om rollen:

För långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser till våra kunder letar vi nu efter flera DevOps kollegor för att vara en del av vårt skickliga och snabbt växande Devops-team!

Som anställd på ELITS får du uppleva det bästa från två världar; delvis kundmiljöerna, men också ELITS som arbetsgivare där du är med och formar vår stora företagskultur och delar kunskap och erfarenheter med andra likasinnade.

Du kommer också att erbjudas utbildning, kompetensutveckling och certifieringar tillsammans med våra tekniska partners där vi arbetar tätt tillsammans med Redhat, Suse/Rancher, Hashicorp och Styra .

Våra konsultuppdrag innebär ofta att vi hjälper våra kunder i modernisera deras IT-miljöer, att hjälpa dem arbeta mer agilt och på ett modernt sätt med rätt typ av verktyg för att på bästa sätt stötta deras nuvarande och framtida behov. Detta gör vi enligt en metodik vi på ELITS kallar Journey to Agile.



För att passa in i rollen tror vi att du har erfarenhet av följande:

- Systemadministration i en Linux-baserad produktions-miljö
- Container-infrastruktur (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Scriptning/programmering i språk som Bash, Python, Go
- Versionshantering - Git
- Automatisering


Meriterande om du även har kunskap inom:

- IaC - Ansible, Terraform
- CI / CD
- Openstack
- Publika clouds
- Openshift och/eller Rancher
- Hashicorp: Vault, Consul, mfl




För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.

Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!

För denna position utförs även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.



Om du har frågor om rollen eller våra uppdrag, tveka inte att kontakta mig.

Peter.hallabro[at]elits.com

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
At Semcon, we believe that the one who understands the end-user best, will create the best solutions. Therefore for us, it’s always people first. Then technology.

Now we are looking for a DevOps Engineer with drive and warmth to join us. A person who thrive in a setting where a lot of things are going on. You will focus on facilitate coordination and collaboration among operations, development and testing functions.

You will be part of our growing Digital Services team and work together with kind and skilled individuals in challenging assignments and with exciting customers. In our division we all come from different areas of expertise and our ambition is to build a large team with skills ranging from digital strategy, project management and UX/service design to software development and emerging tech. We also have a long history of working with embedded software to create connected and smart products.

Want to learn more about our offerings and projects within the Digital Services area? Click here. (https://semcon.com/sv/digital-hubb/)

What you’ll do

- Support in-house teams and customers improving their SW development workflow and getting the most out of their CI/CD environment
- Bridge the gap and improve collaboration between operations, developers and testing functions
- Troubleshoot issues with tools, processes, applications and/or infrastructure
- Evaluate current development and operations procedures, recommend and implements tools and practices to increase efficiency and reliability
- Having fun!


We’ll look beyond your resume, but here is a starting point.

- Solid experience developing, testing and deploying software systems
- Previous experience from working with some of the tools that make a state-of-the-art CI/CD environment (e.g. Azure/AWS, Jenkins, Python, Ansible, Kubernetes, Docker, Linux, Gitlab, Bitbucket).
- Enjoy working with new technology
- Excellent knowledge of agile methods
- Great communication skills in Swedish and English.


We strongly believe that diversity of background, experience and perspectives is important to create excellent user experiences and to make Semcon a great place to work.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
DevOps Engineer

We are looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer with an enthusiastic mindset to join our Infrastructure and Security team. This team is the heart of Kivra and is building and supporting a large, scalable platform for all our services. 

What you'll do
You'll play a key role in Kivras Infrastructure and Security team, where you will work alongside great colleagues with automation of deployment pipelines, monitoring and alerting and regular system and network management among other things. You will develop and drive implementation of new tools in order to make our infrastructure more efficient as well as maintain and improve our current infrastructure. And always with a focus on the security and stability of our services!

Our infrastructure is based on

- Distributed systems, micro service architecture (Docker and Kubernetes)

- Automation and provisioning with Ansible and Terraform



- Web stack: Nginx, HAProxy, Google LB, Istio

- Monitoring and logging: Zabbix, Sentry, Pagerduty, Splunk

- Zookeeper, Kafka, Python, Erlang and some Java backend applications

- Self hosted hardware: HP, MikroTik, Supermicro, Cisco

- Database environment: Riak, PostgreSQL

- IAM: Google & MS AD



Required skills
Who you are and how you fit the team is super important. We thrive on being nice and helpful to each other and to the rest of the company!

But to have fun at Kivra you also need to have strong skills in Linux, Enterprise level IT system management and automation (e.g. Ansible/Terraform) paired with an equally strong sense of service. You have worked with DevOps and SRE for some years now and are therefore well versed in working in hybrid environments spanning from on prem to the cloud. And, to quote ourselves, “always with a focus on the security and stability of our services''

Desired skills
If you know network and firewall management that is really great. Database management is a huge plus as well as knowledge of web application management. And last but not least, a solid understanding of containers and container orchestration would make you an even stronger candidate.

We are looking for someone with a strong skill set and past experience within our tech stack. We have a very warm and friendly culture and we expect you to take part in that naturally. We thrive on collaboration and teamwork, we expect personal initiatives and love strong opinions based on facts.

We offer

Kivra offers a place in a committed team with the opportunity for a high degree of innovation. You will be involved in influencing Kivra's exciting business and product development of a service that is currently used by more than half of Sweden's population. One of Kivra's values is happy-happy, which is also reflected in the concern for Kivra's staff. In addition to collective agreements and wellness, we offer a number of other great benefits.



Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We are looking for someone who is educated in or has experience of working with DevOps to join our team of consultants, delivering software, architectures, and models for organizations in transformation.

As a DevOps consultant with us, you will be helping our customers streamlining their development processes to reduce lead time while increasing demands on quality and delivery precision. You get to work with the entire chain (CI/CD), everything from development, automation, integration, build systems, repositories, and delivery as well as operational frameworks. Our assignments often involve modern API-based solutions and the security field (IAM, IdM).
You are the one who sets up, configures, and administers the infrastructure in (typically) cloud environments as well as monitoring availability and performance. Security is always in focus in combination with building sustainable solutions that are easy to maintain.
Our customers are both national as well as international, with a wide range of projects and lots of new technology. Together with other developers, tech leads and managers, you work in close collaboration with our customers to help them find the best possible solution for their needs.
We want you to contribute to developing our business, both for customers and with our offers. In this work you have the support from our competence teams and our CTO on strategic issues.
Qualifications
We believe that you are educated in and/or has experience of working with DevOps. If you have experience from tools and techniques such as Azure DevOps, AWS (CloudWatch CloudFormation, etc), databases (SQL, NoSQL, big data), Kubernetes, Ansible, and Jenkins. AWS or Azure certification is not required but seen as a merit. We are fully aware that there are few people who have all this on their resume so let us know what you can do!
You can break down complex problems into manageable parts and communicate this at both business and technical level. You take pride in the craftsmanship around software development. We believe that you are committed and have a strong sense of responsibility. You can have technical depth and expertise in the area, or you have broad knowledge and practical experience of the change management work that CI / CD adaptations require.
You are a team player with a willingness to share solutions, insights, and trends with others in the organization. We believe that you can adapt the way you communicate depending on the situation.
As a consultant, your contact area is wide, and it is important to navigate between different stakeholders. We value curiosity and it is important that you have the ambition to be at the forefront of technology and methodology development.

What we offer
We work in an open and unpretentious organization with good sense of community. Our keywords are cooperation, communication, and quick feedback.
Our customers appreciate our deep technical competence, flexibility, and integrity. We offer individual competency development and a networking organization.
Of course, we want to have fun at work. Community and cohesion are important and contributes to creating a good work-life balance.
We have flexible working hours with the opportunity for telework and many benefits such as union collective agreements, wellness grants and subsidized massage.
About Ductus
Data Ductus is a modern, flexible company that offers high-quality IT services for large and medium-sized companies and organizations. We work closely with our customers and build long-term relationships where our service areas are business development, system development, system integration and operation, management & support.
Additional Information
Location: Flexible. We would like you to live in one of the places in Sweden where we have our larger offices, such as Malmö, Skellefteå or Uppsala / Stockholm.
Working hours: Full time.
Start time: By agreement.
Other: Travel occurs. Mainly in Europe but also the rest of the world.
Questions

Application
Welcome with your application via www.dataductus.com/careers. Selection is ongoing.
We only accept applications via our website.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real-time and at a high scale.
We are now looking for a talented Senior DevOps Engineer that wants to participate in building our success story.
At our office, located in the center of Stockholm. We promote self-organizing cross-functional teams, a flat hierarchy and flexible working hours to give all our employees a good work/life balance. Because of our large customer base, each with a different set of requirements, there is always a new challenge and you will most certainly find projects that align with your passions.
What you'll do
Perform daily operations for all our hosted solutions

Design, build and maintain DevOps specific tools


Maintain and manage CI/CD pipelines

Proactively work with life cycle management and outage prevention
Serve, Educate, and share knowledge with our local and distributed development teams so they can own their infra and code changes

What you'll bring
Have proven DevOps experience
Have ability to code, test, build, deploy, etc.
A solid experience in terms of building and running scalable solutions in the Cloud. (Kubernetes expertise and AWS)
Have experience and worked with related tools, ie Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform, Helm, Jenkins, DataDog, Jira, Confluence
Have set up and operated services by measuring and monitoring availability and performance
A team player mindset, comfortable with collaboration, open communication and reaching across the functional borders

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
WHY WE WILL LOVE YOU
We at Ingka Group believe you share the IKEA values and that you are passionate about our vision in becoming the world’s leading multichannel home furnishing retailer. We believe you have a great understanding of what simplicity and togetherness means. As a person you have the curiosity and clear understanding of how we would like to automate as well as integrate our deployment pipeline with a “getting things done” mentality. Together we will research, evaluate, develop and deploy new applications and work on ways to quickly identify and overcome any blockers we might encounter along the way.


You are driven by renewing and improving by continuously integrating and delivering in a fast-paced and challenging environment.


We believe you are experienced in:
Public clouds like GCP and Azure

Infrastructure automation using IaC
CI/CD



A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US
We trust your knowledge and experience when it comes to DevOps ways of working, that’s why you will have the space to take responsibility for the tools and methods we use for our continuous delivery. We guide, advice and consult teams towards a modern, efficient & safe agile delivery model.


When you spot an opportunity to innovate, we at IKEA encourage you to do so. Feel free to test new solutions, creative suggestions or bringing aboard new technologies to boost the everyday life for all our co-workers and customers. And by working closely with your fellow engineers.
In our chapter we share our knowledge and coach each other when it comes to functional expertise. We will grow together towards a data-informed organisation by connecting across multiple initiatives within the Ingka Group.


TOGETHER AS A TEAM
We’re the ones who make it possible for people to have a smarter life at home and a hassle-free and rewarding shopping experience. Together we work to find new digital solutions for every business need to help make IKEA a great and efficient place to work. We like to think of ourselves as innovative and modern, and we believe that nothing would actually work without us.
As personal and professional growth is important, we encourage curiosity. Together we will discover new things, step into the unknown and make sure we are always trying out new ways.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Oneflow is a rapidly growing tech startup located in the heart of Stockholm. We have created a platform that automates the entire contract process from start to finish, all in one place. Turning clunky, static contracts into helpful, smart contracts. Processes are faster, decisions are better, and deals are quicker. It’s an easier, smoother, and smarter way for teams of all shapes and sizes to handle their contracts - just like magic. Come and work wonders with us!
We are now looking for a new DevOps Engineer. If you are dedicated and like to work in a collaborative environment, where we make progress together, both when it comes to our product and our growth as individuals, this is something for you! We are currently 120+ people representing 22 nationalities. We believe our diversity, both when it comes to our different backgrounds and our gender equality, is a strength in our organisation.

You will be working with the Oneflow Platform Team, who continuously scale, secure and improve our infrastructure, which enables our developers to make several deployments each day. We have multiple self-organizing teams that you will support by improving the core infrastructure across the entire platform. We want our developers to feel a strong sense of ownership and that their work really matters. We also want them to be involved in all steps of product development, from feature planning to release.
What's in it for you?
You get to work with modern technologies with very low amounts of technical debt. We have embraced containerization, cloud services and modern development methodologies and we know that making our developers happy will make our customers happy. You will get to define, set up, configure and maintain an infrastructure of products and services used by thousands of companies every day together with experienced colleagues. We value security, stability, redundancy and uptime, and you will absolutely feel that what you do matters.
Who you are
As a DevOps Engineer at Oneflow, you have an interest in distributed systems and their scalability. You think of encryption, "defense in depth" concepts and the privacy of our customers data. You will be working with infrastructure development and will both improve existing flows and create new ones as our platform evolves. We see that you have at least a few years of experience working with cloud infrastructure, container orchestration, encryption and information security.
Your background:
Having worked a few years with cloud infrastructure and container orchestration
Experience working with tools such as Terraform and cloud platforms
You have created and maintained Kubernetes clusters, both locally and through cloud offerings such as EKS or GKE
You are familiar with CI/CD pipelines and like to optimize deployment processes

Comfortable securing high volumes of data

Technologies and concepts to work with:
Kubernetes and Docker
AWS
Terraform (or similar)
CI/CD
Distributed logging, tracing and monitoring
Docker and containerization in general
KMS / HSM

We also value if you have an interest in any of these areas:
Performance and scalability of distributed systems
MySQL / Elasticsearch / RabbitMQ
An understanding of SaaS product development

Come work with us
We value gender equality and diversity in our organisation and strive for a team that reflects the diversity in today's society. At Oneflow we encourage and welcome applicants who are people of colour, LGBTQ+, people with disabilities and those without college degrees. We follow a competence based recruitment process. If you feel the above description seems like a good fit for you - we would love to hear from you! Get in touch to start a journey you won’t forget!

Apply by submitting your resume and a personal letter telling us more about why the role is interesting and why you would be a good fit. We will get back to you as soon as possible!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
As our new DevOps Engineer you will be part of the software development team at Cepheid, a growing Diagnostics company located in Solna, Stockholm. You will be part of the team responsible for supporting and maintaining Cepheid’s C360 connected platform in AWS cloud.
Cepheid C360 is a cloud based software platform providing administrative and analytics support for Cepheid’s GeneXpert product family.

Responsible for deployment and maintenance of the product in AWS cloud. Drive automation of build and deployment process. Provide documentation including, but not limited to support and maintenance plan, IQ protocols and reports, backup and recovery policy, upgrade plans.
Responsibility includes interacting with cross-functional stakeholders from SQA, Marketing, Service and support organizations, and project/program managers during the development and delivery of the product. Perform duties as an individual contributor and/or team member with 100% hands-on work
Knowledge and skills:
 A minimum of 3 years professional experience as DevOps Engineer.
 Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), EC2, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, Aurora, S3, SES, etc.
 Experience with container technology (Docker or similar) and container orchestration (Fargate ECS, EKS or Kubernetes)
 Automation tools (Jenkins, GitLab, etc.)
 Experience with build and deployment pipelines, CI/CD.

 Experience with systems administration and IT operations (networks, cyber security, etc.)
 Experience with databases.
 Comfortable in using a wide variety of open source technologies and tools.
 Ability to be self-motivated, proactive, curious, accountable and flexible.
Minimum qualifications:
 Bachelor’s degree with 6+ years of related work experience or Master’s degree in field with 5+ years of related work experience

headline: DevOps Engineers
description.text:
Vårt erbjudande

ELITS kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.

Hos  får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med Openstack, Kubernetes, containertekniker och cloud native i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.

Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik



Som anställd på ELITS får du ett antal fördelar som:

- En trygg och säker anställning
- Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
- Friskvårdsbidrag
- Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
- Privat pensionsrådgivning
- Förmånsportal
- Extremt kompetenta och skickliga kollegor


Om rollen:

För långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser till våra kunder letar vi nu efter flera DevOps kollegor för att vara en del av vårt skickliga och snabbt växande Devops-team!

Som anställd på ELITS får du uppleva det bästa från två världar; delvis kundmiljöerna, men också ELITS som arbetsgivare där du är med och formar vår stora företagskultur och delar kunskap och erfarenheter med andra likasinnade.

Du kommer också att erbjudas utbildning, kompetensutveckling och certifieringar tillsammans med våra tekniska partners där vi arbetar tätt tillsammans med Redhat, Suse/Rancher, Hashicorp och Styra .

Våra konsultuppdrag innebär ofta att vi hjälper våra kunder i modernisera deras IT-miljöer, att hjälpa dem arbeta mer agilt och på ett modernt sätt med rätt typ av verktyg för att på bästa sätt stötta deras nuvarande och framtida behov. Detta gör vi enligt en metodik vi på ELITS kallar Journey to Agile.



För att passa in i rollen tror vi att du har erfarenhet av följande:

- Systemadministration i en Linux-baserad produktions-miljö
- Container-infrastruktur (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Scriptning/programmering i språk som Bash, Python, Go
- Versionshantering - Git
- Automatisering


Meriterande om du även har kunskap inom:

- IaC - Ansible, Terraform
- CI / CD
- Openstack
- Publika clouds
- Openshift och/eller Rancher
- Hashicorp: Vault, Consul, mfl




För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.

Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!

För denna position utförs även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.



Om du har frågor om rollen eller våra uppdrag, tveka inte att kontakta mig på det sätt som passar dig bäst, chatta, maila eller ring!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Schibsted Enterprise Technology is the IT division within Schibsted, with offices in Stockholm, Oslo and Krakow. Our philosophy is to move IT one step forward and provide Schibsted with global, scalable and high available services that empower our colleagues.

In E-Tech Collaboration team we create and maintain systems to enable all the organisations to Collaborate. We provide tools, training and support to ensure everyone can share and communicate with colleagues in different locations.

We run our services in AWS and we apply CI/CD mechanisms.

We strongly believe in continuous improvement of always-on systems so we relentlessly work to achieve near complete resiliency of everything we do. This means no actual user downtime and seamless infrastructure and service upgrades as well as being proactive to issues. So come join our DevOps team to be at the forefront of active systems engineering and development!

Responsibilities:

 -
As part of the technology area within the E-Tech group you will advise this group as to which technology stacks / cloud / big data solutions to use

 -
Automating the operations and production of large-scale distributed systems so no manual intervention is needed eventually

 -
Help develop a state of the art platform as a service solution using the latest and greatest technologies and approaches (e.g. Mesos, Docker, Microservices, etc)

 -
Help develop the best possible continuous delivery pipelines supporting features like automated promotion to production, automated canary releasing or blue green deployments

 -
Work closely with the engineering organisation making sure that they follow the infrastructure guidelines that you set, and help them make design / reliability trade offs and implement systems that fail over gracefully and transparently to clients

 -
Implement monitoring and logging solutions that enables the production systems to be monitored 24/7

 -
Respond to requests from engineering by building self-service solutions. Make sure that any tech solution that you put in place is robust, will scale, and failover / BCP systems are in place

 -
Install, configure, fine-tune, and optimise technology solutions


Requirements:

 -
A BSc (or equivalent) degree in computer science

 -
AWS expertise

 -


 -


 -


 -


 -
Experience in designing and building systems that scale

 -
Experience with modern continuous deployment tools like Jenkins, Git, Puppet, Chef


We offer you:

 -


 -
Amazing colleagues

 -
A global role

 -
Plenty of challenges and opportunities

 -
Personal development plan




Schibsted is a family of digital brands with a strong Nordic position, and more than 5,000 employees. Millions of people interact with our companies every day through our leading online marketplaces, world-class media houses. We also help new promising businesses grow. Our joint mission of empowering people in their daily lives is rooted in the values of our media heritage and a legacy of bold change. At our best, we are a fearless force for change in a society built on trust and transparency.

Schibsted Enterprise Technology – or “E-Tech” as we’re called – is the internal IT company within Schibsted.
