headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Come work with us at GOALS!

We have just started building our dream game and are looking for a DevOps Engineer. We have a genuine ambition to make something that is more than a game. In the GOALS universe games exist both on and off screen, blending football, fashion, esports and digital assets.

Focus Areas
As a DevOps Engineer you will help us with the infrastructure and workflow for how we build, deploy and manage our game tech development. Together with stakeholders, you will provide the core infrastructure, tools and necessary support to enable the development team. You are not only expected to maintain the environment but we want you to continuously improve it.

We think you have some years of experience as a DevOps- or Build Engineer and that you like collaboration and giving support. We expect you to know the state of the art but we also want you to challenge existing best practices and you love to find improvements to processes and automate things in general.

Qualifications


- Plastic SCM, Perforce, Git or equivalent experience.
- Experience with at least one scripting language and one programming language.
- Monitoring tools such as DataDog, Grafana, etc.
- Kubernetes
- Have worked with at least one cloud provider and have experience with deploying servers off-site.
- Self-motivated, strong work ethic, able to work independently




It would be a bonus if you also have experience in

- Game development
- Unreal Engine
- Writing bots for Discord
- Steamworks


About the Employment

You can work from our Stockholm office, fully remote or hybrid. 



GOALS is all about dreams coming true! We are willing to take chances. Apply anyways!

Pass your application by submitting your profile.

_______________________________________________

Our values

At GOALS we empower people, from our team to our community. We empower the game creators. As part of the team your enthusiasm, creativity and voice matter and is reflected in this extraordinary game. We empower diversity. We believe in a space where we drive for change and equality together, throughout our organization, game and industry. We empower flexibility. As an inclusive and international company, we welcome remote work and flexible work hours.

About the Studio

GOALS is a small start-up with big dreams!

Not humble in our objective; creating the best football game in the world.

Recognizing there wasn’t a fast paced, competitive, multiplayer focused football game on the market we decided to change that. Let’s bring football into esports for real! Bridging the gap between the real world and the digital, we’re building something that is more than a game.

Our community is the most important voice, and we want to give every colleague and gamer a feeling of ownership.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
As our new DevOps Engineer you will be part of the software development team at Cepheid, a growing Diagnostics company located in Solna, Stockholm.
You will be responsible for supporting and maintaining Cepheid’s C360 connected platform in AWS cloud. Cepheid C360 is a cloud based software platform providing administrative and analytics support for Cepheid’s GeneXpert product family.
It is important that you appreciate a fast-paced environment and that you have strong interpersonal and communicative skills to succeed in this role.

Responsible for deployment and maintenance of the product in AWS cloud.
Drive automation of build and deployment process.
Provides documentation including, but not limited to support and maintenance plan, IQ protocols and reports, backup and recovery policy, upgrade plans.
Responsibility includes interacting with cross-functional stakeholders from SQA, Marketing, Service and support organizations, and project/program managers during the development and delivery of the product.
Perform duties as an individual contributor and/or team member with 100% hands-on work



Knowledge and skills:
A minimum of 3 years professional experience as DevOps Engineer.
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS), EC2, CloudFormation, CloudWatch, Aurora, S3, SES, etc.
Experience with container technology (Docker or similar) and container orchestration (Fargate ECS, EKS or Kubernetes)
Automation tools (Jenkins, GitLab, etc.)
Experience with build and deployment pipelines, CI/CD.

Experience with systems administration and IT operations (networks, cyber security, etc.)
Experience with databases.
Comfortable in using a wide variety of open source technologies and tools.
Experience from Agile/Scrum/Kanban team work
Ability to be self-motivated, proactive, curious, accountable and flexible.



Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree with 6+ years of related work experience or Master’s degree in field with 5+ years of related work experience.



When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.
At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

headline: DevOps tekniker
description.text:
Tekniker till DevOps-team
Ett av CGIs egenutvecklade system som vi är väldigt stolta över är Heroma. Heroma är ett komplett personalsystem med kunder inom hela Sveriges offentliga sektor.
Heroma levererar tjänster via en IT-plattform som möter användarna via appar, moderna webbklienter i en arkitektur baserat på Microsoft .NET. Dataarkitekturen bygger på antingen MS SQL server eller IBM DB/2.
Just nu söker vi en tekniker till Heromas utvecklingsavdelning. Vi söker dig som vill göra skillnad och utvecklas med kollegor så att du får ut det bästa av din potential.
Om tjänsten
Du kommer att vara en del av vårt DevOps-team som stöttar utvecklings- och supportteamen och arbetar med förbättring av vår nuvarande plattform. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår uppsättning och underhåll av testmiljöer, implementation av utvecklingsverktyg, infrastruktur och Configuration Management. Det ingår också att hantera larm och incidenter.
För denna roll söker vi dig som är lösningsorienterad och förstår vikten av delat ansvar mellan drift och utveckling samt kunna hantera lösningar i ett större perspektiv.
Du kommer arbeta med att minska manuellt arbete kring underhåll av miljöer genom att automatisera och införa självservicefunktioner. Du kommer medverka i att skapa förutsättningar och ökad säkerhet vid utveckling, Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery (DevSecOps).
Vi jobbar agilt och fokuserar mycket på kunskapsspridning, designa och implementera förbättringar både i produkten och i vårt arbetssätt.
Det förekommer tjänsteresor inom Sverige i rollen.
Vem är du?
Vi söker dig som har god kunskap inom nätverk och vSphere. Du har erfarenhet av installation och drift av Windows Server OS 2016/2019 och SQL server 2016/2019 samt har erfarenhet av scriptspråk och har förståelse för att bygga infrastruktur med kod (Infrastructure as Code).
Om du dessutom har erfarenhet av följande är det meriterande:
Container-teknologi

Citrix
Active Directory
ADFS
Group Policy
Vetskap om att jobba i en miljö med hög säkerhet
Kerberos

För att lyckas i rollen som tekniker i vårt DevOps-team behöver du vara en nyfiken och lösningsorienterad lagspelare. Du är strukturerad och driven som person och har ett genuint intresse för teknik och trivs när du får ta ansvar och lösa utmaningar inom ditt område.
Du känner dig bekväm i rollen, där du förväntas delta aktivt i möten, pedagogiskt förklara tekniska utmaningar och ta till dig av andras erfarenhet. Du är duktig på att kommunicera och har goda kunskaper i såväl svenska som engelska, både i tal och i skrift.
Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av liknande arbete. Vidare pratar du flytande svenska och behärskar engelska i tal och skrift. Personliga säkerhetskrav kan komma att krävas för vissa av våra leveranser.
Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?
CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
Mer information om våra förmåner
Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 3 000 kr.
Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.

Vill du veta mer?
Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Sista ansökningsdatum är 2021-10-22. 
Vi jobbar löpande mer urval och tillsätter tjänsten så snart vi hittar rätt kandidat, skicka därför gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
CGI
CGI leder digitaliseringen av Sverige och är världsledande på att omvandla innovation, information och teknologi. Genom djup branschkunskap och en förståelse för kundens utmaningar, bidrar vi med insikter för att skapa hållbara resultat. Vi finns i 40 länder med 80 000 medarbetare. I Sverige finns våra 4000 anställda på 30 orter med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to strengthen our DevOps team and bring next-generation tools and practices to game development and online game services. You will be working with some of the latest technologies and methodologies to design, implement, and maintain the game's tools, systems, and services; achieving a true always-online platform with minimum interruptions.

As a studio we offer you the opportunity to explore new territory in the realm of online gaming, starting with our first game Bloodhunt. We are looking for people who want to have fun at work, share ownership, and make smart decisions; responsible people who have a positive attitude, are passionate, and value professionalism.


- Comfortable working independently in Python or any major language.
- Proficiency with containerization and cluster management technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.

- Ability to build tools to monitor & alert high performance and low latency applications.
- Technical skills in scaling application management, SQL, CDN technologies, network analysis tools, and distributed systems will be crucial to success in identifying production issues.
- Enthusiastic for new technologies and growth.
- A true collaborative spirit - making sure communication works efficiently between disciplines.


You don't need to be a gamer to join us, but we consider it a bonus (and hopefully, you do too)!

This is a permanent position based in Malmö, Sweden, and is open to all applicants intending to relocate as soon as possible.

Who we are
Sharkmob was founded in 2017 and has offices in Malmö, Sweden and London, UK. 

We hope that you want to join us on our adventure and become a part of our crew. You can find more great perks of being a crew member  here. (https://career.sharkmob.com/pages/perks) If you want to know more about Sharkmob and our projects, take a look at our  homepage (https://www.sharkmob.com/).

headline: DevOps Engineers
description.text:
Vårt erbjudande

ELITS kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.

Hos  får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med Openstack, Kubernetes, containertekniker och cloud native i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.

Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik



Som anställd på ELITS får du ett antal fördelar som:

- En trygg och säker anställning
- Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
- Friskvårdsbidrag
- Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
- Privat pensionsrådgivning
- Förmånsportal
- Extremt kompetenta och skickliga kollegor


Om rollen:

För långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser till våra kunder letar vi nu efter flera DevOps kollegor för att vara en del av vårt skickliga och snabbt växande Devops-team!

Som anställd på ELITS får du upplevaia av det bästa från två världar; delvis kundmiljöerna, men också ELITS som arbetsgivare där du är med och formar vår stora företagskultur och delar kunskap och erfarenheter med andra likasinnade.

Du kommer också att erbjudas utbildning, kompetensutveckling och certifieringar tillsammans med våra tekniska partners där vi arbetar tätt tillsammans med Redhat, Suse/Rancher, Hashicorp och Styra .

Våra konsultuppdrag innebär ofta att vi hjälper våra kunder i modernisera deras IT-miljöer, att hjälpa dem arbeta mer agilt och på ett modernt sätt med rätt typ av verktyg för att på bästa sätt stötta deras nuvarande och framtida behov. Detta gör vi enligt en metodik vi på ELITS kallar Journey to Agile.



För att passa in i rollen tror vi att du har erfarenhet av följande:

- Systemadministration i en Linux-baserad produktions-miljö
- Container-infrastruktur (Docker, Kubernetes)
- Scriptning/programmering i språk som Bash, Python, Go
- Versionshantering - Git
- Automatisering


Meriterande om du även har kunskap inom:

- IaC - Ansible, Terraform
- CI / CD
- Openstack
- Publika clouds
- Openshift och/eller Rancher
- Hasicorp: Vault, Consul, mfl




För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.

Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!

För denna position utförs även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.



Om du har frågor om rollen eller våra uppdrag, tveka inte att kontakta mig på det sätt som passar dig bäst, chatta, maila eller ring!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Who are we?
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission; to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future.
Since 1927, we have been a brand known for our commitment to safety, creating innovative cars that make life less complicated for our consumers. In 2010, we decided to transform our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technologies, as well as steady growth and record sales. 
We are constantly pushing our own skills and abilities to drive change in the automobile industry like never before. We are looking for innovative, committed people to join us in this endeavour and create safe, sustainable and connected cars. We believe in the power of people and will challenge and support you to reach your full potential. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars’ journey into the future.

What’s in it for you?
You are a hands-on developer with programming and devops experience. You are comfortable with agile development and a champion of software development best practices.

You're going to join our devops engineering team and support large groups of developers in other product teams by improving the developer experience of working on our platform. You will gather feedback from teams on areas of improvements but also be able to independently identify projects with a large impact.

You're going to be the hero who saves thousand of minutes in time by automating a process that is being done over and over manually or by making the CI/CD run a couple of seconds faster.

You and your skills
You have strong knowledge and deep understanding of git. Experience in Microsoft Azure infrastructure. We are looking for someone with a software developer background with experience in writing code in javascript/typescript mainly for Node.js. Experience and interest in DevOps and Infrastructure as code. You have experience working with Kubernetes or Docker. Experience in building CI/CD pipelines (ArgoCD, Jsonnet). 

Optional qualifications
Familiarity with other cloud service providers like AWS and GCP. Familiarity with Package management (mainly npm).

Contact & Application
Please apply via the link provided by the 3rd of December, 2021.Applications and CVs will not be accepted via email.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We are looking to expand our client's platform team with a DevOps Engineer.
Dedicated to continuous improvement, they explore emerging technologies such as quantum computing, AI and big data analytics.
Right now, they are looking for a dedicated DevOps engineer with a customer focus. A natural team player with an interest in infrastructure automation, continuous integration and containers.
Responsibilities include:
•	Develop and provide easy instantiation and deployment environment for their products
•	Handling any problems or challenges collaboratively
•	Be active in the team evolvement
About the DevOps role
This role gives you the responsibility to develop and maintain environments and processes that enable continuous integration for other teams to employ. Soon, the company will move towards containerised deployments that would work in “cloud-like” ways.
Product quality is at the core of the organisation, where build-environment, tests and CI/CD in combination with a DevOps mindset is a crucial part for success in their journey from on-premises solutions towards SaaS solutions. 
About you

We believe you have an analytical approach to problem solving, strong communication skills and an interest in technology as well as human relations. A good understanding and experience of agile methodology is highly valued.
As a person you are driven, committed, have a positive attitude and are comfortable with continuous team growth. You will have great opportunities to influence, learn and grow as a software developer and individual. 
Qualifications:
•	Bachelor of Science or Master of Science in computing engineering or equivalent
•	3+ years of experience in the IT industry
•	Experience and clear interest in DevOps




•	Experience and understanding in using agile methodology

At the company’s office in central Gothenburg, Sweden, you will be joining a team of talented, creative and dedicated colleagues. Here, you have the chance to broaden your horizon by working alongside 400 professionals from over 30 different countries. You will have the chance to travel and collaborate with clients across the world.

Please press the Apply button at the top right corner of the page. We consider candidates on a rolling basis, which means the role might be filled before the application deadline.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Till vårt Common Infrateam på IT söker vi en ny medarbetare med erfarenhet av DevOps, Azure och som har ett genuint intresse för infrastruktur som kod.



OM ROLLEN

I rollen som Devops engineer hos oss får du vara med att bygga och sätta upp utvecklingsverktyg och infrastruktur på ett automatiserat och strukturerat sätt.

Du kommer arbeta med att automatisera och förbättra utvecklings- och release-processer samt arbeta hjälpa våra olika team med processer kring DevOps.

Du blir en viktig medarbetare då du samarbetar med kollegor från olika avdelningar inom banken för att säkerställa att utvecklingen följer etablerade processer och ”best practice”.

Samarbetet med andra kollegor kommer även innebära att du förstår behoven som är relaterade till utvecklingsprocessen och kan förmedla tips till våra utvecklare. En del av arbetet är att testa och undersöka delmängd av kod som skrivits av andra och kvalitetssäkra den innan driftsättning.

En annan viktig arbetsuppgift är att säkerställa att systemen är säkra mot cybersäkerhetshot och att bankens system uppfyller regulatoriska krav och standarder.

Som DevOps engineer ingår du i ett centralt team som tillhandahåller och förvaltar centrala tjänster och som stöttar andra team med säkerhet och infrastruktur i Azure.



VEM ÄR DU?

För att trivas och lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en god samarbetsförmåga då du kommer samarbeta och ge tips till bankens många och kunniga utvecklare.

Vi tror att du som söker:

- Har erfarenhet av DevOps
- Har erfarenhet av infrastruktur som kod, gärna Terraform
- Programmerings eller skriptkunskaper
- Erfarenhet av AKS eller annan Kubernetes
- Gillar att ständigt lära dig nya saker.
- Förmåga att felsöka och hitta lösningar på problem




OM COLLECTOR BANK OCH VAD VI KAN ERBJUDA DIG

Collector är en digital nischbank som utvecklar finansiella tjänster för privat- och företagskunder. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att skapa smarta, digitala lösningar som förenklar våra kunders vardag. För privatpersoner erbjuder vi sparande, lån, kreditkort och appar. För företag erbjuder vi lån, factoringtjänster samt betallösningar för e-handel och butik. Collector Bank är ett entreprenörsdrivet teknikföretag som brinner för att förverkliga idéer - både våra egna och andras.

Våra kontor finns i Göteborg (huvudkontor), Stockholm, Helsingfors och Oslo. Koncernens moderbolag Collector AB (publ) är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm. Koncernspråket är svenska och all dokumentation sker på svenska.

Som medarbetare hos oss blir du en del av vår starka företagskultur, som kan beskrivas utifrån våra värdeord Entreprenörskap, Engagemang och Etik. Vi präglas av öppenhet kring nya idéer, innovation, engagerade människor som drivs av att få saker att hända, tänker stort och utmanar sig själva varje dag.

Känner du att det passar in på hur du skulle vilja ha det på din arbetsplats tror vi att du kommer att trivas bra tillsammans med oss!



INTRESSERAD?

Kul!

Ansök redan nu så hör vi av oss! Urval och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande.

Har du frågor eller vill veta mer?





Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real time and at high scale.

*What you'll do*

 - Perform daily operations for all our hosted solutions

 - Design, build and maintain DevOps specific tools
 - Be responsible for maintaining and develop the company’s established frameworks (test, deploy, build, etc)


 - Maintain and manage CI/CD pipelines

 - Proactively work with life cycle management and outage prevention

*What you'll bring*

 - Have proven DevOps experience (2-5years)
 - Have ability to code, test, build, deploy, etc.
 - Have experience and are knowledgeable in AWS infrastructure

 - Have set up and operated services by measuring and monitoring availability and performance

 - Have excellent verbal and written communication skills
 - Have experience in writing software in one or more languages such as Python and NodeJS
 - Always think about Security when building or running solutions




DigitalRoute has the only platform that is purpose built to convert raw usage data into billable items. This enables companies to capitalize on the growing wave of usage-based business models. More than 400 companies rely on our platform for usage-based monetization, quote-to-cash automation, finance system consolidation and telecom mediation. We deliver extreme precision in the most complex environments in the world. We’re the new standard for usage-based revenue.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Gpsgate

We build vehicle tracking software that powers fleet management businesses around the world. We help fleet owners improve fleet efficiency, keep drivers safe, and reduce their environmental impact. Our goals: end users love GpsGate, our resellers grow their businesses, and we have fun doing it.


We are looking for a DevOps Engineer with previous experience in a leading DevOps role. You will work closely with our lead engineers to build, manage and automate our AWS infrastructure. You have technical depth and hands-on implementation experience from tools in the DevOps toolchain.

At GpsGate, you’ll join a growing team that is full of energy. We emphasize knowledge-sharing and teamwork, so you get to work closely with your talented colleagues.

What you'll do
-  Design and manage a cloud infrastructure for GpsGate Server that is secure, scalable, and highly available on AWS
- Work collaboratively with our architects to define infrastructure and deployment requirements
- Provision, configure and maintain AWS cloud infrastructure defined as code
- Troubleshoot problems across a wide array of services and functional areas
- Build and maintain operational tools for deployment and monitoring
- Perform cost analysis and optimization of AWS resources
- Implement CI/CD workflows in AWS
- Work with a broad range of AWS services such as MSK, Keyspaces, Aurora, ECS Fargate, S3, Lambda, EC2 and many more


Who you are
You take pride in your work. You enjoy working closely with colleagues and the fast pace that comes with a smaller company. You’re eager to take on a leading role defining our cloud infrastructure.

We’re looking for a DevOps engineer with:

- Experience automating cloud native technologies, deploying applications, and provisioning infrastructure
- Containerizing existing and new applications and services
- Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code, using CloudFormation/CDK
- Experience developing cloud native CI/CD workflows using tools like AWS CodePipeline
- Hands-on experience with microservices and distributed applications
- Experience in VPC designs and architecture



Requirements
- At least 3-5 years of experience building and maintaining AWS services
- Bachelor’s or master’s degree within Computer Science or related field



Why GpsGate
At GpsGate, you have real impact. Our software helps companies worldwide in their day-to-day business managing deliveries, cutting fuel emissions, ensuring the safety of their staff, and much more.

- Have the freedom to try out new things, find smarter ways to work with your team, and identify innovative solutions
- Join a diverse team with multinational colleagues
- Grow as a DevOps specialist in an expanding company


And of course, we also have great benefits:

- Competitive salary
- Flexible work policy
- 30 days paid vacation
- Annual company conference and local office outings
- Friskvårdsbidrag/ health & fitness allowance
- Private health insurance
- ITP (pension retirement savings)

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Assessio is one of the Nordic countries largest talent assessment suppliers, and we provide our digital services through a number of SaaS assessment and development platforms.
We have around 100 dedicated employees in Sweden, Norway and the Netherlands, all of whom are united under our shared vision of Zero Talent Waste. We strive to contribute to an effective and fair working life where everyone is judged on equal, relevant terms. Our digital products and solutions help our clients to make effective, fair and transparent people decisions in recruitment and development processes.

As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Assessio you’ll be part of a growing team building cloud infrastructure and tooling for our next generation products and platform. Your main responsibilities will be centred around building, maintaining and monitoring the cloud infrastructure for our SaaS platforms, primarily through the application of infrastructure-as-code within a cloud native environment. You will also be a major factor in ensuring the tooling and methods used provide operational excellence of the running systems.
Together with the rest of the engineering and platform teams, you will have the opportunity to work with modern technologies and toolsets to develop best-in-class cloud-native applications and have an influence on large parts of the technical infrastructure and architecture for those systems.
Assessio’s Engineering team comprises individuals with a broad range of cultural backgrounds and a combination of both on-site and remote team members. Your contribution will be essential to both the team and the business success of the Assessio group. We are thus looking for a team player with a strong sense of commitment and responsibility.

·      Build, test and maintain our SaaS cloud platform, primarily through infrastructure-as-code – Kubernetes, Helm, Containers, AWS CDK
·      Automation of modern Continuous Integration and Deployment pipelines and processes, including a focus on GitOps
·      Evolve tooling to optimise developer productivity within a cloud-native environment
·      Responsibility to ensure our cloud architecture aligns with cloud-native best practices, including security, reliability, performance and cost control
·      Create technical documentation related to infrastructure and tooling
·      Work directly as part of the agile teams building our SaaS platform
·      Act as a team lead for specific projects and mentor to more junior team members
Qualifications and Experience
·      B.Sc degree or higher in relevant engineering field

·      5+ years technical background in designing, implementing and improving cloud-native infrastructure, applications and platforms
·      2+ year commercial experience working with Kubernetes and related technologies
·      Development experience with modern programming languages, preferably including Typescript
·      Experience working with Linux-based operating systems
·      3+ uears experience working with agile teams and processes
·      AWS related certifications an advantage
·      Excellent problem solving skills

Additional Info
As part of the offer is a competitive remuneration package, including excellent benefits, participation in a bonus scheme, and the opportunity for working both within our centrally located Stockholm office and also remotely for employees within Sweden.
If you find this interesting and have the needed experience and work situation, please apply and we will send you a link to our assessment platform where we would like you to complete two assessments. It will take you approximately 30 minutes – but we guarantee valuable feedback after the assessments and a quick response from our side.
We look forward to being in touch!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
As a fast growing Saas company we have revolutionized the HR-industry with our award-winning Global HR software solution. Helping our clients attract and reward their employees is something we at Benify are really passionate about. Through our tailormade platform we make sure that its not just simple to onboard new colleagues digitally, but it’s simpler than ever to keep a personal communication and offer attractive benefits to your employees.

As a Benifyer, you get the possibility impact not only our clients’ internal HR-processes but also their employees’ wellbeing.

As we are continuously growing internationally, we need to strengthen our DevOps team. We will focus a lot of effort into keeping availability up, efficiently handle incidents and automation. You’ll have great variation in your days and work with a competent team that find great joy in solving complex technical problems! Then Benify can be exactly where you belong!

Your role as DevOps Engineer

Your mission is to build a scalable, redundant system that gives great conditions for performance and high availability and work closely with software developers to provide the tools and environment needed for efficient development.

In team you own and take responsibility for your area, but to thrive with us, you like working in a team that helps each other out and put no prestige in which various tasks you perform.

Together with 2 other colleagues, you’ll be responsible for:

• Database and development environment

• Together with DevOps Lead, develop DevOps Tools
• System monitoring and proactive security measures
• Storage
• Backup and disaster recovery

Here is what we are looking for in our new colleague:

We believe that you are a solutions oriented doer who likes to take initiatives - and when you start something, you run the initiative all the way to the end line and don’t like leaving things unfinished. You think that technology should solve a problem and can navigate through the continuous evolvement of new technologies, to understand what is relevant for our organization. Since you’ll work close both with colleagues in your team as well as developers and DevOps Lead - we believe you like to collaborate, help you colleagues and share knowledge.



• Databases (we use MySQL)

• Docker
• Virtualization
• Ansible / Puppet
• Git

• General Network knowledge

Knowledge in Jira, oVirt, Ansible, Foreman, Vdi, Fortigate firewalls is a great plus.

Practical information

Start: As soon as we find the right fit
Extent: Full-time, 100%
Location: Gothenburg preferably, but we are open to other locations

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Who are we?
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission; to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future.
Since 1927, we have been a brand known for our commitment to safety, creating innovative cars that make life less complicated for our consumers. In 2010, we decided to transform our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technologies, as well as steady growth and record sales. 
We are constantly pushing our own skills and abilities to drive change in the automobile industry like never before. We are looking for innovative, committed people to join us in this endeavour and create safe, sustainable and connected cars. We believe in the power of people and will challenge and support you to reach your full potential. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars’ journey into the future.

What’s in it for you?
You are a hands-on developer with programming and devops experience. You are comfortable with agile development and a champion of software development best practices.
You're going to join our devops engineering team and support large groups of developers in other product teams by improving the developer experience of working on our platform. You will gather feedback from teams on areas of improvements but also be able to independently identify projects with a large impact.
You're going to be the hero who saves thousand of minutes in time by automating a process that is being done over and over manually or by making the CI/CD run a couple of seconds faster.

You and your skills
You have strong knowledge and deep understanding of git. Experience in Microsoft Azure infrastructure. We are looking for someone with a software developer background with experience in writing code in javascript/typescript mainly for Node.js. Experience and interest in DevOps and Infrastructure as code. You have experience working with Kubernetes or Docker. Experience in building CI/CD pipelines (ArgoCD, Jsonnet). 

Optional qualifications
Familiarity with other cloud service providers like AWS and GCP. Familiarity with Package management (mainly npm).

Contact & Application
Please apply via the link provided by the 12th of November, 2021.Applications and CVs will not be accepted via email.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
About MATCHi

Did you know that if you google “What is the fastest growing sport in the world?”, the answer will probably be Padel. 

At MATCHi, we have been on a mission to be the platform of choice for the racket sports community since 2012. Our goal to help the community to play more by connecting players and venues is coming everyday closer to reality, helped by the impressive boom of Padel.

Our growth is stronger than ever, recently doubling the players and venues joining us on the journey. Today, our platform offers a wide range of solutions for players to find and book their court, and for venues to administer their schedule while offering training and competitions. We see the future ahead of us and the possibilities are broad: video recordings, venue automation, intelligent training, online communities, perfect player matching. Be it tennis, padel, badminton or table tennis, the breadth of innovations will bring racket sports players around the world to simply play more.

Join us as a DevOps Engineer and be part of building the number one racket sports platform.

About the Role

As a DevOps Engineer at MATCHi you will work in our platform team with a set of talented backend and DevOps engineers. Following our recent growth, we have taken the first steps to move our entire infrastructure to AWS and work towards better scalability and reliability. In this role, you will help us address the next millions of players across the globe on the MATCHi platform.

What we are looking for

- A cooperative and kind team member who appreciates attentive teamwork
- A curious and ambitious colleague with a focused mind
- A creative coworker who shares crazy ideas with a brave heart
- You have worked at least 3 years with AWS or similar services in complex infrastructure environments
- You have been part of a product company with a live service distributed to a large user base
- Technologies such as GoLang, Lambda, Infrastructure as Code, and Cloudformation are part of your expertise and you can help us making the right choices to support our growth


What we offer

- A collaborative team and a culture of trust and autonomy
- A modern office with the possibility of a flexible working setup

- Great benefits like massage, personal trainer and padel lunches

- A broad product and technology set ranging from B2B SaaS platform to Consumer apps and Hardware
- A scaling challenge with a product already in use by more than a million racket sports players and expanding rapidly internationally



If you think this opportunity sounds GREAT and you're interested in joining us, simply apply just down below or at the top of this page.

headline: DevOps Developer
description.text:
På denna resa spelar IT en väsentlig roll och för närvarande söker vi DevOps tekniker med intresse av IaaS. Har du denna bakgrund och samtidigt drivs av att jobba i ett mindre tajt och kompetent team vill vi gärna ha dig ombord.

Din framtida roll

Du kommer att vara en aktiv medlem i ett mindre DevOps team som utvecklar och supportar en IaaS-plattform baserad på OpenStack. Vi arbetar med scrum och kör därför daily standups och scrum-to-scrum möten där du förväntas delta och vara aktiv. Det är därför viktigt att du gillar att jobba i grupp där ni kontinuerligt samarbetar och utbyter kunskap med varandra. I rollen kommer ni även arbeta med support av andra DevOps-team på Saab. Dessa team är användarna av IaaS-plattformen som bygger våra utvecklingsmiljöer för Saabs verksamhet inom R&D där arbetet genomsyras av ett stort fokus på produktivitet och säkerhet.

Den du är idag

För att passa bra i rollen bör du ha erfarenhet av arbete som DevOps-tekniker, gärna på ett större processdrivet företag. Vidare ser vi gärna att du som person är självgående inom området samtidigt som du drivs av ständig utveckling. Det är viktigt att du har ett genuint intresse av att stötta användare på plattformen och även fungera som support till vår R&D avdelning. Slutligen arbetar vi agilt och det är därmed även bra om du har erfarenhet av detta.

För att trivas i rollen och leva upp till våra förväntningar bör du ha erfarenhet av:

 * OpenStack - Förstå uppbyggnad samt kunna installera, konfigurera, supporta och uppgradera
 * Ansible - Ha erfarenhet av att jobba med Ansible samt skapa och underhålla playbook
 * SDN - Förstå koncept och hur detta interagerar med andra lager och komponenter. Kunna använda, konfigurera och underhålla
 * Linux, KVM samt Git - Kunna använda, konfigurera och underhålla
 * Python - Kunna koda, felsöka och anpassa på en nivå där man kan arbeta effektivt med OpenStack och integration med externa och interna APIer
 * Prometheus alt. Zabbix - Kunna sätta upp, konfigurera och underhålla. Arbeta med larmnivåer och statistik och rapporter.
 * Ceph - Installation, felsökning, uppdateringar och support.

Vi ser det även som meriterande om du har erfarenheter inom följande:

 * Terraform - Infrastructure as Code som koncept och användning med Terraform
 * Arbetat på större processdrivet företag
 * PKI - Kunna använda och förstå
 * Efterlevnad av ramverk
 * Logghantering, ELK eller EFK - Kunna installera, konfigurera, underhålla och supporta
 * Erfarenhet av att jobbat med eller utveckling/underhåll av CI/CD pipelines

Vad du blir en del av

Du kommer att tillhöra Group IT, den en del av Saab-koncernen som ansvarar för drift, installation, underhåll och förvaltning av företagets utvecklings och produktionsmiljöer samt dess ingående komponenter som servrar, storage, nät och klienter mm. Group IT ansvarar även för driften av datorhallar med kringutrustning samt tillhandahåller systemutvecklingsstöd och programanpassning.

Inom Group IT kommer du vidare tillhöra den nya sektionen Agile IT Development. Vi supportar företagets alla IT enheter med denna tjänst. Sektionen har idag drygt 70 medarbetare, till största delen konsulter. Vi utvecklar både interna applikationer och anpassar kommersiella applikationer. Inom sektionen jobbar vi nu för att sätta ett agilt arbetssätt både för oss själva men även för att få med andra delar av företaget på den agila resan.





Om du vidare vill du lära känna vår verksamhet och personal lite bättre kan du hitta berättelser från några av våra anställda här.

Sista ansökningsdatum: 2022-01-31.

Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

Tveka därför inte att söka redan idag. Vi ser fram mot din ansökan!

Vi är stolta över en vårdande miljö, där alla är olika men vi delar samma uppdrag - att skapa förutsättningar för ett tryggt samhälle.

headline: DevOps Automatiseringskonsult
description.text:
Älskar du ordet automatisering och vill fortsatt jobba, utvecklas och fördjupa dig inom detta område?

Vi har en spännande resa framför oss, där vi bygger vårt konsultteam utifrån värdegrunden; Pannben, Enkelhet, Laganda, Långsiktighet och Stolthet.
Är det något som tilltalar dig, så gör vi gärna denna resa tillsammans med dig!

Vi vill nu stärka vårt konsultteam med kompetens inom Devops Automatisering.
Som person letar vi efter dig som är driven och ambitiös och vill utvecklas både professionellt och privat. För rollen behöver du ha relevant utbildning eller motsvarande i erfarenhet och tycker om att jobba såväl i team som individuellt.

I konsultuppdrag inom området DevOps Automatisering får du bland annat jobba med eller leda arbetet inom följande områden;

-Leda DevOps och Agila transformationer för våra kunder eller vara en del av teamet för genomförandet.

-Introducera koncept för kontinuerlig integration, kontinuerlig leverans och testautomatisering.

-Introducera, driva eller genomföra automatisk driftsättning för kundapplikationer.

-Introducera, driva eller genomföra och utöka nivån av testautomatisering för kundapplikationer för att öka kvalitén.

-Tillhandahålla automatisk installation och skalning av infrastruktur i molnbaserade miljöer.

-Designa effektiv infrastruktur med hjälp av molnlösningar.

-Tillhandahålla verktyg, ramverk och processer som säkerställer kvalitén på kundapplikationen.

-Tillhandahålla lösningar som använder infrastruktur som kod och konfiguration som kodkoncept.

-Att föreslå optimeringar och förbättringar för att minska ledtiderna som tar bort flaskhalsar i produktutvecklingen.

- I en mer ledande roll får du vara drivande och bygga förslag på lösningar även om helhetsbild och information delvis saknas vid start av byggnation.

I rollen som Automatiseringskonsult ser vi gärna att du har några års erfarenhet av några eller fler
av kompetenserna/teknikerna nedan:


• Automatiseringsverktyg; Ansible, Puppet, SaltStack, Terraform
• Containerteknik; Openshift, Docker, Kubernetes
• Vmware sviten (t.ex: vRealize, vCenter, ESXi, workstation)



• Log hantering, Elastic Search, Kibana/Grafana
• Microservices-arkitektur, Infrastructure as Code
• SQL Database, MS SQL

• Scrum och Agila metoder som arbetssätt
• Förståelse av traditionella och moderna datalagringslösningar
• Grundläggande kunskap om generell infrastruktur (servrar, switchar, brandväggar, etc).

Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift

Dina konsultuppdrag ger en variation av arbetsplatser och företag.
Infinity erbjuder en trygg anställning med bra förmåner och försäkringar.

Är det här något som lockar dig - varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!




Infinity IT Consulting är ett nystartat dotterbolag till Infinity HR som etablerades 2009 med sin expertis inom rekryteringar och har under flera år försett de största varumärkena och de mest välkända serviceföretagen och butikskedjorna i Sverige med de bästa medarbetarna. Infinity IT Consulting har ett fortsatt fokus på att hjälpa befintliga och nya kunder vid rekryteringsbehov men nu även inom IT och konsulting. Företaget drivs av en stark företagskultur med konsulter inom IT & Management och ett fokus på laganda och utveckling tillsammans.

headline: DevOps Owner
description.text:
Företagsbeskrivning


På AFRY samlar vi ledande digital expertis och teknologier i AFRY X. Den nya divisionen AFRY X är en digital ledare och experthubb inom industriell IoT, AI, design och cybersäkerhet som hjälper kunder att accelerera sin digitala transformation.
AFRY är en europeisk ledare inom ingenjörs-, design- och rådgivningstjänster med global räckvidd. Vi påskyndar omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle.
Vi är 16 000 hängivna experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering, som skapar hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.




Jobbeskrivning


För två år sedan bildade vi en arkitektgruppering inom affärsområde IT Solutions. Detta för att kunna ge stöd och rådgivning till våra kunder inom olika områden gällande IT arkitektur. Flera av arkitekterna är även delaktiga i våra projektleveranser och sitter då som en del av teamen.
De är då en del av vårt PDO, “Project delivery organization”, där vi är specialiserad på kund- och produktprojekt. Vi arbetar inhouse, tar fullt ansvar för leveransen och ser varje projekt som ett Start up där vi skräddarsyr vilka verktyg och tekniker som används beroende på typ av kund. Gemensamt för alla projekt är att det är agila team som leds av en Scrum master och följer vår metodik kring en projektleverans.
Kunderna är både nationella och internationella och inkluderar såväl medelstora- och stora organisationer inom alla möjliga domäner - statliga som privata. Våra plattformar och verktyg är primärt .NET Core, C#, Java, Angular, DB, GitLab, Atlassian (Jira, Confluence) m.fl.
I dagsläget består vår arkitektgruppering av åtta stycken arkitekter, alla med sitt egna expertområde, och digitaliseringsprojekten är många. Fler än vi riktigt hinner med. Därför söker vi nu att komplettera teamet med ytterligare en arkitekt, mer specifikt en DevOps Owner.




Kravspecifikation


Du kommer att samarbeta med såväl enskilda individer som hela projektteamet och delta i arbetsmöten, workshops och gemensamma utvecklingsaktiviteter. Du har en god förståelse för beställare och andra intressenters behov.
Därför tror vi att du med fördel är en engagerad person som tar ansvar för att bidra till helheten. Som arkitekt är du av naturen noggrann och strukturerad i hur du utför ditt arbete. Då samarbete är en så central del i din roll behöver du ha ett driv och vilja att lära dig av, men också lära ut till övriga i teamet.
Du ska ha god erfarenhet och kunskap inom följande områden:
Erfarenhet av att arbeta med agila systemutvecklingsmetoder
Sätta upp och underhålla infrastruktur för servermiljö (virtualiserad)
Designa, implementera och förvalta CI/CD pipelines (exempelvis genom Gitlab eller Jenkins)
Application Deployment Architecting via Docker och TLS certifikat hantering för produktionsmiljöer

Förståelse på arkitekturnivå av frontend-tekniker såsom Angular/React, backend-tekniker såsom .NET Core/C#/Java samt databaser och messaging lösningar
Erfarenhet av felsökning av t.ex. FW inställningar, serverproblem, trafik mellan servrar
Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska, i tal och skrift

Meriterande
Kubernetes (K8)

ELK stack
Goda kunskaper i svenska , i tal och skrift





Ytterligare information


Förutom vårt arkitektteam hittar du inom affärsområdet IT Solutions ytterligare drygt 450 kompetenta och engagerade kollegor över Sverige! Vi spänner över hela utvecklingskedjan med experter inom krav, test, projektledning, utveckling, arkitektur, cybersäkerhet, AI/ML m.m.
Vi har regelbundna träffar där temat varierar mellan kompetens och socialt utbyte, eller både och. En bra balans helt enkelt! Som anställd hos oss får du t.ex.:
28 dagars semester och ledigt dag före julafton
Balans i arbetslivet

Tillgång till stort utbud aktiviteter genom vår sociala klubb: Club AFRY, till exempel Hackathons, yoga, restaurangbesök med mera
Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner gällande pension, friskvård och föräldraledighet reglerade i vårt kollektivavtal
Företagsrabatter med externa partners genom vår förmånsportal Advantage You och friskvårdsbidrag 3000 SEK/år
Restaurang och cafe på plats
Ett enormt nätverk av tekniska experter med + 16 000 kollegor med kontor i 50 länder och projekt i 100

Utöver att du får fina kollegor och en sund arbetsmiljö där vi värderar gemenskap och balans mellan arbete och fritid, får du även möjligheten att arbeta tillsammans med kompetenta och engagerade chefer. 
Varmt välkommen till oss på IT Solutions!
Om rekryteringsprocessen:
Första avstämning, två intervjusteg (IRL eller på Teams beroende på situation) samt referenstagning. I vår jobbansökningsguide kan du hitta mer information om rekrytering inom AFRY
Kontaktuppgifter för frågor

Magdalenas LinkedIn

Jan-Olofs LinkedIn

AFRY is committed to creating an inclusive & diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths. Join us to accelerate the transition towards a sustainable society.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
WELCOME TO UTOPIA

Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia.

Funnily enough, so do we. Welcome to Utopia. Where music lives.

WHAT UTOPIANS DO

We are building a better world for music with innovative big data technology that tracks online music sources and translates them into meaningful music consumption reports for royalty collection. 

WHAT YOUR ROLE WILL BE

As a DevOps Engineer you’re part of the Engineering organization in the Infra team responsible for DevOps and site reliability. In this role, you build tools and automate systems to improve our developer experience and operational excellence, which results in improved customer experience and value creation velocity. Your role is important part of modernizing the music Industry.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

- Ensure smooth deployment of product updates
- Build and maintain CI/CD tools together with DevOps, site reliability and software engineers
- Support developer teams with - Troubleshooting infrastructure related issues
- Container optimizations
- CI/CD system improvements



- Operating the systems including monitoring, alerting and troubleshooting
- Build necessary integrations to support new and evolving software products and customer needs
- Research new technologies, automation tools and system to improve efficiency and effectiveness
- Documentation of infrastructure tools and services


THE IDEAL SKILLSET

- At least three years of experience as DevOps engineer
- Bachelor degree in Computer Science or similar proven skills

- Knowing bash/shell-scripting
- Programming experience, preferably Python, Golang and Node.js

- Knowledge of Terraform, Ansible and/or Saltstack



THE HIRING PROCESS


- We invite you for an introductory video call to get to know you better and share more about us
- You get a technical test and unlimited time to send us your solution
- You meet the internal team for the technical interview
- You meet the hiring manager for the culture fit interview


WHAT WE OFFER

- A unique opportunity to be part of our global engineering team, and work in an impact oriented, autonomous and empowered team.
- Great atmosphere - we live, love & breathe music & tech!
- An experienced team to learn from, with experience in multiple startups and big tech companies
- Sublime office of hundreds of square meters with a pingpong table, playroom, gym in the basement and seriously good coffee. We love our vibrant office culture and daily breakfasts!
- And if you may prefer being on your own and working from home - we’re fine with that too!
- Swedish benefits such as pension, insurances, famous Health care allowance, phone and subscription
- We are supporting work permits for employees that moved here from countries outside the EU


UTOPIANS

We come from diverse backgrounds and we welcome everyone who identifies with the above to apply. Welcome to Utopia - Where Music Lives!

We’re eager to meet you! :)

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
We’re on the road again. You could think it is the same old foggy highway road, but no, it is the road upwards and forwards with the destination into the pink fluffy clouds. An exciting journey to the next generations of marketplaces, where we actually need some extra hands to dig in with the construction work in order to get the stuff up there. Grab your gear, bring your maps. Let’s build this path and stairway to heaven (the cloud).
We are Blocket, Sweden’s largest and most popular marketplace with around 12,3M monthly active users generating 100 million sessions. We are proud of our work to enable second-hand trade in Sweden and our contribution to a positive environmental impact. Want to get a feel for the Blocket vibe? Check us out on Instagram & LinkedIn and read more on Begagnateffekten!
What you’ll be up to
You will be surrounded by a great team consisting of thirteen dedicated tech enablers. In order to succeed you also have to understand development, and be prepared on being hands-on developing infrastructure. Our environment today is a mix of Kubernetes (EKS), PostgreSQL (RDS), EC2s, etc.
We collaborate heavily with pull requests, CI/CD, using infrastructure as code (terraform). And we work to solve problems only once, by automating, rather than doing things manually. Our mantra is ”Autonomy for teams; you build it, you run it”. In other words - take responsibility.
We work together with development teams to solve development needs. Currently we are running in AWS, but also in our two on premise data centers. And that is where you will play a really important role getting us there. Look up to the sky - that’s where we’re heading!
In short:
Find the best way to use the cloud together with stakeholders


Automate as much as possible


Create self service infrastructure


Hands on develop infrastructure

Who you are
Except being a great devops engineer knowing kind of everything about the cloud, construction work and what storms that turn things up and down - or call it infrastructure - you’re a real fan of collaboration. Although different specialities within the team, we are one team, supporting other teams. Our task is to make that equation work smoothly. Quality and speed - the key to success, the key to everything. We truly believe in teamwork, the more brains the merrier. Or at least more knowledge. So if you are up for pair or even mob programming then hey - this is your team. In order to communicate with each and everyone, on all levels, you need to be fluent in English.
Requirements/skills
Experience with infrastructure as code


Experience with AWS, GCP, Azure or Kubernetes


Experience in at least one of go/python/ruby during the last couple of years


Three years of experience in cloud and programming or equivalent knowledge


Warm welcome to a multidisciplinary team with skills varying from software development, infrastructure expertise to cloud security. As a part of our house (team) you will enjoy an enriching environment with constant learnings and discussions. You will collaborate and enable all teams within Blocket, but beyond that share tech with all of Schibsted.
Blocket is the best place to be, not only do we have highly skilled technical employees and satisfying challenges, but we are also proud of an excellent work culture and diversity balance. We believe this is the essence of a wonderful work experience at Blocket. It’s a great responsibility and motivator to work at Blocket with Blocket in everyday work. Working close to a product that engages “all” in Sweden and at the same time contribute to a sustainable lifestyle gives you a wider perspective.
Best part about my role (Nitin) is the freedom in the technical decision making, this is something that is highly encouraged in Blocket. It helps you widen your horizons and grow more, grow fast! I (Mika) appreciate the trust given to us - building a new tech stack, with modern technologies - and the challenge it gives when building for scale and resilience.
Interested in joining the Blocket world?
We look forward to hearing from you! Send your CV or apply with your LinkedIn-profile and let us know what makes you tick. We would love to get to know you a bit better!

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Join our creative and international environment to help us shape the future of air-traffic management systems, and offer efficient delivery of integrated software systems to airport control towers around the world.



Your Role



We are currently undergoing organizational change, and moving from extremely Waterfall processes to a more agile approach with automated testing, continuous integration and continuous delivery.



Our aim is to apply software engineering principles, and modern methods found in the wider community, to the process of building, releasing, and deploying IATS software and configuration.



 * 1. Designing, developing, and maintaining IATS development & build infrastructure (internal systems and tools)
 * 2. Designing and implementing the IATS deployment subsystem (delivered as part of the product)
 * 3. Helping to improve our delivery processes and tools (the bridge between 1 and 2)


What we work with

 * Software tools and services, mostly written in Python and Bash.
This is ultimately the responsibility of component maintainers.
 * Software version control with Git, Subversion.
 * Build pipelines, currently implemented with Jenkins, Maven, Artifactory.
 * Software packaging (RPM, deb).
 * Virtualisation, virtual machine management, containers.
 * Improving automation and refactoring existing tools to give us continuous integration and continuous delivery. Doing it right.
 * IP network design, implementation, and debugging (incl. Ethernet, VLANs, IPv4, IPv6, multicast, TCP, UDP).
 * Switch configuration (Cisco, Juniper).
 * Network services (incl. iSCSI, DHCP, TFTP, DNS, NTP, SNMP, SSH, HTTP, HTTPS).
 * Information security (incl. OS hardening, file system permissions, TLS, public key certificates, digital signatures, cryptographic hashing).

DevOps Engineer responsibilities

 * Design, development, and testing of small-to-medium-scale software programs.

 * Some hardware maintenance and troubleshooting.
 * Monitoring (hardware, network, software) and analysis.



Your profile



An interest in civil aviation is a plus, but we can help you with that!

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.



What you will be part of

Welcome to a workplace with inspiring challenges where the meeting between competence and personality builds the foundation for our success. We look forward to your application as soon as possible!



We pride ourselves on a nurturing environment, where everyone is different yet we share the same goal - to help protect people.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real-time and at a high scale.

We are now looking for a talented Senior DevOps Engineer that wants to participate in building our success story.

At our office, located in the center of Stockholm. We promote self-organizing cross-functional teams, a flat hierarchy and flexible working hours to give all our employees a good work/life balance. Because of our large customer base, each with a different set of requirements, there is always a new challenge and you will most certainly find projects that align with your passions.

What you'll do

 - Perform daily operations for all our hosted solutions

 - Design, build and maintain DevOps specific tools


 - Maintain and manage CI/CD pipelines

 - Proactively work with life cycle management and outage prevention
 - Serve, Educate, and share knowledge with our local and distributed development teams so they can own their infra and code changes

What you'll bring

 - Have proven DevOps experience
 - Have ability to code, test, build, deploy, etc.
 - A solid experience in terms of building and running scalable solutions in the Cloud. (Kubernetes expertise and AWS)
 - Have experience and worked with related tools, ie Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Terraform, Helm, Jenkins, DataDog, Jira, Confluence
 - Have set up and operated services by measuring and monitoring availability and performance
 - A team player mindset, comfortable with collaboration, open communication and reaching across the functional borders







DigitalRoute has the only platform that is purpose built to convert raw usage data into billable items. This enables companies to capitalize on the growing wave of usage-based business models. More than 400 companies rely on our platform for usage-based monetization, quote-to-cash automation, finance system consolidation and telecom mediation. We deliver extreme precision in the most complex environments in the world. We’re the new standard for usage-based revenue.

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
At Semcon, we believe that the one who understands the end-user best, will create the best solutions. Therefore for us, it’s always people first. Then technology. We create value and impact, innovating sustainable products, services and business models for our customers, enabled by digital capabilities. Some of our core deliveries at Semcon Digital Services include Digital Transformation, Smart solutions, Digital experience, AI solutions, Computer Vision solutions and Autonomous solutions.

Now we are looking for a DevOps Engineer with drive and warmth to join us. A person who thrive in a setting where a lot of things are going on. You will focus on facilitate coordination and collaboration among operations, development and testing functions.

You will be part of our growing Digital Services team and work together with kind and skilled individuals in challenging assignments and with exciting customers. In our division we all come from different areas of expertise and our ambition is to build a large team with skills ranging from digital strategy, project management and UX/service design to software development and emerging tech. We also have a long history of working with embedded software to create connected and smart products.

Want to learn more about our offerings and projects within the Digital Services area? Click here. (https://semcon.com/sv/digital-hubb/)

What you’ll do

- Support in-house teams and customers improving their SW development workflow and getting the most out of their CI/CD environment
- Bridge the gap and improve collaboration between operations, developers and testing functions
- Troubleshoot issues with tools, processes, applications and/or infrastructure
- Evaluate current development and operations procedures, recommend and implements tools and practices to increase efficiency and reliability
- Having fun!


We’ll look beyond your resume, but here is a starting point.

- Solid experience developing, testing and deploying software systems
- Previous experience from working with some of the tools that make a state-of-the-art CI/CD environment (e.g. Azure/AWS, Jenkins, Python, Ansible, Kubernetes, Docker, Linux, Gitlab, Bitbucket).
- Enjoy working with new technology
- Excellent knowledge of agile methods
- Great communication skills in Swedish and English.


We strongly believe that diversity of background, experience and perspectives is important to create excellent user experiences and to make Semcon a great place to work.





Area Manager Digital Services

headline: DevOps Engineer
description.text:
Be the magician of engineering enablers!
Imagine you have a 4-meter-high black beast of a truck in front of you, a Volvo FH loaded with over 100 tons of gods. There is no driver in the cab, the truck will drive autonomously to its destination. It has driven down that track before and knows the way.
During the assignment an emergency brake is triggered but the logs shows that this hard of a brake wasn’t necessary. 



So who are we?
We are Build, Measure and Learn Technology, a part of Electrical and Electronics Architecture at Volvo Group Trucks Technology in Gothenburg!
We have the goal ensure that we have the structure, framework and knowledge to build and verify the EE system, from single component up to full system. This by creating the development pipelines for our embedded code, simulations and test structures that enables continuous integration and Delivery.

Why do we do that?
Our vision is to be the most desired and successful transport solution provider in the world. We need to work with the mentality that we develop to learn, learn to reach further than our goals.
We see that the most important key to this learning is automation of everything and it’s in this that you’re going to help us!



Software development it’s all about testing and instant feedback. In this we have a set of tools and tool chains to gather the metrics needed for data-driven development of the embedded platform.
Your mission together with the team is to design, develop and maintain our infrastructure for data management and visualization to match the need of developers and testers. A big part for us is also to analyse and understand the the data, build connection and visualize it. Since covering data from written source code to vehicles running on the field, it’s a big scope that requires new solutions, technologies including eg. machine learning
It doesn’t matter if you have long experience and looking for a leading role or junior that want to join a team that can help you learn. If you are the right person for this team you get the role and challenges that inspires you.

So who are you?
Team player that iterates solutions and share knowledge with your teammates.
You have some experience of working with build and test with software development (CI/CD).
Being swift in front of the keyboard, in other words huge interest in software development and testing
Interest of working with data science and machine learning
Always eager to learn new stuff to help you grow and excel.

Welcome to join our world full of possibilities!

Further information

https://youtu.be/jKbhjxBllqc

headline: Senior Devops Engineer
description.text:
Have you been through a change involving cloud and container and you know that it is more than just technology shift? As part of our strategy to continuously improve our way of working, we are taking next step into a DevOps organization and therefore reinforcing our DevOps/SRE Platform team to help us provide the best possible experience for our developers. You will have the opportunity to influence the culture of the Engineering organization, facilitate technical delivery and work with the team's strategy definition and implementation
What you will do:
Your main responsibility will be to provide reliable tools and services for the Development teams, to help them to deliver stable SW
You will provide standards/templates for cloud infrastructure to be used by Development teams and continuously develop/improve them to smoothen the delivery pipeline
You should support the Development teams to grow and deliver healthy SW, by facilitating process alignment
You will interact with distributed Development teams across several locations as well as our operation teams

You'd like to work with these technologies:

Test and release framework (e.g. Jenkins)
Repository and version control systems(e.g. Bitbucket, Harbor)
Build and deployment systems (e.g. ArgoCD, GitOps)
Observability tools (e.g. Grafana, Prometheus)

We expect you to:
Be curious, self-driven, team-player, pragmatic, persistent
Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team
Be open to changing technologies and continuous innovation
Have strong DevOps/SRE mindset, working in an Agile organization

Have extensive CI/CD experience (build, deploy & test automation)
Experienced with technologies like, logging, monitoring, configuration mgmt. & reporting tools
Be comfortable with requirement gathering, documentation & excellent communication skills
Experience in Java, Phyton or Go development is beneficial

What's in it for you?
Opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company
A fun and flexible working culture
Work with very smart and humble people
International work environment

If you want to be part of a new development team in central Stockholm/Uppsala, please apply with your cover letter and CV.

headline: DevOps Engineer, Luleå/Stockholm
description.text:
Pensionsmyndigheten är i teknisk framkant. IT-avdelningen har ca 450 medarbetare. Storleken behövs, bland annat för att möta kommande reformer i pensionssystemet för långsiktigt trygga pensioner. Vi står inför omfattande utveckling under många år med den senaste tekniken och med moderna arbetssätt. På IT-avdelningen möter du i en kultur med driv och hög ambitionsnivå, samtidigt som vi värnar om en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Vår vision är att leverera bäst IT för Sverige.

Vi arbetar med Continuous Delivery, automatiserad testning och automatiserad konfigurationshantering. Vi har som ambition att automatisera vårt arbete redan från början för att undvika att behöva göra samma sak mer än en gång. Allt i linje med DevOps.

Varje dag utvecklar och arbetar vi med innovativa tekniska lösningar för våra miljontals kunder runt om i landet. Här får du arbeta med de senaste tekniska innovationerna och samtidigt göra en insats för samhället  vårt jobb berör alla!

I din roll som DevOps Engineer kommer du att ingå i ett, utav flera, agila, tvärfunktionella och självgående team som hantera alla delar av utvecklingskedjan. Vi jobbar i korta cykler och driftsätter ofta, enligt agila principer.

I teamet kommer du att vara en central person och underlätta dina kollegors dagliga arbete genom att diskutera idéer, angreppssätt och lösningar. Du får många kunniga kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sin kunskap och erfarenheter och vi jobbar aktivt med kompetensspridning.

Idag har teamet få tjänster i drift men detta kommer att växa över tid, i takt med att vi utvecklar framtidens pensionssystem. Initialt kommer därför dina arbetsuppgifter att kretsa mycket kring CI/CD pipeline, test-, utvecklings- och produktionsmiljöer, samt annan nödvändig infrastruktur och automatisering. Du kommer även att övervaka, felsöka och utföra installationer, samt ansvara för konfiguration och integration mot bakomliggande system.

Det här är några av de tekniker vi arbetar med:

 Docker / Openshift / Kubernetes



 Java / Maven / Springboot
 Git / Bitbucket
 Puppet / Ansible
 Elastic Stack / Grafana / Prometheus
 Nagios / Check_mk
Utbildning och erfarenhet:
Vi tror att du antingen har en bakgrund som utvecklare, med erfarenhet och intresse av att jobba med systemadministration, eller som systemadministratör, med erfarenhet och intresse av att jobba med utveckling. Eller så jobbar du redan idag som en DevOps Engineer?

Vi ser att du har:

 erfarenhet inom programmering, gärna Java
 goda kunskaper i tal och skrift i såväl svenska som engelska

Kunskaper inom följande områden anses meriterande för rollen:
 arbetslivserfarenhet av ovan nämnda tekniker/system
 erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt, lean eller DevOps
 eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT

Egenskaper:
För att trivas i rollen som DevOps Engineer hos oss är det viktigt att du som person har en god analytisk och problemlösande förmåga. Vidare ser vi att du är nyfiken, ansvarstagande och resultatorienterad. Självklart tycker du om att arbeta i team, har en god samarbetsförmåga och trivs med vårt klimat där kompetensspridning är en naturlig del i arbetet.

Vi har stort fokus på vår kultur och hur vi tillsammans påverkar vår arbetsplats, du bör därför ha ett intresse och vilja att vara med på denna kulturresa. Vår kultur andas DevOps och kan sammanfattas med tre ord: effektiva, kunniga och hjälpsamma.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och lämplighet för rollen.


Övrigt:
Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Vi är drygt 1400 medarbetare på åtta orter.

Vi gör pensioner enklare!

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning, vi tillämpar provanställning om 6 månader.

Då anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kommer att genomföras innan anställning.

Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.

Tjänsten kan placeras i Stockholm eller i Luleå. Vi har möjlighet till hybridarbete - att arbeta både på kontoret och på distans.

För mer information:


Fackliga representanter:
Liv Berntsson, Saco, tel. 



Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekyteringssajter och liknande.
