headline: Infrastructure and DevOps engineer
description.text:
Global migration is a 21st-century reality: Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, finding love, or looking to experience new cultures, people are now living side by side in a new way. At Rebtel, we believe in tearing down borders – from the geographical borders that complicate international communication and money transfers to the cultural borders that keep people divided. We’re on a mission to build products serving the 2 billion modern internationals of the world. We offer work, communication, and remittance services for anyone that has crossed a border:
Our team mirrors our global audience:  we are a diverse team of people from 20 different countries that get together everyday – and we’d love for you to join us. 

Rebtel is looking for an Infrastructure & DevOps Engineer
About Rebtel’s infrastructure
Our infrastructure is entirely cloud-based and we have components in the 3 major cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP). Our infrastructure hosts our customer-facing business applications as well as support systems used internally by different teams. Given how long we have been around, we have some legacy applications and systems that run on VMs in the cloud, but our preference is for containerization orchestrated by Kubernetes.
In an environment as vast as Rebtel’s, it is important to maintain thorough documentation of our systems, but even better to persist our infrastructure as code using modern tools such as Terraform. Our work approach is well structured without being stifling. We use an agile workflow to handle day to day tasks. We strongly encourage collaboration as an excellent way to spread knowledge and to deliver universally relevant products and services.
Given our fast-paced journey and market ambition, you will find tasks that are demanding and that will trigger your creativity. At Rebtel, everyone contributes to our customer propositions - we have quick communication channels between teams and have regular hackathons to respond to opportunities and challenges as they come.
Rebtel is looking for a DevOps and Infrastructure engineer to join its team that is building new products and services in a modern, cloud-based ecosystem.
About you and your responsibilities

We’re looking for an individual who we can learn from and help us take our infrastructure to the next level.
We love to share the knowledge we have and to learn new things from you.
You have keen interest in architecture: how to build complex systems that are maintainable.
As an Infrastructure and devops engineer, your role will include actively contributing towards architectural decisions. You will discuss technical solutions with the rest of the team and act as an inspiration to improve and maintain system stability, availability, and security.
You are interested in problem solving and enjoy finding the simplest possible solution to complex problems.
You work well with teams, even in areas besides DevOps and infrastructure, but are also capable of performing as a sole contributor in your area

Requirements

Experience with Azure and, preferably, also with GCP and AWS.
Sound knowledge of networking principles and common concepts such as firewalls, load balancers and application gateways and debugging tools such as Wireshark.

Experience setting up CI/CD pipelines using common tools deployment tools (GIT, Azure Devops, Teamcity, Octopus)
Experience with infrastructure-as-code tools such as Terraform and Ansible
Experience with system administration on both Windows and *nix based platforms including scripting using Powershell and Shell.


Bonus points

Knowledge of IP telephony and related technologies/protocols such as SIP, WebRTC.
Experience writing and automating system tests
Experience working with cross functional teams on mature products with many users
Experience working with standards for compliance in the payments industry e.g PCI

Ideal candidate

3+ years full-time professional experience (i.e., 6k+ hours)
Committed to documenting and automating routine tasks
Raise the level of everyone around you

Always curious, always learning
Vision for product development and for how a code base evolves
A pleasure to work with


We are Rebtel. People from all around the world, as of now 20 countries and more to come. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
&nbsp

headline: Talented Devops Node/GoLang developer
description.text:
Summary

At APSIS, we imagine a world where nobody gets a single spam message ever again.

Our vision is to help our customers communicate better with their users by allowing them to use their customer data more effectively. 

Work Description

Our new APSIS One platform is built from the ground up using brand new cloud-native technology and methods.

APSIS aims to work at the forefront of technology and development. We follow modern agile practices with cross-functional DevOps teams, where each team assumes complete technical and operational ownership of their applications. This includes implementation, architectural design and tech selection, QA, continuous delivery, and technical production environment operations. We believe in small, highly skilled, highly empowered and autonomous teams taking maximal ownership of their systems.

In a typical day this role will be working as part of such a team, working in close collaboration with their team members and other similar teams in Stockholm, Malmö, Warsaw and Rostov, and with their Product Owner. APSIS dev teams also have “20% time” where the team works outside the product backlog on tasks of their own choice.

Responsibilities

- As part of the development team, implement new features and solve engineering challenges in a modern, cloud-native, microservice-based tech stack.
- Take an active part in team development, knowledge sharing and improvements to increase team velocity and developer quality of life.
- Respond to disruptions and proactively work to prevent such from occurring in the first place. 


Requirements

- 2+ years / 5+ years / 7+ years of professional development experience with a robust software engineering background
- Professional experience with using Amazon Web Services (particularly ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, Lambda, API Gateway, ElasticSearch, CloudWatch, and supporting tools like IAM) and Docker in production systems
- Experience with Node and/or GoLang and ready to learn and pick up tasks in either language
- Proven ability to write high-performant, maintainable code
- Ability to operate in a DevOps environment
- Experience with working on CI/CD pipelines
- Interest in, and ability to work hands-on with managing your own cloud infrastructure on a daily basis
- Creative and solutions-oriented, someone who enjoys tackling big challenges and is not afraid to learn new things along the way

- Collaborative mindset, ability to work as part of a very distributed development organisation where many small teams need to coordinate


Bonus qualifications

- Experience with Angular, Typescript, React, Jasmine, ngrx
- Experience with Java, C# and .Net core
- AWS certifications or equivalent evidence of advanced AWS competency
- Experience with high performance / resilient microservices architecture is highly desirable
- Experience with REST API design, development and consumption
- Experience with distributed systems, queueing systems, event driven architecture
- Professional experience with building SaaS software, especially from web analytics or digital marketing or equivalent
- Experience from integration with 3rd party vendor systems


Position type

Full time


Please apply by providing your CV and a personal letter as soon as possible. We will hire as soon as we find the right person.



About us
At APSIS, we believe in enabling great marketing for our customers. As the leading provider of marketing solutions in the Nordics, our goal is to enable and simplify the workloads of our many global clients every day. We do this by creating simple yet scalable tools within digital marketing, including data management, targeted emails, lead management and e-commerce recovery. At the end of the day, it all comes down to one thing: our clients’ marketing success is our success. And we’re proud to be there for them, every step of the way. ...Intrigued? Find out more at apsis.com!

Disclaimer

Apsis is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Apsis via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Apsis.

headline: DevOps Engineer at Toyota
description.text:
We at Toyota are looking for DevOps engineers that can further strengthen our growing software development organisation at R&D.

As a DevOPS Engineer at Toyota R&D you will:

 * Work with all our software development teams and products.
 * Improve and introduce new software development tools.
 * Automate workflows with scripts or other tools to make our development process more efficient
 * Standardise way of working for software developers, repos, tools, CI/CD pipelines, release management, connection to issue management systems...
 * Manage our Azure cloud subscription and configuration of Azure DevOps.
 * Support re-use of common software components in Toyota products.
 * Coordinate activities with Toyota IS/IT.

Our software organisation is growing, we are adding new teams and software components - both for embedded- and cloud based applications. As a DevOps engineer you will have the possibility to work across all teams and support them with expert knowledge of our tools and processes. As a DevOps engineer you will learn our products and their code base, while focusing on how to increase our efficiency via automation or usage of new or existing tools. As a DevOps engineer you probably have a software developer background but have developed knowledge of or want to become a tool smith that makes your colleagues smile when they use your latest scripts or standardized tool setup.
At Toyota in Mjölby you will see your efforts result in a complete product, our fork-lifts. As a developer you are expected from time to time to test new software or solutions on fork-lifts in our lab. Fork-lift driver licence is included in the employment.
Development is primarily done in various scripting languages and configuration files.

What is Toyota Material Handling?

At our site in Mjölby, 3,000 employees work with material handling from development concepts to manufactured vehicles. Our product range goes from loyal servants such as manual hand trucks to autonomous self-driving 1.5 tonne vehicles and innovative energy solutions. With us, the employee is central and our employees describe us as a friendly company with a focus on personal development, personal responsibility and health.

 Sustainable employer

At Toyota, we strive to be a sustainable employer through our outstanding environmental work and our personnel policy. We currently have, among other things, a carbon-neutral production and a KRAV-labelled staff restaurant. Furthermore, we offer our staff good training opportunities through group training eight times a week and a newly renovated gym.

Commuting

We have good commuting opportunities by commuter trains and car from most cities in Östergötland, 30 minutes from Linköping and 20 minutes from Motala. We offer free parking within 5 minutes of your workplace with free access to engine heaters.

Your profile

 * Master or Bachelor in Engineering, other relevant technical college education or vocational education combined with work experience.
 * Experience of software development, CI/CD and git
 * Knowledge of various scripting languages
 * Azure and Azure DevOps knowledge is a plus, but not mandatory
 * A broad interest in technology and good problem-solving ability

Your Application

Does it sound interesting? We work with ongoing selection, so send in your application today.

Feel free to contact our employees for more information:




Instagram: ToyotaMHsweden
Linkedin: Toyota Material Handling Manufacturering Sweden AB
Youtube: Toyota Material Handling

headline: Software Engineer // Devops
description.text:
Description
As a DevOps team member, you will develop an automated process for building and testing software which is constructed with model-based design and C/C++ code. This automated process handles all the required steps for creating and delivering a binary file ready to be downloaded to cars.
 You will be a part of a team responsible for deciding the future of our Software Factory with its CI/CD system to support hundreds of developers.

 • Develop and maintain an automated process to assure software quality
 • Maintain and update current scripts/tools to support an evolving software
 • Evaluate and develop new tools to support developers
 Required qualifications:
 • Master of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent
 • Expertise working with C/C++ and Python
 • Experience working with continuous integration tools
 • Understanding of software development workflow and processes
 Meritorious:
 • Zuul
 • Experience in software development for embedded systems
 • Git/Gerrit
 • Ansible

 • Docker

 • Matlab
 • Understanding of model-based systems, Simulink/TargetLink
 • Experience with issue tracking tools and an Agile way of working
 Personal qualities:
 • A good ability of communication and team work is essential
 • Structured, with good analytical and problem-solving skills
 • Capable of focusing on both daily issues and long term visions
 • Interested in new tools and technologies

- 2+ years / 5+ years / 7+ years of professional development experience with a robust software engineering background
- Professional experience with using Amazon Web Services (particularly ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, Lambda, API Gateway, ElasticSearch, CloudWatch, and supporting tools like IAM) and Docker in production systems
- Experience with Node and/or GoLang and ready to learn and pick up tasks in either language
- Proven ability to write high-performant, maintainable code
- Ability to operate in a DevOps environment
- Experience with working on CI/CD pipelines
- Interest in, and ability to work hands-on with managing your own cloud infrastructure on a daily basis
- Creative and solutions-oriented, someone who enjoys tackling big challenges and is not afraid to learn new things along the way

- Collaborative mindset, ability to work as part of a very distributed development organisation where many small teams need to coordinate


Bonus qualifications

- Experience with Angular, Typescript, React, Jasmine, ngrx
- Experience with Java, C# and .Net core
- AWS certifications or equivalent evidence of advanced AWS competency
- Experience with high performance / resilient microservices architecture is highly desirable
- Experience with REST API design, development and consumption
- Experience with distributed systems, queueing systems, event driven architecture
- Professional experience with building SaaS software, especially from web analytics or digital marketing or equivalent
- Experience from integration with 3rd party vendor systems


Position type

Full time


Please apply by providing your CV and a personal letter as soon as possible. We will hire as soon as we find the right person.



About us
At APSIS, we believe in enabling great marketing for our customers. As the leading provider of marketing solutions in the Nordics, our goal is to enable and simplify the workloads of our many global clients every day. We do this by creating simple yet scalable tools within digital marketing, including data management, targeted emails, lead management and e-commerce recovery. At the end of the day, it all comes down to one thing: our clients’ marketing success is our success. And we’re proud to be there for them, every step of the way. ...Intrigued? Find out more at apsis.com!

Disclaimer

Apsis is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Apsis via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Apsis.

headline: DevOps Engineer / SRE
description.text:
Quickspin is an online iGaming provider with the pursuit of creating the most thrilling experience ever. We also happen to be really awesome. 
About the role
Quickspin is expanding its product portfolio with a newly acquired games platform. This platform is used to service all our major customers, delivering the games as well as reporting, configuration and monitoring of the gaming operation. 
In the role as a DevOps Engineer (also named Site Reliability Engineer, SRE) you will focus on reliability, network, and security to strengthen our team. Quickspin is a casual and playful place to work, where the pace is high and all voices matter.
What we are looking for:


Some experience of Network security, configurations of load balancers and Firewalls in an Opensource as well as cloud environment
Some experience with infrastructure automation/configuration management using tools such as Ansible

Hands-on experience with troubleshooting and root cause analysis
Familiar with standard software development and quality processes, methodologies and tools


Bonus points for...
Experience with log processing and metrics collection (loki/prometheus/Grafana)
Knowledge of GitOps
Experience with AWS (EC2, EKS)
Experience with Docker
Experience with MariaDB/MySQL


Who are you and what we offer
We are seeking a structured yet creative person, who does not settle and is always eager to learn and develop new things. You understand and embrace good development practices such as code reviews, test automation and you take pride in writing code that is easy to test, read and maintain. You love backwards compatibility. We go by the vision of “We create Awesomeness” and that goes with everything we do - From creating a great work environment together to making thrilling games. You will be surrounded by kind, corny, and simply put - awesome people - that are truly passionate about what they do. We are also proud to say that we offer an excellent package, flexible hours and of course, a challenging and rewarding job in one of the fastest growing and most exciting industries there is.


Interested?

headline: Devops ingenjör till Handelsbanken
description.text:
Handelsbanken är ett företag med en stark tro på den enskilda individens förmåga och kan erbjuda dig utmaningar och möjligheter att utvecklas i ett företag som befinner sig mitt i en spännande digitaliseringsresa. Just nu söker vi dig med stort IT-intresse som vill joina oss under denna resa. Din främsta uppgift är att effektivisera utvecklarnas vardag. Så om du drivs av att göra livet enklare för andra är detta uppdrag just för dig.

Din vardag

På avdelningen för IT-styrning ansvarar vi bland annat för applikationsramverk och utvecklarstöd och arbetar dagligen med att effektivisera och förbättra IT-leveransen. I dagsläget består området 4 team som jobbar agilt och tvärfunktionellt med omväxlande och intressanta uppgifter.

Du kommer att ingå i vårt Devops Toolchain team som ansvarar för bankens CI/CD plattformar där du kommer ha en ledande roll och tar ett stort ansvar för våra leveranser och bidrar med kunskap och engagemang genom hela processen.

Vem är du

För att lyckas i din roll ser vi det som krav att du har dessa kompetenser i bagaget:


• Kunskaper inom DevOps Toolchains (provat på olika CI/CD verktyg)

• Erfarenhet av verktyg som UrbanCode Deploy, Ansible, TeamCity eller andra typer av deploy verktyg
• Goda kunskaper om pipelines för build och deploy processer
• Erfarenhet av Git
• Kommunicera på svenska och engelska på en professionell nivå
• Har en akademisk utbildning som Systemvetare, civil ingenjör eller annan relevant bakgrund

 Det är även meriterande att du är intresserad av IT-säkerhet och nätverk

För att trivas hos oss och känna att du har hamnat hos likasinnade människor är det viktigt att du är positiv och mån om vilken energi du tar med dig till jobbet. Du är lösningsorienterad och har förmågan att hitta nya vägar framåt. Du är generös med att dela med dig av dina kunskaper och erfarenheter så ni som grupp blir starkare och smartare tillsammans. Du har lätt för att kommunicera ut komplexitet på ett förenklat sätt. Sist med inte minst ansvarstagande!

Vill du veta mer

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Nexer Recruit. 

Välkommen med din ansökan på www.nexerrecruit.com/jobb. Då urval och intervjuer sker löpande ber vi dig skicka din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

Om Handelsbanken
 Den personliga kontakten mellan människor är utgångspunkten för lyckade bankaffärer. Tycker vi. Det har vi tyckt sedan 1871, när banken grundades. De goda relationerna är förmodligen anledningen till att vi fortsätter vara en stabil bank år efter år, med framgångsrika affärer och nöjda kunder. Som medarbetare i Handelsbanken finns stora möjligheter att utvecklas åt det håll som intresserar dig mest – oavsett om du vill bli rådgivare, chef, specialist eller satsa på en internationell karriär. Välkommen till en bank med lång erfarenhet i branschen.

headline: Senior Developer with Devops
description.text:
Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

It is in everything we do. From delivering a premium service to our operators, to creating an entertaining experience for the end user; we are unwavering in our mission to create the worlds’ leading sports betting experience.

Senior Developer with Devops experience

Kambi Development is constantly growing, and we are looking for more skilled people to further strengthen our development teams' ability to turn user stories into shippable code. We're dedicated to value driven development, think lean software development is a great way of achieving that, and use agile processes to support our efforts along the road.

Our team consists of 3 developers and one tester and are now looking to grow that, We believe in passion for quality, taking ownership, being inventive and having a mindset that is open to giving and receiving feedback to improve as individuals. You will work in our office at Juvelen in central Uppsala, tapping into the spirit of starting up something new while being part and work in close cooperation with our Stockholm office and other offices around the world.

This is what we are looking for

• You are used to build scalable and maintainable systems that runs and fails gracefully.
• Use code reviewing and automated tests to ensure a high-quality product.
• Know your way around containerization and orchestration.
• Knowledge in migrating to cloud.
• Apply their technical skills and curiosity to the product development process.
• Monitor our products in production, finding ways of improving them.
• Continuous integration and releasing our tested code into production.

This is some tech we work with

• Java 11+
• Kotlin
• Kafka
• ZooKeeper
• PostgreSQL
• LinuxAnsible
• AWS
• K8S/EKS
• Terraform
• JavaScript & React knowledge is a plus
• Git
• Kibana
• Docker

• IntelliJ
• Grafana/Graphite

We would like you to

• Experience working as a Java Developer
• Have good experience of working in an agile team developing, deploying and
• owning business critical systems
• Have demonstrated that you have the mindset and skills to become an
• effective part of a cross-functional, self-organizing, self-managing team
• Have both theoretical and practical knowledge of agile and/or lean software
• development
• Have the ability to write clean, well-structured and readable code


You'll like Kambi if you:

• Find technically complex systems thrilling
• Take pride in being good at what you do and doing it well
• Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team
• Thinks business value delivered is what defines great development
• Enjoys releasing software and working with latest technology's
• Work closely together within their development team
• Write testable software in collaboration with our testers
• Continuously improve our way of working
• Support our Product Owners with technical insight

If you want to be part of a dedicated community of developers in central Uppsala, then please apply now!

#LI-KQ1

headline: Molnexpert - DevOps Specialist
description.text:
Vill du jobba i ett självstyrande team med moderna tekniker och nära samarbete med andra utvecklingsteam? Brinner du för att vara med och utveckla produkter som gör skillnad för demokratin, samhället och det fria ordet? Då kommer du att trivas på Bonnier News – Sveriges största mediehus där vi nu tar nästa steg i att skapa morgondagens journalistik.

Vi är i en spännande fas där vi lägger grunden för den framtida driften av de tekniska plattformarna till Bonnier News många kända varumärken. Tyngdpunkten ligger i att bygga upp infrastruktur i Googles molnplattform. Kopplat till detta så söker vi en DevOps-expert som vill vara med och bygga en av Mediesveriges mest moderna och progressiva utvecklingsorganisationer.

Om teamet:

Du kommer vara en del av ett engagerat team som stöttar de olika utvecklingsteamen inom Bonnier News Tech gällande användning av molntjänster, CDN och annan infrastruktur. I rollen kommer du jobba nära våra DevOps-specialister och utvecklare samt övriga team-medlemmar som är placerade i Stockholm och Mellerud. Du kan räkna med visst distansarbete, men du bör kunna vara på plats 2-3 dagar per vecka.

Vi jobbar mycket med, och värdesätter, samarbete. Både inom teamet och i olika samarbeten med varumärkenas utvecklingsteam. Detta tar sig ofta uttryck i par-/mobbprogrammering, inte sällan över teamgränserna. På så sätt är vi både stöd till utvecklingsteamen och har inflytande på teknikval, strukturer och best practices.

Några av de vanligaste teknikerna hos oss i dagsläget:

 -
Docker.

 -
Kubernetes, speciellt Openshift.

 -
Tjänster inom GCP, men även AWS.

 -
Elasticsearch, MongoDB, Redis, PostgreSQL.

 -
NodeJS och Golang.


Din erfarenhet:

Vi söker dig som har jobbat med några av de ovan nämnda tekniker, gärna med fokus på infrastruktur och DevOps. Du är prestigelös och gillar att samarbeta med andra i autonoma team. Bonnier News jobbar målmedvetet med frågor som berör mångfald och vill ta tillvara de kvaliteter som det tillför verksamheten. Vi värdesätter också engagemang i den digital transformation som vi befinner oss i för att göra vår journalistik och våra tjänster ännu mer tillgängliga för ännu fler.

Övrig information

Bonnier News Tech har tre hubbar; Stockholm, Sundsvall och Malmö. I den här rollen har du möjlighet att jobba på den plats, av dessa tre som passar dig bäst. 

Urvalet till den här tjänsten sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt genom att trycka på ansök-knappen nedan. Med anledning av GDPR har vi inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via email.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, hoppas vi hörs!


Som Nordens största medieföretag hjälper vi medborgare och organisationer att fungera i ett demokratiskt samhälle. Våra journalister rapporterar, granskar och berättar om vår tids frågor. Vi inspirerar och skapar affärer genom möten, produkter och tjänster. Med varumärken som Dagens Nyheter, Expressen och Dagens industri når vi miljoner läsare och användare varje dag. Genom Bonnier News Local har vi även ett stort lokalt engagemang - från Sydsvenskan i söder till Örnsköldsviks Allehanda i norr. Förutom detta ger vi också ut branschspecifika tidningar såsom Dagens Media, Resumé, Dagens medicin och Fastighetsnytt, och även en rad livsstilsmagasin som Damernas Värld, Sköna Hem, Teknikens Värld och Allt om Mat m.fl. Genom att ständigt driva den digitala utvecklingen framåt når vi hela tiden längre - som medarbetare hos oss kan du påverka riktningen.

På Bonnier News värdesätter vi att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter och perspektiv. Jämställdhet och inkludering är prioriterade frågor hos oss och ett av fyra bärande fokusområden i vår hållbarhetsstrategi. Vi vill skapa ett öppet klimat på våra arbetsplatser och strävar efter att hitta talangfulla medarbetare som vidgar våra perspektiv och hjälper oss att bidra till ett mer inkluderande samhälle. Detta genom journalistik och tjänster som är ännu mer tillgängliga för fler. Vi hoppas att även du vill bidra till detta!

Stockholm

is mandatory.

headline: DevOps Engineer till MFEX
description.text:
Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en organisation som förstår värdet av DevOps och agil utveckling! MFEX söker dig som älskar tekniska utmaningar och har en passion för att bygga hållbara, högkvalitativa lösningar. MFEX har sedan starten 1999 vuxit till att bli en ledande global fondplattform, som erbjuder en komplett och toppmodern lösning för bl.a. fondhandel, fonddistributionstjänster och datalösningar. Ta chansen och bli en del av ett växande och globalt företag i en spännande bransch!

OM TJÄNSTEN
MFEX expanderar i snabb takt internationellt med både nya kunder och nya marknader och letar just nu efter en DevOps-ingenjör.

Tjänsten passar dig som:


* tycker om att arbeta i en snabb och föränderlig miljö, förstår värdet av agil utveckling och automatisering.
* är en lagspelare som vill arbeta i nära samarbete med teammedlemmar, utvecklingsteam samt andra intressenter.
* drivs av att förbättra och förändra och vill vara med och påverka!


ARBETSUPPGIFTER
MFEX har en väl uppbyggd och förankrad DevOps kultur med väl inarbetade agila arbetssätt. Du kommer att ingå i DevOps teamet och tillsammans arbetar ni nära utvecklarna. Här har du möjlighet att påverka, att effektivisera och att underlätta för andra. Som grupp har ni stor inverkan på vilken riktning arbetet tar.

VI SÖKER DIG SOM
- Har en högskoleutbildning inom IT, alt. Förvärvat likvärdig kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet.
- Goda kunskaper i Microsoft utvecklingsstack och Microsoft Azure (Microsoft development stack and Microsoft Azure.). Det är meriterande om du även har kunskaper inom andra programmeringsspråk och ramverk.
- Har erfarenhet av- och intresse för agil utveckling.
- Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska, både i skrift och tal

Om du har erfarenhet och intresse av Microsoft SQL Server, MongoDB, Kubernetes, Azure DevOps och DataDog så är ett plus då det är tekniker MFEX arbetar med och tror på!

Som person är du:


* En lagspelare
* Problemlösande
* Självgående
* Serviceinriktad
* Kommunikativ


Övrig information


* Start: Omgående eller enligt överenskommelse
* Omfattning: Heltid
* Placering: Umeå


Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten hanteras av Academic Work. 

Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals- och intervjufasen.

INFORMATION OM FÖRETAGET
As independent experts in global fund distribution, MFEX offers a complete solution for fund companies and distributors. With assets under administration of EUR 320 billion, MFEX is one of the leading B2B fund platforms. Over 350 institutional clients (including banks and insurance companies) use MFEX to access one of the world's largest range of funds with 80,000 funds from over 960 fund companies. MFEX offers complete transparency between distributors and fund companies.



Läs mer om MFEX här.

headline: DevOps Engineer @ Quiddly
description.text:
Join us in the transactional revolution! With us, you will be at the forefront in fintech that works with the latest technology, and drive change all over the world.

As our DevOps Engineer, you will be able to build sharp technology with smart solutions and work in the platform that we have built and sell to customers. In addition, you will join our global expansion and have the opportunity to influence and build something from scratch. Sounds good? Keep reading!





What you will be doing:

- Work closely with the Developing team, our CTO, and Product Owner to ensure a reliable world-class product
- Build, test, and maintain infrastructure and tools that enable development and release of software
- Work with infrastructure automation tools to build and maintain high-quality CI/CD pipelines
- Responsible for IAM-policies and procedures
- Create monitoring and toolings for the overall infrastructure






We offer you:

 Annual Bonus and allocation in our Options Program
 Flexible working hours & Work-life balance
 Remote work up to 50% of your working hours
 Select your own equipment from preferred manufacturer
 Occupational pension benefits according to the current ITP plan
 Wellness allowance SEK 3,000 / year
 Insurance & Annual health check
🏻‍♀️ Exercise during working hours - from Zumba to Marathon
 Paid parking just outside our office
 Breakfast & coffee - the 10-break and 3-coffee is sacred to us
 Join regular after works and happenings!
 Pingis til you drop in our internal pingis league
 Team spirit - become part of a tight and successful team
 Saas & Fintech - two of the hottest industries on the market
 Opportunity to influence and build something from scratch
 Join our global expansion outside Sweden's borders
 Great career opportunities within the Blingdale Group
 A clear development plan for you as an individual





Who are you?



- +3 years of experience within software development and/or operations
- Experience working with continuous integration and continuous delivery processes
- Experience with Google Cloud, alternatives Amazon Web Services or Azure




We also belive that you are accustomed to working independently and taking ownership of your own work. Further, you are analytical, good at digging into facts, understanding details and ensuring that frameworks are followed.

About Quiddly🎩

Quiddly, which is part of the Blingdale Group, is a software company that licenses and develops platforms for credit and invoice management. We are currently offering modules for invoicing, factoring and debt collection, and our integration engine Squidd. We own, develop and maintain all source code, while focusing on scalable, secure and flexible system architecture.

Quiddly’s concept is simple, but the solutions are advanced. Our customers can pick and choose from our presets to lay the foundation for a new fintech product. Everything is state of the art modular technology that integrates with all types of systems.

headline: Devops Engineer - DataOps
description.text:
WELCOME TO UTOPIA

Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia.

Funnily enough, so do we. Welcome to Utopia. Where music lives.

WHAT UTOPIANS DO

We are building a better world for music with innovative big data technology that tracks online music sources and translates them into meaningful music consumption reports for royalty collection. 

WHAT YOUR ROLE WILL BE

As a DataOps Engineer you’re part of the Engineering organization in the Infra team responsible for DevOps, DevSecOps, DataOps, and MLOps. In this role, you build tools and automate systems to improve our developer experience and operational excellence, which results in improved customer experience and value creation velocity. Your role is an important part of modernizing the music Industry.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

- Promoting a DataOps approach to the data and engineering team to automate the provision, the testing, the monitoring of the multiple databases, and to ensure optimized ETL solutions and data quality.
- Jointly with Data Engineers, design, model, develop and maintain large, complex data sets to support exploratory analysis, ad-hoc reporting and statistical model-building
- Jointly with the MLOps, promoting a DataOps approach to the data science delivery process to automate the provision of data, testing and monitoring to reduce development cycles and increase deployment frequency.
- Jointly with the DevOps, develop and deploy systems to ensure quality, reliability, and efficiency of data systems through automation
- In general, define and operate reliable data pipelines
- Build data tools/products to suit the specific needs of all our stakeholders


THE IDEAL SKILLSET

- University degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering (or comparable skills)
- Programming experience, preferably Python, Golang, Java and Node.js
- Experienced with BigQuery, MongoDB, SQL

- Exposed to working in a cloud environment, in particular GCP

- Experienced in CI/CD (deployment automation, Test automation, integrations)
- Highly knowledgable on data modeling (database selection and optimized models definition in regards to specific use-cases)
- Deep understanding of data integration and transformation patterns such as messaging, ETL
- Hands-on experience with traditional data warehouse technologies and Business Intelligence or visualization tools
- Experience in database optimization, data replication, database recovery, DR failover and HA solutions, and performance tuning


THE HIRING PROCESS


- We invite you for an introductory video call to get to know you better and share more about us
- You get a technical test and unlimited time to send us your solution
- You meet the internal team for the technical interview
- You meet the hiring manager for the culture fit interview


WHAT WE OFFER

- Great atmosphere - we live, love & breathe music & tech!
- Working in an impact oriented team.
- An experienced team to learn from, with experience in multiple startups and big tech companies.
- Benefits depend on location.
- Flexible remote policy so if you may prefer being on your own and working from home - we’re fine with that too.
- We are supporting work permits for employees that have already moved to our locations from countries outside the EU. However, we do not support relocation at the moment.


UTOPIANS

We come from diverse backgrounds and we welcome everyone who identifies with the above to apply. Welcome to Utopia - Where Music Lives!

We’re eager to meet you! :)

headline: System Developer -  Devops
description.text:
Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

It is in everything we do. From delivering a premium service to our operators, to creating an entertaining experience for the end user; we are unwavering in our mission to create the worlds’ leading sports betting experience.

System Developer with Devops skills

Kambi Development is constantly growing, and we are looking for more skilled people to further strengthen our development teams' ability to turn user stories into shippable code. We're dedicated to value driven development, think lean software development is a great way of achieving that, and use agile processes to support our efforts along the road.

Our team consists of 3 developers and one tester and are now looking to grow. We believe in passion for quality, taking ownership, being inventive and having a mindset that is open to giving and receiving feedback to improve as individuals. You will work in our office at Juvelen in central Uppsala, tapping into the spirit of starting up something new while being part and work in close cooperation with our Stockholm office and other offices around the world."

We are looking for someone who

• Has experience working in a DevOps environment.
• Has knowledge in migrating to cloud environment.
• Knows your way around containerisation and orchestration.
• Experience building scalable and maintainable systems that runs and fails gracefully.
• Use code reviewing and automated tests to ensure a high-quality product.

• Likes to do continuous integration and releasing our tested code into production

It would be really great you like to work with

• AWS
• K8S/EKS
• Terrafrom

• Java
• Kafka
• Kotlin
• Spring

• PostgreSQL
• Ansible
• JavaScript, TypeScript & React
• Functional Programming
• Git
• Kibana
• Docker

• IntelliJ
• Grafana/Graphite
• Atlassian suite

• Have good experience of working in an agile team developing, deploying and
• owning business critical systems
• Have demonstrated that you have the mindset and skills to become an
• effective part of a cross-functional, self-organizing, self-managing team
• Have both theoretical and practical knowledge of agile and/or lean software
• development
• Have the ability to write clean, well-structured and readable code


You'll like Kambi if you:

• Find technically complex systems thrilling
• Take pride in being good at what you do and doing it well
• Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team
• Thinks business value delivered is what defines great development
• Think common sense goes a long way


What’s in it for you?

• Opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company
• A fun and flexible working culture
• Ability to directly influence your and your teams’ work environment and processes
• Management who understands and appreciates agile
• International work environment

If you want to be part of a dedicated community of developers in central Uppsala, then please apply now!

headline: Systemtekniker till DevOps team!
description.text:
PengVin Affärssystem befinner sig i ett spännande skede, där kundernas verksamheter genomgår en intensiv digitalisering. Därmed är behovet av den typen av lösningar och funktionalitet som PengVin är experter på att ta fram mycket stort. Antalet förfrågningar om nya konsultjobb och ny funktionalitet är många, och uppdragen ramlar in i snabb takt.
Med sina drygt 20 anställda präglas PengVin som arbetsplats av en varm och familjär stämning. Graden av samarbete är högt, och man både tycker om, och har högt fokus på, att göra saker tillsammans. Om du lockas av det mindre sammanhanget, där beslut likaväl kan tas vid kaffebordet på fikarasten som i ett konferensrum, så erbjuder PengVin troligen helt arbetsmiljö för dig.
Här får du chansen att vara med på en spännande resa, där ett etablerat företag med gedigen kunskap om sin kund och dess branscher, med stora kliv är på väg in i nästa fas av sin utveckling. Tydlig tillväxt, men på stabila grunder, och med stort fokus på framtiden.




Är du serviceinriktad, trivs med kundkontakt och gillar både teknik och problemlösning?

PengVin Affärssystem befinner sig på en riktigt spännande resa och nu har du möjligheten att bli en viktig del av deras nysatsning när de ska gå från ”Good to Great”.
ArbetsuppgifterSom systemtekniker på PengVin har du mycket kontakter med externa kunder och partners. Du tar emot kundernas inkommande förfrågningar och önskemål, du analyserar och felsöker i systemet, inklusive integrationer och kringtjänster. Vid dagliga planeringsmöten fördelar du uppgifter till teamet, du är också den som driver på och följer upp att det blir gjort. Du är den som ansvarar för att informera kunderna om nya och uppdaterade funktioner i PengVins produkter och tjänster. Du jobbar kontinuerligt med att förbättra supportprocessen för att öka kundnöjdheten.

Det här är en direktrekrytering och du blir anställd av PengVin.

Vem är du?För tjänsten som systemtekniker söker vi en person som erfarenhet av liknande uppgifter. Vi söker dig som har övergripande kompetens om olika klienter; PC/Laptop, Mobila enheter etcetera Du behöver också kunskap om relationsdatabaser, programspråket SQL samt tidigare erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt. 

PengVin söker dig som verkligen trivs med mycket extern kundkontakt gillar att ge bra service. Vi söker en självgående person som är vill av att vara med och påverka och förbättra både för PengVin och för PengVins kunder.

Har du frågor om tjänsten eller PengVin? 
Urval och presentation sker löpande, vänta därför inte med att höra av dig.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

description.text:

Responsibilities
Design, implement, operate, and support large scale solutions for CI build automation as well as systems to support source code management.
Provide expert level support on the usage of the provided solutions.
Contribute to boosting team knowledge and continuous improvements.
Ability to work with a diverse set of tools and willing to invest time digging into problems and learning new things.

Required experience / skills
Documented experience of architecting, designing, implementing, documenting, testing, administrating, and operating solutions in an enterprise environment.

Experience from deployments in containers e.g. Docker.

Experience from provisioning tools, automation, and script languages including PowerShell, Bash, Ansible, Python.
Knowledge of setup/administration/usage of gating system like Zuul is meritorious.
Knowledge from version control systems like Git/Gerrit.
Software development knowledge with Python is meritorious.
Understanding of CI/CD – use and operations.
Knowledge from cloud-based deployments. Knowledge on AWS is meritorious.
Demonstrated ability to be a team player in a fast-paced environment.

Experience in the automotive industry is advantageous .
Experience from working in an agile framework.
Required Personality
Enjoy working in a collaborative and empowered team environment.
Able to work both within a given frame and with thinking outside the box.
Like technical challenges and to share knowledge.
Self-directed, organized, analytical, and results oriented. Proactive and responsible.
Comfortable working with in complex and global organisation. Able to work under rapidly changing conditions.

headline: Newly graduate/Junior DevOps Engineer
description.text:
THE POSITION:

We are looking for a newly graduated or Junior DevOps-engineer to our client. This is great opportunity for you as a junior to be mentored and learn from and a senior DevOps-engineer.

You will work with the existing and upcoming containerized solutions using containers and Kubernetes for both internal and external use. You will also be working on the existing development infrastructure, contribute with new ideas and be able to add new features.

Running and maintaining containers in Kubernetes and automate provisioning of infrastructure using Ansible.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:

You are educated in DevOps or have work experience in the field. Maybe you have studied a higher vocational education (YH) in DevOps and looking for your first opportunity?

You are driven and able to take initiative. You have an easy time cooperating with others and works well in a team environment. You are excellent oral and written communication in English.

ABOUT THE COMPANY:

They deliver the capability to implement enterprise grade PKI and signature systems ready to support solutions such as IoT, e-ID, e-Passports, authentication, digital signatures, code signing, and validation; all solutions where digital certificates would be a main enabler.

ABOUT THE EMPLOYMENT:

This is a consulting assignment which means that you will initially be employed by Friday. 

START DATE:

Immediately/Upon agreed start date

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:



Apply by clicking the link below. Remember to be quick with your application as we make continuous selection of candidates and the position can be filled before the application deadline is due.

ABOUT FRIDAY:

By being a partner to our clients and candidates, we strive to find the best match for you both. We achieve this by really getting to know our clients and candidate’s needs! Of course, we will ensure that requirements and skillsets match. But above all, we focus on the importance to find harmony between values ​​and corporate culture which both candidate and client considers optimal.

Our passion is to help people to the right position, workplace and context and we work in the field between IT and Technology. 

We mainly focusing on young engineers who are at the beginning of their careers or soon concluding college / university within the IT and Technology field.

Our belief is that people reach their fullest potential when looking forward to going to work each morning. "Friday - everyday", how about that?

headline: Cloudutvecklare, Service och Devops
description.text:
Taekwondo-tränare, biodlare eller hobbyfiskare? Just nu söker vi en cloudutvecklare med fler intressen än bara jobbet.

Dina talanger och erfarenheter berikar. De bidrar till en större förståelse för människors vardag och den värld vi alla lever i samt gör CPAC Systems till en roligare arbetsplats att jobba på. När du, humleodlaren och filatelisten hamnar i möte med hemmasnickaren tar ni er an de kreativa utmaningarna på andra sätt än när ni bara har på er ingenjörshatten. Ni hittar smartare lösningar som gör livet lättare för våra kunder ute på deras arbetsplatser, inte bara ute i lastbilen, grävmaskinen, asfaltsläggaren, dumpern utan även för dem på sitekontoret.

Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens produkter inom bland annat automation, styrning, HMI och när vi tar steget bortom maskinerna och skapar kraftfulla lösningar för både webben och mobila enheter? Alltsammans uppkopplat i real-tid baserat på vår egen cloud-lösning. Har du andra erfarenheter än de som syns på visitkortet eller examensbeviset? Välkommen att leda och utveckla fordonsbranschen tillsammans med oss.

Det här vill vi att du ska göra

Som cloudutvecklare på CPAC får du jobba med de roligaste, men också de mest utmanande projekten inom vår bransch. Du arbetar tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor i ett utvecklingsteam med fokus på att skapa framtidens produkter. Eftersom vi är ett produktbolag kommer du att vara med hela vägen från idé till färdig produkt. Kraven som ställs på användarvänlighet och värdeskapande funktioner är mycket höga vilket gör att samarbetet mellan kunder, utvecklare och provning är otroligt viktigt. Du arbetar tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor i projektteamet med fokus på att verkligen göra skillnad för våra kunder.

Organisationen är platt och rättfram i en bransch där utvecklingen går mycket snabbt framåt, där du kommer att vara direkt involverad i det som händer.

Det här är du

Vi söker dig som tycker att cloudutveckling är bland det roligaste som finns. Då våra team jobbar brett med produkten och kundvärdet i fokus får du gärna även ha intresse för systemutveckling, testutveckling och allt annat som krävs för att sätta en framgångsrik produkt på marknaden. Du håller dig uppdaterad på vad som händer inom dina specialområden och delar med dig av din expertkunskap som vi tror du fått genom några års erfarenhet av att arbeta med:

 - Devops, Golang, Java, SQL/databaser, Git/SVN, Spring, Linuxmiljöer, Kommunikation via http, websockets, REST eller GRPC.

Har du även erfarenhet inom följande områden så är det meriterande:

 - Kotlin, Node, Kubernetes, Helm, AWS, Docker/Micro-services, Ingress, Ambassador, Javascript, Typescript.

Utöver intresse för just cloudutveckling är du en bra kollega och gillar kreativ friktion. Du tar dig tid att lyssna samtidigt som du gillar fart. Och såklart är du van vid att kommunicera på både på svenska och engelska.

I vår värld rekryterar vi personligheter. Känner du att det här är något för dig vill vi gärna veta vem du är.

headline: DevOps Engineer • Platform
description.text:
In 2021, Zettle became ZettlebyPayPal to go further in its mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. By offering the tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow, we are empowering them to reach their full potential. Together, we’re extraordinary. Together, we’re made for more and the best is yet to come. Our journey in putting an end to ordinary and redefine financial freedom is just starting. 


As we continue our quest to democratize financial services, our Platforms Alliance is on the lookout for a passionate engineer to join our Platform Services Team. In this role, you will get the opportunity to co-tackle a wide variety of challenges together with a group of talented people driven by a shared ambition to create hassle-free solutions enabling our internal customers i.e feature teams.
A glimpse of what you will get here
Simply stated, our day-to-day mission essentially consists in providing the best platform experience for our feature teams. As a member of Platform Services, you will be jointly responsible for the daily's operations of our infrastructure systems and everything “platform” that allow millions of transactions to flow through our system every day.
As a member of the wider platform area you would be able to make a difference in a more general direction around shared DevOps domains between the platform teams such as infrastructure and monitoring and collaborate on POC work and larger projects.

While we will be here to support you, we think that the following skills and know-how would help you to be successful:

Be able to write clean code in a language or two to create tooling (Python, Golang or Java).
A passion to automate away repetitive tasks and increase efficiency.
Experience with Docker.
Extolls the behaviors and understanding associated with "DevOps" and "SRE".
Understands the developer perspective of platforms/systems.
Great collaboration skills.


You are a true team player known for being reliable, curious and bold.
You are willing and able to communicate well and include yourself in group discussions.
You gladly share your knowledge, experience and opinions while understanding and respecting that the last word comes from the team.

Where does the magic happen?
We look forward moving into our brand-new office in the middle of the Tech Hub in central Stockholm (Sweden).
Go on, bring your talent to our attention!
If you're ready to take things further, hit Apply & let's talk!

headline: DevOps till energisektorn, Stockholm
description.text:
Om konsultuppdraget

- Ort: Stockholm
- Uppdragslängd: ca. 12 månader
- Sista ansökningsdagen: ansök snarast
- Uppdragsstart: Enl. ök.
- Omfattning: 100%
- OBS! Det är väldigt viktigt att du uppfyller skall-kraven för att vi överhuvudtaget ska kunna offerera dig, annars förkastar beställaren vårt anbud omgående där både din tid resp. vår tid går till spillo.


Bakgrund

Kunden arbetar med att bygga upp och förstärka sin egen förmåga kring IT-systemutveckling och stöd för IT-leveransen, där flera nya verktyg, men även införandet av containerplattform ingår. Viktiga beståndsdelar i detta arbete är förändrade arbetssätt inom deras agila team som bygger på införandet av DevOps. Parallellt etableras en förvaltningsorganisation för att ge stöd till utvecklingsteamen och organisationen kring dessa förmågor. För kunden är IT-säkerhet ett viktigt område som påverkar alla delar inom IT-systemutveckling och IT-leverans. Nu behöver kunden förstärka med en DevOps-konsult med fokus på säkerhet.

Uppdragsbeskrivning

Kunden har behov av en konsult som DevOps Engineer med fokus på DevSecOps till deras IT-förvaltning som ska stödja deras agila systemutvecklingsprojekt där även CI/CD och containerplattformar ingår. Rollen innebär dels att vara med och driva, införa och vidareutveckla DevOps-baserat arbetssätt med fokus IT-säkerhet och dels att stödja projekt och förvaltningar att kontinuerligt använda arbetssätt som bygger på DevSecOps-principer. Uppdraget omfattar både arbetsuppgifter av mer koordinerande och planerade karaktär samt mer praktiska och operativa arbetsuppgifter som kan komma att ske hands-on i deras plattformar och system. Konsulten kommer arbeta tillsammans med pågående projekt inom området och andra IT-förvaltningar.

Säkerhetsprövning

Säkerhetsprövning kommer att krävas med anledning av att personen kommer hantera hemliga uppgifter. För aktuellt uppdrag krävs säkerhetsskyddsavtal 2 med samt registerkontroll av aktuell konsult för uppdraget. Processen för upprättande av SUA-avtal beräknas ta ca 8 till 10 veckor men kan både ta längre och kortare tid. Om upprättandet av SUA-avtal och registerkontroll blir klar innan angiven tidplan för uppdragsstart ser Kunden gärna att konsulten påbörjar sitt uppdrag tidigare i överenskommelse med aktuell beställare från Kunden.

Obligatoriska kompetenser och erfarenhet (skallkrav):

- Högskole-/universitetsutbildning omfattande minst 120p/180hp inom IT, alternativt motsvarande utbildning eller arbetslivserfarenhet
- Skall ha arbetat med DevSecOps och/eller DevOps där arbete med IT-säkerhetshöjande aktiviteter har ingått i minst 3 år.
- Skall ha arbetat som systemutvecklare i minst 3 år.
- Skall kunna använda svenska och engelska som dagligt arbetsspråk både skriftligt och muntligt.


Meriterande kompetenser och erfarenhet (börkrav):

- Arbetat med både införande av DevOps- och/eller DevSecOps-baserat arbetssätt och verktyg under minst två år
- Arbetat med införande av agila arbetssätt i minst tre team
- Arbetat med standarder och ramverk inom IT-säkerhetsområdet, t.ex. ISO27001 i minst 3 år
- Arbetat med scriptning i Linux- eller Windows-miljö under minst 3 år


Annat

Nedanstående personliga egenskaper säkerställs via referenser och vid eventuell intervju. Kunden förbehåller sig rätten att kontakta egna relevanta referenser (än de som leverantören själv angivit) för att säkerställa uppfyllande av krav.

- God samarbetsförmåga och initiativförmåga
- Flexibel och anpassningsbar efter arbetsbelastning
- Utåtriktad och tydlig i sin kommunikation
- Ödmjuk och ha lätt för att skapa förtroende
- Arbetar självständigt och målinriktat
- Fallenhet för administrativa arbetsuppgifter
- Förmåga att arbeta i grupp


______________________

Hur du kommer vidare

- Sök uppdraget genom denna annons
- I ansökan anger du ett kravställt timpris
- Lägg in ett CV i word-format
- Vi återkopplar genom plattformen om något behöver kompletteras eller förtydligas.
- Återkoppling sker vanligtvis från Kunden till oss inom 10 arbetsdagar  från det att ansökningstiden utgått. Vi försöker återkoppla omgående till dig som kandidat snarast vi har ny information avseende din ansökan eller uppdraget. Skulle återkoppling dröja, vänligen kontakta oss via plattformen.


Inför en eventuell intervju meddelas du om vilken kunden är i god tid.



Konsult- och kompetenspartner inom IT, Management och Teknik.

Vi lägger ett stort fokus på kund-/konsultpartnernöjdhet och kvalité i våra leveranser och verkar idag i hela Sverige med utgångspunkt i Stockholm. Vårt motto är därför Ödmjukhet, Ihärdighet samt Flexibilitet.

Varmt välkommen att höra av dig vid frågor eller funderingar.

Annonsförsäljare undanbedes.

headline: DevOps Engineer to Swedbank
description.text:
Then the key-role as DevOps Engineer to Swedbank’s team “Pega CoE” might be the right next step for you.

You will lead the DevOps journey for the Pega application, help building Continuous Delivery pipelines, improve the area of test automation and achieve Software-Defined Everything (SDx). Sounds interesting? 


In this role as DevOps Engineer you will be part of an experienced team – the Pega Centre of Excellence (CoE) team at Swedbank. As DevOps Engineer, you will play a central role in the prioritized and strategic vision for Swedbank overall.

Your will get the opportunity to:
  Deliver platform services and expertise guidance to the development teams.
 Securing a stable platform by proactive drive development, monitoring, configuring and troubleshooting of the Pega platform.
 Be responsible for development and lifecycle of the Pega DevOps pipelines.
 Act as a consultant for questions in DevOps and cloud strategy.
 Collaborate with external vendor (Pegasystems) to taking the next step for the DevOps journey.

You will work across seven business areas and be part of leading the DevOps journey for the Pega application(s). It is a great opportunity to get to know many different parts of the bank and to continuously get personal as well as technical development. You will be placed at Swedbank’s HQ in Sundbyberg.

Is this you?

  Experience from working as a DevOps Engineer, in a leading position

 Extensive experience in SW development life cycle

 Deep understanding of application structure including hardware and integrations to systems

Knowledge on cloud technologies like Azure and AWS are meritorious. Experience from working with a BPM tool is not mandatory but also an advantage.

Personality wise, it is important that you have great communication skills as you will be in contact with many different departments internally as well as external consultants and vendors. It is important that you are pedagogic and comfortable in facilitating workshops. You are a true team-player who gets energy of achieving common goals but are also self-driven and used to take own initiatives. You are curious and driven by learning new things and to develop.


In this process Swedbank is working with Level Recruitment.

headline: Molnexpert - DevOps Specialist
description.text:
Vill du jobba i ett självstyrande team med moderna tekniker och nära samarbete med andra utvecklingsteam? Brinner du för att vara med och utveckla produkter som gör skillnad för demokratin, samhället och det fria ordet? Då kommer du att trivas på Bonnier News – Sveriges största mediehus där vi nu tar nästa steg i att skapa morgondagens journalistik.

Vi är i en spännande fas där vi lägger grunden för den framtida driften av de tekniska plattformarna till Bonnier News många kända varumärken. Tyngdpunkten ligger i att bygga upp infrastruktur i Googles molnplattform. Kopplat till detta så söker vi en DevOps-expert som vill vara med och bygga en av Mediesveriges mest moderna och progressiva utvecklingsorganisationer.

Om teamet:

Du kommer vara en del av ett engagerat team som stöttar de olika utvecklingsteamen inom Bonnier News Tech gällande användning av molntjänster, CDN och annan infrastruktur. I rollen kommer du jobba nära våra DevOps-specialister och utvecklare samt övriga team-medlemmar som är placerade i Stockholm och Mellerud. Du kan räkna med visst distansarbete, men du bör kunna vara på plats 2-3 dagar per vecka.

Vi jobbar mycket med, och värdesätter, samarbete. Både inom teamet och i olika samarbeten med varumärkenas utvecklingsteam. Detta tar sig ofta uttryck i par-/mobbprogrammering, inte sällan över teamgränserna. På så sätt är vi både stöd till utvecklingsteamen och har inflytande på teknikval, strukturer och best practices.

Några av de vanligaste teknikerna hos oss i dagsläget:

 -
Docker.

 -
Kubernetes, speciellt Openshift.

 -
Tjänster inom GCP, men även AWS.

 -
Elasticsearch, MongoDB, Redis, PostgreSQL.

 -
NodeJS och Golang.


Din erfarenhet:

Vi söker dig som har jobbat med några av de ovan nämnda tekniker, gärna med fokus på infrastruktur och DevOps. Du är prestigelös och gillar att samarbeta med andra i autonoma team. Bonnier News jobbar målmedvetet med frågor som berör mångfald och vill ta tillvara de kvaliteter som det tillför verksamheten. Vi värdesätter också engagemang i den digital transformation som vi befinner oss i för att göra vår journalistik och våra tjänster ännu mer tillgängliga för ännu fler.

Övrig information

Bonnier News Tech har tre hubbar; Stockholm, Sundsvall och Malmö. I den här rollen har du möjlighet att jobba på den plats, av dessa tre som passar dig bäst. 

Urvalet till den här tjänsten sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt genom att trycka på ansök-knappen nedan. Med anledning av GDPR har vi inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via email.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, hoppas vi hörs!


Inom Bonnier News värnar vi om det fria ordet och gör skillnad genom journalistik som når och berör många. Vi är Sveriges ledande mediehus med varumärken som Dagens Nyheter, Expressen och Dagens industri når vi miljoner läsare och användare varje dag. Genom Bonnier News Local har vi även ett stort lokalt engagemang - från Sydsvenskan i söder till Örnsköldsviks Allehanda i norr. Förutom detta ger vi också ut branschspecifika tidningar såsom Dagens Media, Resumé, Dagens medicin och Fastighetsnytt, och även en rad livsstilsmagasin som Damernas Värld, Sköna Hem, Teknikens Värld och Allt om Mat m.fl. Genom att ständigt driva den digitala utvecklingen framåt når vi hela tiden längre - som medarbetare hos oss kan du påverka riktningen.

headline: DevOps Engineer to Bluestep
description.text:
Bluestep is since 2005 a modern and solution-oriented lender that today offer mortgages in Sweden, Norway and Finland. Bluestep´s mission is to help customers who cannot obtain a loan at a traditional bank for various reasons. We see a possibility to change people´s lives for the better, when it comes to their financial situation. 

Today we have over 20 000 mortgage customers. We have a leading digital focus which will only increase in the upcoming years. We are on an exciting journey of growth in search of new stars that is passionate about improving lives of others.

What you will do

As DevOps Engineer you will be given the unique opportunity of implementing a DevOps culture at Bluestep and to inspire others in how to build our future. You will join us on our transformation into Azure, where you will have the opportunity to have a big impact on choosing, designing and building the solutions. As DevOps Engineer you will work closely with our development team to innovate our systems and to build new Kubernetes clusters. You will be a part of our Operations team and within the DevOps-life cycle your responsibility will be to deploy, operate and monitor. Furthermore you will work closely together with both our Security and Compliance team.

Who are you?

We believe that you have a few years of experience working within either development or operations. You are a good communicator within the team and towards other stakeholders. You are comfortable with sharing your knowledge to others and have an “automation first” mindset.

We see that you have background in working with either Azure or similar cloud service provider. We also believe that you have experience within Infrastructure as Code (Bicep/Terraform/Cloudformation), CI/CD and are familiar with Rest APIs and CLIs.

We are really impressed if you also:

- Have experience within Kubernetes

- Have knowledge within Powershell and/or Python, Bash, C#
- Knowledge within Azure AD, Azure DevOps, Azure Networking (ER; AZFW), Azure policies
- Experience within Pipeline as Code


Your future colleagues says that:

In my role at Bluestep I get to design and implement a secure, reliable and automated Azure platform. For me, one of the best things is that I get to work closely with the developers & security to help architect new solutions and be part of an awesome team!"





Does this sound interesting? Interviews are held continuously, please submit your application today. 

We look forward to your application!

headline: DevOps Specialist in Gothenburg
description.text:
We are looking for a DevOps Specialist to our client in the Automotive indsutry.

This is a unique opportunity to join us in our journey building an agile and high-performing SW department working with the latest products and brands on the market.


You will primarily be working with highly skilled app teams doing both in-car and off board apps and you will be shaping your role and leading the way into the future.
We also have teams of machine learning and AI developers/engineers working with innovation projects for the mobility of tomorrow on the same department that might need your expertise, but your focus will to begin with be on the projects and products in production.


We expect you to be the kind of person that thrives in an environment where not everything is defined, and a solution needs to be defined and implemented with emphasis on automation, speed and reliability. You will work closely with the developers leading the way to create continuous integration/deployment pipelines and coach them to develop a well-suited development environment that helps us achieve higher quality and throughput.


You need to be pragmatic, self-driven, curious, and flexible with a “we’ll find a way”-attitude.

Responsibilities
Mentoring and enabling the app-teams to create pipelines for CI/CD that would support our teams to integrate and test their software faster and improve their efficiency
Mentoring the app-teams with automation of our products within DevOps environment
Lead the department to implement the DevOps culture with best practices and training
Being up to date with the latest concepts and technology, guiding the teams in continuously improving the DevOps culture
Helping the teams setup a structure working with external partners in an automated way and with customized solutions in a complex environment
Enabling the teams to identify and use relevant metrics for the products and services
Assess infrastructure needs in new products/requirements
Help the team setup monitoring and create awareness of the status of their products


Qualifications
M.Sc. Electrical, or Computer Engineering, or equivalent work experience
+5 years’ experience in at least one high level programming language (Java, Kotlin, Swift)
Solid experience in working with devops for mobile apps
Solid knowledge and skills in unit testing, build pipes and CI/CD
Experience and understanding in using agile methodology

Valuable skills:


Solid experience in various CI/CD and infrastructure tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Gitlab
Solid experience in various deployment strategies (A/B testing, blue/green deployment)
Experience in working with a cloud provider (Azure, GCP etc)
Experience in Git and Gitlab
Experience in DevSecOps is a merit
Experience in Microservice architecture is merited


Application
Interviews and selection will take place on an ongoing basis. 

For us at Randstad, it is important that all skills in the labor market are utilized. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity.

For more information:


About the company
We also offer interim management, executive search and outplacement services. We have a large network of clients and candidates, which means that we convey hundreds of jobs within different industries all over Sweden. Our ambition is to be the best employer in the market.

By combining our passion for people with the power of today’s technology, we help people and organizations to reach their true potential. We call it Human Forward.

Competency prerequisites
6-9 years of experience in Azure DevOps Pipelines Scripting.

Location: (Stockholm)/Remote
Looking forward to your applications

headline: Team Engineering Manager Devops
description.text:
HaleyTek is a joint venture between Volvo Cars and ecarx. We’re on a mission to develop software for Android-based Infotainment systems, for current and future Volvo and Polestar models. We will also make this software available for other brands, mainly within the Geely group. Our focus is on the platform software that enables navigation, media, voice assistants and other services to run on cutting-edge hardware. Quite simply, we want to change the world.

If you want to develop Infotainment SW together with big players like Google, Volvo Cars and Geely Group but keep the startup setup of a company, you will feel right at home with us.

As a Devops team, we also make sure our developer has the right equipment and infrastructure to be at our best.

We are now looking for a Engineering Team Manager - Devops

As a team manager you will together with our Agile leaders be a part of building an outstanding team and develop our key asset, our individuals. Together with our Product Owner you will work and support the strategic product roadmap.

You and your skills

You set the context for our team to navigate in the daily work. You have the ability to see and find the skills needed to deliver on our mission. You are passionate to be part of building and expanding our company both in capacity, culture and product portfolio.

Our culture

As a flat organization we build an accountable culture that enables the teams to influence, and makes quick decisions and actions possible. Everyone is willing and able to pitch in and do hands on jobs when needed. In line with this, you will also have the opportunity to influence the development of this role.

We are a professional, energetic and friendly team, working in a modern office at the waterfront of Lindholmen, Göteborg. Our developers are working with cutting edge equipment and advanced hi-tech computers. We offer competitive benefits, such as maximum taxfree fitness allowance.

If you believe that work should be fun and that a workplace should be defined by inclusion, diversity and an open-minded, ‘in it together’, mentality

Come and join us on our journey!


Please note that due to GDPR regulations we can only accept applications and CV's sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

headline: Devops ingenjör till Handelsbanken
description.text:
Handelsbanken är ett företag med en stark tro på den enskilda individens förmåga och kan erbjuda dig utmaningar och möjligheter att utvecklas i ett företag som befinner sig mitt i en spännande digitaliseringsresa. Just nu söker vi dig med stort IT-intresse som vill joina oss under denna resa. Din främsta uppgift är att effektivisera utvecklarnas vardag. Så om du drivs av att göra livet enklare för andra är detta uppdrag just för dig.

Din vardag

På avdelningen för IT-styrning ansvarar vi bland annat för applikationsramverk och utvecklarstöd och arbetar dagligen med att effektivisera och förbättra IT-leveransen. I dagsläget består området 4 team som jobbar agilt och tvärfunktionellt med omväxlande och intressanta uppgifter.

Du kommer att ingå i vårt Devops Toolchain team som ansvarar för bankens CI/CD plattformar där du kommer ha en ledande roll och tar ett stort ansvar för våra leveranser och bidrar med kunskap och engagemang genom hela processen.

Vem är du

För att lyckas i din roll ser vi det som krav att du har dessa kompetenser i bagaget:

- Kunskaper inom DevOps Toolchains (provat på olika CI/CD verktyg)

- Erfarenhet av verktyg som UrbanCode Deploy, Ansible, TeamCity eller andra typer av deploy verktyg
- Goda kunskaper om pipelines för build och deploy processer
- Erfarenhet av Git
- Kommunicera på svenska och engelska på en professionell nivå
- Har en akademisk utbildning som Systemvetare, civil ingenjör eller annan relevant bakgrund

 Det är även meriterande att du är intresserad av IT-säkerhet och nätverk

För att trivas hos oss och känna att du har hamnat hos likasinnade människor är det viktigt att du är positiv och mån om vilken energi du tar med dig till jobbet. Du är lösningsorienterad och har förmågan att hitta nya vägar framåt. Du är generös med att dela med dig av dina kunskaper och erfarenheter så ni som grupp blir starkare och smartare tillsammans. Du har lätt för att kommunicera ut komplexitet på ett förenklat sätt. Sist med inte minst ansvarstagande!

Vill du veta mer

I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Nexer Recruit. 

Välkommen med din ansökan på www.nexerrecruit.com/jobb. Då urval och intervjuer sker löpande ber vi dig skicka din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

headline: DevOps Engineer to Solidify
description.text:
Join us in Solidifying Software Engineering!

Founded in 2012, we have delivered over 850 successful projects, and among us are several Microsoft MVPs and published authors. We are also an active contributor to the DevOps community and co-founder of the popular Global DevOps Bootcamp. In addition, Great Place to Work ranked number 19 on their top list for small companies in 2019.

What will you do?

As a DevOps Engineer at Solidify, you will support teams in creating and maintaining effective development processes, with the aim of shortening production processes and limiting time to market.

You will also support teams in the construction and deployment of software. This is done through the implementation of modern development tools, continuous delivery, container technology, and cloud solutions. Developing customized tools for even more integrated development toolchains will also be of focus.

As a member of the DevOps team, you will be able to work within various development platforms in changing environments, a great opportunity to fully explore the world of DevOps. It doesn’t matter if you’re fresh or experienced within DevOps, we believe we could have a role that fits you!

Who are you?

Thus, an integral aspect of the role revolves around being solution-oriented with the customer’s needs in mind. Being adaptable and eager to learn are also driving factors that will help you succeed as a DevOps Engineer!

We think that you have experience within:

- CI/CD (Primarily Azure DevOps)

- Container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes, etc)
- Infrastructure as Code (Bicep, Ansible, Terraform, etc)


We would also love to see:

- A relevant University Degree
- Experience in Software Development and Operations
- Hands-on experience from DevOps


Does this sound interesting? If the answer is yes - how lovely! We are looking forward to your application.
