headline: DevOps Engineer at Toyota
description.text:
We at Toyota are looking for DevOps engineers that can further strengthen our growing software development organisation at R&D.

 As a DevOPS Engineer at Toyota R&D you will:

 * Work with all our software development teams and products.
 * Improve and introduce new software development tools.
 * Automate workflows with scripts or other tools to make our development process more efficient
 * Standardise way of working for software developers, repos, tools, CI/CD pipelines, release management, connection to issue management systems...
 * Manage our Azure cloud subscription and configuration of Azure DevOps.
 * Support re-use of common software components in Toyota products.
 * Coordinate activities with Toyota IS/IT.

Our software organisation is growing, we are adding new teams and software components - both for embedded- and cloud based applications. As a DevOps engineer you will have the possibility to work across all teams and support them with expert knowledge of our tools and processes. As a DevOps engineer you will learn our products and their code base, while focusing on how to increase our efficiency via automation or usage of new or existing tools. As a DevOps engineer you probably have a software developer background but have developed knowledge of or want to become a tool smith that makes your colleagues smile when they use your latest scripts or standardized tool setup.

At Toyota in Mjölby you will see your efforts result in a complete product, our fork-lifts. As a developer you are expected from time to time to test new software or solutions on fork-lifts in our lab. Fork-lift driver licence is included in the employment.

Development is primarily done in various scripting languages and configuration files.

What is Toyota Material Handling?

At our site in Mjölby, 3,000 employees work with material handling from development concepts to manufactured vehicles. Our product range goes from loyal servants such as manual hand trucks to autonomous self-driving 1.5 tonne vehicles and innovative energy solutions. With us, the employee is central and our employees describe us as a friendly company with a focus on personal development, personal responsibility and health.

 Sustainable employer

At Toyota, we strive to be a sustainable employer through our outstanding environmental work and our personnel policy. We currently have, among other things, a carbon-neutral production and a KRAV-labelled staff restaurant. Furthermore, we offer our staff good training opportunities through group training eight times a week and a newly renovated gym.

Commuting

We have good commuting opportunities by commuter trains and car from most cities in Östergötland, 30 minutes from Linköping and 20 minutes from Motala. We offer free parking within 5 minutes of your workplace with free access to engine heaters.

Your Application

Does it sound interesting? In that case, apply before 2021-10-31 . We work with ongoing selection, so send in your application today.

Feel free to contact our employees for more information:







Instagram: ToyotaMHsweden
Linkedin: Toyota Material Handling Manufacturering Sweden AB
Youtube: Toyota Material Handling

Your profile

 * Master or Bachelor in Engineering, other relevant technical college education or vocational education combined with work experience.
 * Experience of software development, CI/CD and git
 * Knowledge of various scripting languages
 * Azure and Azure DevOps knowledge is a plus, but not mandatory
 * A broad interest in technology and good problem-solving ability

headline: Junior DevOPS till Telia!
description.text:
Nu söker vi för Telias räkning en driven, nyfiken och framförallt DevOPS intresserad person som vill vara med på deras fortsatta resa. I rollen som junior DevOPS hos Telia är målet att du ska utvecklas. Med andra ord söker vi inte nödvändigtvis dig som har en massa erfarenhet inom DevOPS området utan vi söker dig om vill lära sig, vara med och utvecklas inom området och som framförallt har ett stort tekniskt intresse. Välkommen in med din ansökan!

OM TJÄNSTEN
Du kommer bli en del av Telias Monitoring team inom Assurance Services inom Telia IT som ständigt arbetar med att förenkla och automatisera aktiviteter internt och för att stötta medarbetare. Du kommer bli en del av ett team som består av många olika kompetenser och tillsammans skapa nästa generation av IT monitoring för deras medarbetare samt externa kunder. Idag arbetar det både operativt samt ständigt arbetar för att utveckla deras plattformar genom att använda agila metoder.

Du erbjuds

Här erbjuds du den unika möjligheten att få komma in i en stor, internationell organisation och verkligen få utvecklas ”from scratch”.

Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuder vi stora möjligheter för dig att växa professionellt, bygga ditt nätverk och skapa värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande.

ARBETSUPPGIFTER
- Arbeta med att förenkla och automatisera aktiviteter internt och för att stötta intressenter internt.
- Arbeta både operativt samt ständigt arbetar för att utveckla deras plattformar genom att använda agila metoder.

VI SÖKER DIG SOM
- Har en avklarad gymnasial utbildning, gärna från teknik/data linje
- Har ett stort tekniskt intresse för programmering/data som framgår i ditt CV eller ansökan. Vi ser gärna att du har en vana att bygga egna datorer eller kan uppvisa annat teknisk hårdvaru/mjukvaru intresse.
- Talar och skriver flytande svenska och engelska då båda språken används dagligen i organisationen och i teamet

I och med att vi har begränsade krav för tjänsten kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Vi söker dig som känner stort ansvar för ditt arbete och som gärna lär dig nya saker. Du har en förmåga att själv ansvara för din egna utveckling men drar dig inte för att fråga när du inte vet eller kan. I övrigt tror vi att du har en god samarbetsförmåga och tycker om att prata med olika människor.



Övrig information

Start: Enligt överenskommelse

Omfattning: Heltid, tillsvidare

Placering: Stockholm, Solna

Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och kundens önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten hanteras av Academic Work.

Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals- och intervjufasen.

headline: Senior/Lead Software Engineer DevOps
description.text:
Want to be part of the change? We're expanding several of our engineering teams!


What you'll get to do


Developer Services' goal is to enable Klarna’s engineers to build features at scale with the security and reliability that you should expect from a modern bank. We understand that the best way to do this is to empower Klarna’s engineers by providing great tooling and services to support best practices with a minimal amount of effort. We believe that the best solutions involve not just automation or configuration as code but also a deep understanding of how a developer might want things to work.


In practical terms this means paying attention to details that make the developer’s experience better and constantly evaluating whether we’ve found the right balance between making a developer’s job easier and enabling them to own their solutions. We are looking for passionate engineering managers to join us.


Some of the things you’ll get to work with
Creating libraries and tooling to enable seamless integration of services we use - AWS, Datadog, Sentry, Jenkins, etc.
Providing an easy to use and secure platform for container orchestration built on ECS
Identifying and building solutions that raise the level of quality across an organisation of 1,000+ engineers - from well-supported build pipelines to best-in-class observability. Ultimately, success here will drive better experiences for our over 10M consumers, 100,000 merchants operating in 14 countries.
Automating processes within cloud operations, security configuration, account management, cost optimisations, etc.



You should have
Experience with general software development with a passion for automation.
Use of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery. 
Hands-on experience with containers and related technologies.
Experience with cloud providers, preferably AWS.
Experience with infrastructure as code tooling and a matching mindset.



What we can offer you





Learning - We have a learning and development focused environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing, training, and regular internal technical talks.


Compensation - You’ll receive an attractive salary, pension, and insurance plans, plus we offer all of our employees an opportunity to invest in a RSU program and own a stake of the company. You’ll also receive 30 days annual leave and since we recognise that life is about more than work, we also offer benefits for gym memberships, marathons, and all sorts of activities that promote physical health. We also have generous parental leave (for men and women).

headline: Systemutvecklare med inriktning DevOps
description.text:
Vill du att varje dag ska vara den viktigaste? Vi spelar en central roll i att upprätthålla rättssäkerheten i vårt samhälle. Gå in på www.aklagare.se och läs mer om vår spännande verksamhet.

ÅM2022-492

Åklagarmyndigheten står inför många spännande utmaningar de kommande åren. Med ett närmande till Europa, många pågående lagstiftningsprocesser inom områden som berör oss samt en allt snabbare digitalisering inom rättsväsendet ställs allt större krav på myndighetens it-utveckling. Till enheten för it-utveckling på Åklagarmyndighetens huvudkontor söker vi en Systemutvecklare med inriktning mot DevOps.

Dina arbetsuppgifter

På enheten för it-utveckling arbetar projektledare, systemutvecklare och jurister tätt tillsammans. Arbetet bedrivs till stor del i projektform vilket gör ditt arbete både flexibelt och variationsrikt med goda möjligheter att själv påverka ditt arbete. Vår huvudsakliga användargrupp är våra åklagare och administratörer och de ställer höga krav på våra system.

Cåbra är deras primära verksamhetssystem dygnet runt, årets alla dagar.

Under pågående projekt har vi alla olika arbetsuppgifter men jobbar tillsammans i utvecklingsgrupper. Vi arbetar tätt tillsammans med myndighetens övriga organisation, inte minst våra medarbetare på kammare och specialenheter, men även exempelvis med våra utvecklingscentrum och med tillsyns- och rättsavdelning. Vi arbetar också ofta tillsammans med externa parter såsom exempelvis Polismyndigheten och Domstolsverket och i vissa fall även med andra EU-länder och EU-institutioner.

Du kommer att arbeta med konfigurations- och versionshantering av våra egenutvecklade system. Du ser till att automatisera och övervaka vår byggprocess. Du är själv systemutvecklare i grunden och är verksam i gränslandet mellan utveckling och drift och bistår i utvecklingen av den underliggande infrastruktur som våra egenutvecklade system driftsätts i. Du är med och driftsätter nya versioner av våra system till test, utbildningsmiljöer och även till produktionsmiljön.

Dina kvaliteter och kvalifikationer

Vi söker dig som har:

Högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom systemvetenskap, dataingenjör, annan it-inriktning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet

Erfarenhet av konfigurations- och versionshantering samt automation av stöd till systemutvecklingsprocesser
Goda kunskaper i svenska i tal och skrift
Det är meriterande om du har

erfarenhet av Docker, Kubernetes eller Podman
erfarenhet av JIRA, Subversion
erfarenhet av arbete inom statlig verksamhet
erfarenhet av Oracle Database, iipax SHS
Som person ser vi gärna att du är drivande, självgående och strukturerad och vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.

Om anställningen

Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning med en provanställning om 6 månader.

Tester förekommer i rekryteringsprocessen.

Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och därmed sker säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav för denna anställning.

På grund av arkivbestämmelser sparar vi ansökningar i två år. När du ansöker kommer dina personuppgifter att behandlas enligt offentlighetsprincipen samt dataskyddsförordningen. När du skickar din ansökan till oss, samtycker du till detta

Åklagarmyndigheten som arbetsgivare

På Åklagarmyndigheten känner vi stolthet när vi går till jobbet. Tillsammans är vi 1 700 engagerade och kompetenta medarbetare som står upp för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och demokratiska värden. Oavsett roll i myndigheten så bidrar alla till vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag.

Vill du bli en del av Åklagarmyndigheten? Vi strävar efter att vara en välkomnande och inkluderande arbetsplats som speglar samhällets mångfald.

Ansök redan i dag!

headline: Software Engineer // Devops
description.text:
Description
As a DevOps team member, you will develop an automated process for building and testing software which is constructed with model-based design and C/C++ code. This automated process handles all the required steps for creating and delivering a binary file ready to be downloaded to cars.
 You will be a part of a team responsible for deciding the future of our Software Factory with its CI/CD system to support hundreds of developers.

 • Develop and maintain an automated process to assure software quality
 • Maintain and update current scripts/tools to support an evolving software
 • Evaluate and develop new tools to support developers
 Required qualifications:
 • Master of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent
 • Expertise working with C/C++ and Python
 • Experience working with continuous integration tools
 • Understanding of software development workflow and processes
 Meritorious:
 • Zuul
 • Experience in software development for embedded systems
 • Git/Gerrit
 • Ansible

 • Docker

 • Matlab
 • Understanding of model-based systems, Simulink/TargetLink
 • Experience with issue tracking tools and an Agile way of working
 Personal qualities:
 • A good ability of communication and team work is essential
 • Structured, with good analytical and problem-solving skills
 • Capable of focusing on both daily issues and long term visions
 • Interested in new tools and technologies

headline: Talented Devops Node/GoLang developer
description.text:
Summary

At APSIS, we imagine a world where nobody gets a single spam message ever again.

Our vision is to help our customers communicate better with their users by allowing them to use their customer data more effectively. 

Work Description

Our new APSIS One platform is built from the ground up using brand new cloud-native technology and methods.

APSIS aims to work at the forefront of technology and development. We follow modern agile practices with cross-functional DevOps teams, where each team assumes complete technical and operational ownership of their applications. This includes implementation, architectural design and tech selection, QA, continuous delivery, and technical production environment operations. We believe in small, highly skilled, highly empowered and autonomous teams taking maximal ownership of their systems.

In a typical day this role will be working as part of such a team, working in close collaboration with their team members and other similar teams in Stockholm, Malmö, Warsaw and Rostov, and with their Product Owner. APSIS dev teams also have “20% time” where the team works outside the product backlog on tasks of their own choice.

Responsibilities

- As part of the development team, implement new features and solve engineering challenges in a modern, cloud-native, microservice-based tech stack.
- Take an active part in team development, knowledge sharing and improvements to increase team velocity and developer quality of life.
- Respond to disruptions and proactively work to prevent such from occurring in the first place. 


Requirements

- 2+ years / 5+ years / 7+ years of professional development experience with a robust software engineering background
- Professional experience with using Amazon Web Services (particularly ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, Lambda, API Gateway, ElasticSearch, CloudWatch, and supporting tools like IAM) and Docker in production systems
- Experience with Node and/or GoLang and ready to learn and pick up tasks in either language
- Proven ability to write high-performant, maintainable code
- Ability to operate in a DevOps environment
- Experience with working on CI/CD pipelines
- Interest in, and ability to work hands-on with managing your own cloud infrastructure on a daily basis
- Creative and solutions-oriented, someone who enjoys tackling big challenges and is not afraid to learn new things along the way

- Collaborative mindset, ability to work as part of a very distributed development organisation where many small teams need to coordinate


Bonus qualifications

- Experience with Angular, Typescript, React, Jasmine, ngrx
- Experience with Java, C# and .Net core
- AWS certifications or equivalent evidence of advanced AWS competency
- Experience with high performance / resilient microservices architecture is highly desirable
- Experience with REST API design, development and consumption
- Experience with distributed systems, queueing systems, event driven architecture
- Professional experience with building SaaS software, especially from web analytics or digital marketing or equivalent
- Experience from integration with 3rd party vendor systems


Position type

Full time


Please apply by providing your CV and a personal letter as soon as possible. We will hire as soon as we find the right person.



About us
At APSIS, we believe in enabling great marketing for our customers. As the leading provider of marketing solutions in the Nordics, our goal is to enable and simplify the workloads of our many global clients every day. We do this by creating simple yet scalable tools within digital marketing, including data management, targeted emails, lead management and e-commerce recovery. At the end of the day, it all comes down to one thing: our clients’ marketing success is our success. And we’re proud to be there for them, every step of the way. ...Intrigued? Find out more at apsis.com!

Disclaimer

Apsis is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Apsis via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Apsis.

headline: Cloud DevOps Developer, Solna-Hybrid
description.text:
Join us! Be part of creating the digital customer experiences of the future with us.

At PostNord Digital we build customer solutions for the Nordic markets. A few examples of existing services and apps is PostNord Kundportal, Skicka Direkt, PostNord App and Riktiga Vykort. We have an open and positive environment where we share mistakes and knowledge to learn and improve our skills. We work agile in a DevOps culture, close with our customers and partners and with the latest techniques. 



Learn more about PostNord Digital on https://www.linkedin.com/showcase/postnord-digital/.



We offer you


 - We encourage you to develop. For example, we sponsor you to AWS certify.
 - A job where the value you deliver is important to hundreds of thousands of users.
 - Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and indoor swimming pool.
 - Employee benefits through PostNord´s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
 - Great occupational pension terms.





You will be working in a cross functional team full of experts in API Management and JS/Typescript providing world class APIs to thousands of clients. As a DevOps developer you will be working with our API Platform used by our customers to integrate our APIs into their system. You will also be working with our digital Teams to help our colleagues to make things faster in their daily routines.

You will be responsible for the API Platform lifecycle management from beginning to end where you will work closely with your Product Owner or other business stakeholders and customers to discuss ideas. Then collaborate with teams from design and implementation perspective. There is also a possibility to build feature components within the delivery if that interest exists.




We are looking for you who have

We believe that you have experience of cloud DevOps, and a drive to perform some programming. You should also be familiar to work with infrastructural tasks and basic knowledge in any scripting language. You should not be afraid to contribute to make our delivery better, by adopting modern frameworks and innovative technologies. 


 - Knowledge configuring ngnix proxy server.

 - Experience of CI/CD using bitbucket pipelines or similar.
 - Great communication and collaboration skills.
 - Familiar with node.js, NPM and private packages, Git and Bitbucket, AWS.
 - Team working in an Agile environment.



We make everyday life easier

PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at www.postnord.com



Apply

We look forward to receive your application! 


For union representatives, visit: https://www.postnord.com/sv/karriar/kontakt/facklig-kontakt

We are looking forward to hear from you!

#LI-Hybrid #DevOps #Cloud

headline: DevOps utvecklare med infrastrukturfokus
description.text:
Din roll

Vår verksamhet behöver förstärkas med en DevOps-utvecklare med infrastrukturfokus på vår fortsatta resa mot frekventa leveranser till kund.

Utvecklingen bedrivs i agila team där vi kontinuerligt fokuserar på att förbättra våra arbetssätt, system och utvecklingsmiljöer. Teamet ansvarar för att designa, implementera och testa systemen vi utvecklar.

Du kommer vara en del av teamet som tar fram, och underhåller, vår framtida utvecklingsmiljö.



Din profil

Du har teknisk högskoleutbildning på minst KY-nivå, samt ett genuint intresse för programmering och kompetens inom flera av följande områden:

 *


 *


 *


 *

Ett programmeringsspråk, t.ex Java/Python/C++ , eller liknande
 *

DevOps
 *

Virtualisering/containers (t.ex. VMware och Docker)



Meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av något av nedan:

 *


 *

Versionshanteringssystem (t.ex. Git och ClearCase)
 *

Mjukvarutestning
 *

Byggsystem
 *

Configuration Management
 *

Python (webbutveckling)
 *

Artifactory
 *

Embedded Systems



För att trivas i rollen behöver du gilla att jobba i tvärfunktionella team och att bidra till både teamets samt verksamhetens utveckling. Det är viktigt för dig att komma framåt och att kunna hitta effektiva lösningar. Du är en engagerad och kreativ person som vill utvecklas både personligt och professionellt samt prova olika teknikområden.



Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. 



Vad blir du en del av

Surveillance, ett Affärsområde inom Saab, är en världsledande leverantör av system för bl.a. sensorer och självskyddssystem. Affärsenhet Radar Solutions är ansvarig för Radarprodukter i flygande-, markbaserade- och marina system.







Affärsområdet Surveillance erbjuder världsledande sensorteknik inom övervakning och beslutsstöd för att skydda mot hot. Portföljen omfattar luftburna, markbaserade och marina radarer, elektronisk krigföring, stridsledning, flygsystem och cybersäkerhet.

Verksamheten bedrivs i Sverige, USA, UK, Australien, Tyskland, Sydafrika, Förenade Arabemiraten, Danmark och Finland.



Vill du lära känna vår verksamhet och personal lite bättre? Här kan du hitta berättelser från några av våra anställda.







Vi är stolta över en vårdande miljö, där alla är olika men vi delar samma uppdrag - att skapa förutsättningar för ett tryggt samhälle.

headline: Cloudutvecklare, Service och Devops
description.text:
Taekwondo-tränare, biodlare eller hobbyfiskare? Just nu söker vi en cloudutvecklare med fler intressen än bara jobbet.

Dina talanger och erfarenheter berikar. De bidrar till en större förståelse för människors vardag och den värld vi alla lever i samt gör CPAC Systems till en roligare arbetsplats att jobba på. När du, humleodlaren och filatelisten hamnar i möte med hemmasnickaren tar ni er an de kreativa utmaningarna på andra sätt än när ni bara har på er ingenjörshatten. Ni hittar smartare lösningar som gör livet lättare för våra kunder ute på deras arbetsplatser, inte bara ute i lastbilen, grävmaskinen, asfaltsläggaren, dumpern utan även för dem på sitekontoret.

Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens produkter inom bland annat automation, styrning, HMI och när vi tar steget bortom maskinerna och skapar kraftfulla lösningar för både webben och mobila enheter? Alltsammans uppkopplat i real-tid baserat på vår egen cloud-lösning. Har du andra erfarenheter än de som syns på visitkortet eller examensbeviset? Välkommen att leda och utveckla fordonsbranschen tillsammans med oss.

Det här vill vi att du ska göra

Som cloudutvecklare på CPAC får du jobba med de roligaste, men också de mest utmanande projekten inom vår bransch. Du arbetar tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor i ett utvecklingsteam med fokus på att skapa framtidens produkter. Eftersom vi är ett produktbolag kommer du att vara med hela vägen från idé till färdig produkt. Kraven som ställs på användarvänlighet och värdeskapande funktioner är mycket höga vilket gör att samarbetet mellan kunder, utvecklare och provning är otroligt viktigt. Du arbetar tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor i projektteamet med fokus på att verkligen göra skillnad för våra kunder.

Organisationen är platt och rättfram i en bransch där utvecklingen går mycket snabbt framåt, där du kommer att vara direkt involverad i det som händer.

Det här är du

Vi söker dig som tycker att cloudutveckling är bland det roligaste som finns. Då våra team jobbar brett med produkten och kundvärdet i fokus får du gärna även ha intresse för systemutveckling, testutveckling och allt annat som krävs för att sätta en framgångsrik produkt på marknaden. Du håller dig uppdaterad på vad som händer inom dina specialområden och delar med dig av din expertkunskap som vi tror du fått genom några års erfarenhet av att arbeta med:

 - Devops, Golang, Java, SQL/databaser, Git/SVN, Spring, Linuxmiljöer, Kommunikation via http, websockets, REST eller GRPC.

Har du även erfarenhet inom följande områden så är det meriterande:

 - Kotlin, Node, Kubernetes, Helm, AWS, Docker/Micro-services, Ingress, Ambassador, Javascript, Typescript.

Utöver intresse för just cloudutveckling är du en bra kollega och gillar kreativ friktion. Du tar dig tid att lyssna samtidigt som du gillar fart. Och såklart är du van vid att kommunicera på både på svenska och engelska.

I vår värld rekryterar vi personligheter. Känner du att det här är något för dig vill vi gärna veta vem du är.

headline: DevOps Engineer at Toyota
description.text:
We at Toyota are looking for DevOps engineers that can further strengthen our growing software development organisation at R&D.
 As a DevOPS Engineer at Toyota R&D you will:
Work with all our software development teams and products.
Improve and introduce new software development tools.
Automate workflows with scripts or other tools to make our development process more efficient
Standardise way of working for software developers, repos, tools, CI/CD pipelines, release management, connection to issue management systems...
Manage our Azure cloud subscription and configuration of Azure DevOps.
Support re-use of common software components in Toyota products.
Coordinate activities with Toyota IS/IT.

Our software organisation is growing, we are adding new teams and software components - both for embedded- and cloud based applications. As a DevOps engineer you will have the possibility to work across all teams and support them with expert knowledge of our tools and processes. As a DevOps engineer you will learn our products and their code base, while focusing on how to increase our efficiency via automation or usage of new or existing tools. As a DevOps engineer you probably have a software developer background but have developed knowledge of or want to become a tool smith that makes your colleagues smile when they use your latest scripts or standardized tool setup.
At Toyota in Mjölby you will see your efforts result in a complete product, our fork-lifts. As a developer you are expected from time to time to test new software or solutions on fork-lifts in our lab. Fork-lift driver licence is included in the employment.
Development is primarily done in various scripting languages and configuration files.

Your profile
Master or Bachelor in Engineering, other relevant technical college education or vocational education combined with work experience.
Experience of software development, CI/CD and git
Knowledge of various scripting languages
Azure and Azure DevOps knowledge is a plus, but not mandatory
A broad interest in technology and good problem-solving ability

headline: DevOps Engineer • Platform
description.text:
In 2021, Zettle became ZettlebyPayPal to go further in its mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. By offering the tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow, we are empowering them to reach their full potential. Together, we’re extraordinary. Together, we’re made for more and the best is yet to come. Our journey in putting an end to ordinary and redefine financial freedom is just starting. 


As we continue our quest to democratize financial services, our Platforms Alliance is on the lookout for a passionate engineer to join our Platform Services Team. In this role, you will get the opportunity to co-tackle a wide variety of challenges together with a group of talented people driven by a shared ambition to create hassle-free solutions enabling our internal customers i.e feature teams.
A glimpse of what you will get here
Simply stated, our day-to-day mission essentially consists in providing the best platform experience for our feature teams. As a member of Platform Services, you will be jointly responsible for the daily's operations of our infrastructure systems and everything “platform” that allow millions of transactions to flow through our system every day.
As a member of the wider platform area you would be able to make a difference in a more general direction around shared DevOps domains between the platform teams such as infrastructure and monitoring and collaborate on POC work and larger projects.

While we will be here to support you, we think that the following skills and know-how would help you to be successful:

Be able to write clean code in a language or two to create tooling (Python, Golang or Java).
A passion to automate away repetitive tasks and increase efficiency.
Experience with Docker.
Extolls the behaviors and understanding associated with "DevOps" and "SRE".
Understands the developer perspective of platforms/systems.
Great collaboration skills.


You are a true team player known for being reliable, curious and bold.
You are willing and able to communicate well and include yourself in group discussions.
You gladly share your knowledge, experience and opinions while understanding and respecting that the last word comes from the team.

Where does the magic happen?
We look forward moving into our brand-new office in the middle of the Tech Hub in central Stockholm (Sweden).
Go on, bring your talent to our attention!
If you're ready to take things further, hit Apply & let's talk!

headline: Molnexpert - DevOps Specialist
description.text:
Vill du jobba i ett självstyrande team med moderna tekniker och nära samarbete med andra utvecklingsteam? Brinner du för att vara med och utveckla produkter som gör skillnad för demokratin, samhället och det fria ordet? Då kommer du att trivas på Bonnier News – Sveriges största mediehus där vi nu tar nästa steg i att skapa morgondagens journalistik.

Vi är i en spännande fas där vi lägger grunden för den framtida driften av de tekniska plattformarna till Bonnier News många kända varumärken. Tyngdpunkten ligger i att bygga upp infrastruktur i Googles molnplattform. Kopplat till detta så söker vi en DevOps-expert som vill vara med och bygga en av Mediesveriges mest moderna och progressiva utvecklingsorganisationer.

Om teamet:

Du kommer vara en del av ett engagerat team som stöttar de olika utvecklingsteamen inom Bonnier News Tech gällande användning av molntjänster, CDN och annan infrastruktur. I rollen kommer du jobba nära våra DevOps-specialister och utvecklare samt övriga team-medlemmar som är placerade i Stockholm och Mellerud. Du kan räkna med visst distansarbete, men du bör kunna vara på plats 2-3 dagar per vecka.

Vi jobbar mycket med, och värdesätter, samarbete. Både inom teamet och i olika samarbeten med varumärkenas utvecklingsteam. Detta tar sig ofta uttryck i par-/mobbprogrammering, inte sällan över teamgränserna. På så sätt är vi både stöd till utvecklingsteamen och har inflytande på teknikval, strukturer och best practices.

Några av de vanligaste teknikerna hos oss i dagsläget:

 -
Docker.

 -
Kubernetes, speciellt Openshift.

 -
Tjänster inom GCP, men även AWS.

 -
Elasticsearch, MongoDB, Redis, PostgreSQL.

 -
NodeJS och Golang.


Din erfarenhet:

Vi söker dig som har jobbat med några av de ovan nämnda tekniker, gärna med fokus på infrastruktur och DevOps. Du är prestigelös och gillar att samarbeta med andra i autonoma team. Bonnier News vill ta tillvara de kvaliteter som en jämn könsfördelning samt etnisk och kulturell mångfald tillför verksamheten.

Övrig information

Bonnier News Tech har tre hubbar; Stockholm, Sundsvall och Malmö. I den här rollen har du möjlighet att jobba på den plats, av dessa tre som passar dig bäst. 

Urvalet till den här tjänsten sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt genom att trycka på ansök-knappen nedan. Med anledning av GDPR har vi inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via email.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan, hoppas vi hörs!


Inom Bonnier News värnar vi om det fria ordet och gör skillnad genom journalistik som når och berör många. Vi är Sveriges ledande mediehus med varumärken som Dagens Nyheter, Expressen och Dagens industri når vi miljoner läsare och användare varje dag. Genom Bonnier News Local har vi även ett stort lokalt engagemang - från Sydsvenskan i söder till Örnsköldsviks Allehanda i norr. Förutom detta ger vi också ut branschspecifika tidningar såsom Dagens Media, Resumé, Dagens medicin och Fastighetsnytt, och även en rad livsstilsmagasin som Damernas Värld, Sköna Hem, Teknikens Värld och Allt om Mat m.fl. Genom att ständigt driva den digitala utvecklingen framåt når vi hela tiden längre - som medarbetare hos oss kan du påverka riktningen.

headline: UCG 111903 Engineer Devops
description.text:
UCG/Radio Support is a consulting company based in Kista in northern Stockholm. Regardless placement you will be employed by UCG, with Swedish salary and benifits.

As a consultant you may be placed at different customers. UCG will assist with extra training when needed. As a consultant we need you to be flexible and to easily adapt to a new environment.
Education/training
Our roles require a basic technical education, sometimes university level.
Experience
We require at least 3 years of relevant job experience for all roles, mostly more.
Required experience for this role:
- experience as Devops engineer, specifically:
-Experience with container technology such as Docker

-Experience of using and operating version control systems such as GitHub
-Experience with binary repository tools such as Artifactory


Qualifying requirements:
- Embedded systems
- Container orchestration and tools such as Kubernetes

- MedTech or other regulated businesses


About the position
-Role as engineer in a Devops team.
-Be part of a team of 6 and contribute with your experience as Devops Engineer in order to create a modern CI/CD infrastructure including test execution in container environment for both host and target, implement delivery pipelines for different products/applications and create a test execution platform for automatic tests.
-Team consists of Devops engineers, software developers and testers.
-Area: Medical devices
Location: Stockholm
Start: Asap

headline: DevOps Engineer to Swedbank
description.text:
Then the key-role as DevOps Engineer to Swedbank’s team “Pega CoE” might be the right next step for you.

You will lead the DevOps journey for the Pega application, help building Continuous Delivery pipelines, improve the area of test automation and achieve Software-Defined Everything (SDx). Sounds interesting? 


In this role as DevOps Engineer you will be part of an experienced team – the Pega Centre of Excellence (CoE) team at Swedbank. As DevOps Engineer, you will play a central role in the prioritized and strategic vision for Swedbank overall.

Your will get the opportunity to:
  Deliver platform services and expertise guidance to the development teams.
 Securing a stable platform by proactive drive development, monitoring, configuring and troubleshooting of the Pega platform.
 Be responsible for development and lifecycle of the Pega DevOps pipelines.
 Act as a consultant for questions in DevOps and cloud strategy.
 Collaborate with external vendor (Pegasystems) to taking the next step for the DevOps journey.

You will work across seven business areas and be part of leading the DevOps journey for the Pega application(s). It is a great opportunity to get to know many different parts of the bank and to continuously get personal as well as technical development. You will be placed at Swedbank’s HQ in Sundbyberg.

Is this you?

  Experience from working as a DevOps Engineer, in a leading position

 Extensive experience in SW development life cycle

 Deep understanding of application structure including hardware and integrations to systems

Knowledge on cloud technologies like Azure and AWS are meritorious. Experience from working with a BPM tool is not mandatory but also an advantage.

Personality wise, it is important that you have great communication skills as you will be in contact with many different departments internally as well as external consultants and vendors. It is important that you are pedagogic and comfortable in facilitating workshops. You are a true team-player who gets energy of achieving common goals but are also self-driven and used to take own initiatives. You are curious and driven by learning new things and to develop.


In this process Swedbank is working with Level Recruitment.

headline: Senior Developer with Devops
description.text:
Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

It is in everything we do. From delivering a premium service to our operators, to creating an entertaining experience for the end user; we are unwavering in our mission to create the worlds’ leading sports betting experience.

Senior Developer with Devops experience

Kambi Development is constantly growing, and we are looking for more skilled people to further strengthen our development teams' ability to turn user stories into shippable code. We're dedicated to value driven development, think lean software development is a great way of achieving that, and use agile processes to support our efforts along the road.

Our team consists of 3 developers and one tester and are now looking to grow that, We believe in passion for quality, taking ownership, being inventive and having a mindset that is open to giving and receiving feedback to improve as individuals. You will work in our office at Juvelen in central Uppsala, tapping into the spirit of starting up something new while being part and work in close cooperation with our Stockholm office and other offices around the world.

This is what we are looking for

• You are used to build scalable and maintainable systems that runs and fails gracefully.
• Use code reviewing and automated tests to ensure a high-quality product.
• Know your way around containerization and orchestration.
• Knowledge in migrating to cloud.
• Apply their technical skills and curiosity to the product development process.
• Monitor our products in production, finding ways of improving them.
• Continuous integration and releasing our tested code into production.

This is some tech we work with

• Java 11+
• Kotlin
• Kafka
• ZooKeeper
• PostgreSQL
• LinuxAnsible
• AWS
• K8S/EKS
• Terraform
• JavaScript & React knowledge is a plus
• Git
• Kibana
• Docker

• IntelliJ
• Grafana/Graphite

We would like you to

• Have at least 5 years of professional experience as a Java developer
• Have good experience of working in an agile team developing, deploying and
• owning business critical systems
• Have demonstrated that you have the mindset and skills to become an
• effective part of a cross-functional, self-organizing, self-managing team
• Be technically brilliant (or getting there)
• Have both theoretical and practical knowledge of agile and/or lean software
• development
• Have the ability to write clean, well-structured and readable code


You'll like Kambi if you:

• Find technically complex systems thrilling
• Take pride in being good at what you do and doing it well
• Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team
• Thinks business value delivered is what defines great development
• Think common sense goes a long way

• Work closely together within their development team
• Write testable software in collaboration with our testers
• Continuously improve our way of working
• Support our Product Owners with technical insight

If you want to be part of a dedicated community of developers in central Uppsala, then please apply with a cover letter and your CV.

headline: DevOps Engineer till IT-Total
description.text:
Vill du jobba med ett vinnande team?
Vi på IT-Total är ett vinnande IT-bolag som växer så det knakar. Tillsammans arbetar vi med att leverera de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder. I våra olika uppdrag använder vi de modernaste teknikerna och har de roligaste projekten. Vi har både interna projekt samt externa uppdrag och vi arbetar med allt från strategi, implementation och utveckling.
Om tjänsten
Är du ett proffs som brinner för att skapa nytta kommer du att ha det väldigt bra på IT-Total. Nu behöver vi förstärka vårt DevOps Team med en till specialist som kan agera expert i våra olika interna och externa projekt. Vi utvecklar anpassade system med moderna lösningar som hjälper oss och våra kunder att arbeta smartare. IT-Total vill jobba med de bästa i branschen och vi är ett stort gäng specialister där det finns mycket i utbyte på en avancerad nivå.
Vad krävs för att lyckas i rollen?



Goda erfarenheter av att utveckla Machine Learning lösningar.
Hands-on erfarenheter av att arbeta med Micro-services/containers (Docker, Kubernetes etc. ).
Erfarenhet av infrastrukturhantering och DevOps. 
Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt och är villig att ta olika typer av arbetsuppgifter för att uppfylla leveransen.
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.

Meriterande:
Certifieringar, men självklart kan vi hjälpa dig på vägen.

Erfarenhet inom C#, .Net eller andra programmeringsspråk.

Varför kommer du att trivas på IT-Total
Vi vill att du ska få goda förtjänstvillkor och frihet att styra din egen utveckling och ditt eget arbete. Utöver att vi är en bra arbetsplats med fantastiska medarbetare så är vi ett mycket aktivt gäng som gör saker tillsammans, när pandemin tillåter. Vi tror på teamkänsla och en stark personlig utveckling.
Vi är en innovativ arbetsgivare som satsar på framtiden och jobbar i teknikens framkant. Hos oss omges du av kollegor som är bland de vassaste i branschen inom IT-infrastruktur och Cybersäkerhet. Vår kultur är något vi är mycket stolta över och som har kännetecknat oss sedan start. Vi lever efter våra kärnvärden som genomsyrar allt vi gör: Gemenskap, Engagemang, Kompetens, Kvalité och Omtanke.
Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

headline: UCG 121601 Engineer Devops
description.text:
UCG/Radio Support is a consulting company based in Kista in northern Stockholm. Regardless placement you will be employed by UCG, with Swedish salary and benifits.

As a consultant you may be placed at different customers. UCG will assist with extra training when needed. As a consultant we need you to be flexible and to easily adapt to a new environment.
Education/training
Our roles require a basic technical education, sometimes university level.
Experience
We require at least 3 years of relevant job experience for all roles, mostly more.
Required experience for this role:
•	Experience programming in Go (highly preferred) or Java
•	Knowledge of:
−	Kubernetes
−	Microservice architecture
−	Tracing technologies
−	Networking protocols (HTTP and GRPC)
•	Ability to safely operate and maintain databases (Postgres, etcd, Cassandra/Scylla, Kafka, Elasticsearch)
•	Debugging & troubleshooting abilities

Qualifying requirements:
--Swedish


About the position
-You will be a part of a highly skilled and driven R&D team. Together you will work with many of their most difficult DevOps challenges.
-You will join an existing team in charge of the development, deployment, and operational support.
Location: Stockholm/remote
Start: Asap

headline: DevOps Engineer at Toyota
description.text:
We at Toyota are looking for DevOps engineers that can further strengthen our growing software development organisation at R&D.
 As a DevOPS Engineer at Toyota R&D you will:
Work with all our software development teams and products.
Improve and introduce new software development tools.
Automate workflows with scripts or other tools to make our development process more efficient
Standardise way of working for software developers, repos, tools, CI/CD pipelines, release management, connection to issue management systems...
Manage our Azure cloud subscription and configuration of Azure DevOps.
Support re-use of common software components in Toyota products.
Coordinate activities with Toyota IS/IT.

Our software organisation is growing, we are adding new teams and software components - both for embedded- and cloud based applications. As a DevOps engineer you will have the possibility to work across all teams and support them with expert knowledge of our tools and processes. As a DevOps engineer you will learn our products and their code base, while focusing on how to increase our efficiency via automation or usage of new or existing tools. As a DevOps engineer you probably have a software developer background but have developed knowledge of or want to become a tool smith that makes your colleagues smile when they use your latest scripts or standardized tool setup.
At Toyota in Mjölby you will see your efforts result in a complete product, our fork-lifts. As a developer you are expected from time to time to test new software or solutions on fork-lifts in our lab. Fork-lift driver licence is included in the employment.
Development is primarily done in various scripting languages and configuration files.

Your profile
Master or Bachelor in Engineering, other relevant technical college education or vocational education combined with work experience.
Experience of software development, CI/CD and git
Knowledge of various scripting languages
Azure and Azure DevOps knowledge is a plus, but not mandatory
A broad interest in technology and good problem-solving ability

headline: Talented Devops Node/GoLang developer
description.text:
Summary

At APSIS, we imagine a world where nobody gets a single spam message ever again.

Our vision is to help our customers communicate better with their users by allowing them to use their customer data more effectively. 

Work Description

Our new APSIS One platform is built from the ground up using brand new cloud-native technology and methods.

APSIS aims to work at the forefront of technology and development. We follow modern agile practices with cross-functional DevOps teams, where each team assumes complete technical and operational ownership of their applications. This includes implementation, architectural design and tech selection, QA, continuous delivery, and technical production environment operations. We believe in small, highly skilled, highly empowered and autonomous teams taking maximal ownership of their systems.

In a typical day this role will be working as part of such a team, working in close collaboration with their team members and other similar teams in Stockholm, Malmö, Warsaw and Rostov, and with their Product Owner. APSIS dev teams also have “20% time” where the team works outside the product backlog on tasks of their own choice.

Responsibilities

- As part of the development team, implement new features and solve engineering challenges in a modern, cloud-native, microservice-based tech stack.
- Take an active part in team development, knowledge sharing and improvements to increase team velocity and developer quality of life.
- Respond to disruptions and proactively work to prevent such from occurring in the first place. 


Requirements

- 2+ years / 5+ years / 7+ years of professional development experience with a robust software engineering background
- Professional experience with using Amazon Web Services (particularly ECS, RDS, DynamoDB, Lambda, API Gateway, ElasticSearch, CloudWatch, and supporting tools like IAM) and Docker in production systems
- Experience with Node and/or GoLang and ready to learn and pick up tasks in either language
- Proven ability to write high-performant, maintainable code
- Ability to operate in a DevOps environment
- Experience with working on CI/CD pipelines
- Interest in, and ability to work hands-on with managing your own cloud infrastructure on a daily basis
- Creative and solutions-oriented, someone who enjoys tackling big challenges and is not afraid to learn new things along the way

- Collaborative mindset, ability to work as part of a very distributed development organisation where many small teams need to coordinate


Bonus qualifications

- Experience with Angular, Typescript, React, Jasmine, ngrx
- Experience with Java, C# and .Net core
- AWS certifications or equivalent evidence of advanced AWS competency
- Experience with high performance / resilient microservices architecture is highly desirable
- Experience with REST API design, development and consumption
- Experience with distributed systems, queueing systems, event driven architecture
- Professional experience with building SaaS software, especially from web analytics or digital marketing or equivalent
- Experience from integration with 3rd party vendor systems


Position type

Full time


Please apply by providing your CV and a personal letter as soon as possible. We will hire as soon as we find the right person.



About us
At APSIS, we believe in enabling great marketing for our customers. As the leading provider of marketing solutions in the Nordics, our goal is to enable and simplify the workloads of our many global clients every day. We do this by creating simple yet scalable tools within digital marketing, including data management, targeted emails, lead management and e-commerce recovery. At the end of the day, it all comes down to one thing: our clients’ marketing success is our success. And we’re proud to be there for them, every step of the way. ...Intrigued? Find out more at apsis.com!

Disclaimer

Apsis is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Apsis via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Apsis.

headline: ALTEN söker DevOps Engineer
description.text:
ALTEN IT Stockholm växer och söker nu en DevOps Engineer till ett spännande och långvarigt projekt hos en av våra kunder. Hos ALTEN får du också möjligheten att ledas av vår engagerade chefsgrupp som kommer vägleda dig framåt i din karriär! För oss är det viktigt att du som konsult på ALTEN får en bra teamkänsla och en riktigt härlig gemenskap både i ditt uppdrag men även på ALTEN-kontoret. 


VI SER GÄRNA ATT VÅR NÄSTA KOLLEGA HAR ERFARENHET AV FÖLJANDE:
• ERFARENHET (3+ ÅR) AV UTVECKLARROLLEN.
• CI/CD
• MICROSERVICES
• DOCKER OCH KUBERNETES
• GIT / JENKINS / GERRIT
MERITERANDE KUNSKAP:
• Java eller C#


• Frontendteknologier
• Agilt / Scrum

OM ALTEN
Att arbeta som konsult på ALTEN innebär flera möjligheter för dig, bland annat erbjuder vi dig en karriärresa med fokus på möjligheter, utveckling och gemenskap. Vi drivs av att se människor växa och utvecklas, både professionellt och personligt. Därför erbjuder vi bland annat en personlig utbildningsbudget. Med en bred kundbas inom olika branscher och ett stort urval av tjänsteområden både nationellt och internationellt kan vi på ALTEN hjälpa dig att utvecklas. ALTEN är ett starkt växande bolag och ser fram emot att ha med just dig på resan. Vi på ALTEN erbjuder en trygg karriärresa och värdesätter våra medarbetares välmående och värderar deras balans mellan arbete och privatliv högt. Detta innefattar bland annat kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag, personalcykel, tjänstepension och försäkringar.

ALTEN är ett konsultbolag som utvecklar och levererar kompetens för världsledande företag med konsulter inom teknik, IT och biokemi. I Sverige är vi över 1 700 medarbetare och arbetar från kontor på elva orter, från Skellefteå till Lund. Våra kunder återfinns inom branscher som fordon, telekom, försvar, energi, verkstadsindustri, läkemedel och medicinteknik, där våra konsulter är verksamma genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan.

Vid frågor om tjänsten, vänligen kontakta

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan –
WE BELIEVE IN GROWING TOGETHER!

headline: DevOps Engineer till Swish
description.text:
Swish lanserades 2012 och har sedan dess blivit hela Sveriges mobila betalapp och en av de största mobila betalningslösningarna i Europa. Bolaget Getswish ansvarar för Swish infrastruktur, tjänster, dess regelverk samt varumärket Swish. Swish har cirka 25 medarbetare och har sitt kontor i centrala Stockholm. Deras tjänster möjliggör betalningar mellan privatpersoner, till företag både för e-handel och i fysiska miljö. Den senaste tjänsten möjliggör även utbetalningar från företag till privatpersoner.



Nuvarande situation och resa framåt:
Vi satsar nu på att ytterligare förenkla vardagen för våra kunder och användare. Det blir en tuff, men superintressant resa att transformera både vår nuvarande on-problemlösning till cloud OCH bygga upp en egen IT-organisation. De kommande åren ska vi gå från en helt outsourcad leverans till att sätta oss i förarsätet. Tillsammans med våra leverantörer ska vi göra en resa från traditionell utveckling-förvaltning-drift till en verklighet där vi arbetar enligt DevOps-practice i GCP. Denna transformation blir en balansakt eftersom Swish dels ska klara av att skala affären, bära nya tjänster och fortfarande tillhandahålla en tillgänglig och stabil tjänst 24/7.

Nu söker söker vi en DevOps-engineer som känner sig hemma i att arbeta med Terraform, GCP, Kubernetes och där hela rasket hanteras i Git! Har du dessutom erfarenhet av att hantera transaktionsintensiva distribuerade system och alla de utmaningar som döljer sig när ett sådant system körs på en microservices-arkitektur så är det ett stort plus. Du kommer vara involverad med systemet i alla dess livscykler; från att arbeta med att utveckla våra CI/CD-pipelines för både infrastrukturen och applikationen till att definiera monitors och dashboards för övervakningen.

Du tror precis som vi att DevOps-metodiken, dvs att teamet gemensamt äger sin del av systemet från design till övervakning, är sättet att skapa effektivitet genom helhetsägande och minimering av överlämningsoverhead. Du tar ansvar genom att du bidrar till ett system som gör att hela teamet, inte bara du, kan gå hem för dagen och vara trygg i att systemet rullar på som det ska. Om något ändå blir fel i systemet ska det vara så transparent att alla i teamet ska kunna förstå och i bästa fall åtgärda problemet.



Mer konkret vill vi komplettera vårt team med dig som känner att listan nedan stämmer bra överens med dig och vad du kan bidra med.

Vi söker dig som har:

- Relevant teknisk högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande och minst 5 års erfarenhet av DevOps-utveckling.
- Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code/Terraform, Kubernetes och CI/CD-pipelines (gärna Gitlab CI/CD).
- Minst 2 års erfarenhet av modern molninfrastruktur (helst GCP).
- Känner dig bekväm med befintlig tech-stack: Java, Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, web services and RESTful API’s.

- Meriterande med kompetens inom uppsättning av monitorering och instrumentering av tjänster (Gärna arbetat med Prometheus, Grafana, Dynatrace eller Datadog).
- Är intresserad av omvärlden och hur man bygger bästa möjliga tekniska lösning för ett bolag i snabb tillväxt.
- Ett analytiskt tänkande och god problemlösningsförmåga.
- Van vid ett agilt arbetssätt och god kommunikativ förmåga, både verbalt och i skrift (helst svensktalande)






Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

headline: DevOps Engineer till Datscha
description.text:
2017 flyttade världsledande Datschas utvecklingskontor till Luleå och Varvsgatan, Datscha fortsätter att satsa och växa i Luleå och rekryterar nu en driven Devops Engineer till teamet.
Ghost Competence ansvarar för rekryteringsprocessen med du blir anställd direkt hos Datscha.


Information om tjänsten
Datscha är en världsledande leverantör av information och analys av kommersiella fastigheter. På Datscha tror vi på ett nära samarbete. Vi drivs av innovativa, energirika och engagerade medarbetare. Genom att dela med oss av kunskap till varandra bidrar vi tillsammans till vår framgångsresa.
Vi verkar inom området ”PropTech” och är ett tajt litet gäng (okej, kanske inte så litet nu längre) som älskar allt som har med fastighetsdata och teknologi att göra. Idag är vi över 70 medarbetare i 3 länder och har över 900 företag, däribland fastighetsägare och investerare, banker och konsulter, som kunder.
Att vi har kul ihop och trivs tillsammans är grunden till att vi har nöjda kunder.

Information om kundföretaget
Datscha AB är ett software as a service-leverantör (SaaS) av webbaserade tjänster för information och analys av kommersiella fastigheter. Datscha grundades 1996 och verkar i dagsläget på tre marknader, Sverige, Storbritannien och Finland. De flesta av Datschas kunder är verksamma inom finans- eller fastighetsmarknaden

Dina arbetsuppgifter
Som DevOps Engineer hos Datscha arbetar du med automatisering, pipelines och löpande förbättringsarbete, tillsammans med utvecklare och testare och andra tekniker för att skapa en smidig leveransprocess.


Vi söker dig som
Gillar att ha varierande arbetsuppgifter och har en solid grundkunskap i windowsmiljöer men gärna även linux/unix-operativ och att erfarenhet av att jobba med t.ex. Powershell och andra scriptingspråk.
Vi ser att du har en akademisk examen och att har hunnit jobba några år, men viktigast av allt är att du har rätt inställning och vill utvecklas!
Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Fakta
START: Enligt överenskommelse
OMFATTNING: Heltid
ANSTÄLLNINGSFORM: Tillsvidare
ORT: Luleå
SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDAG: 2021-10-08


Sök tjänsten genom att trycka på "sök jobbet". Skapa en användare och ladda upp ditt CV och personliga brev så har du större möjlighet att bli kontaktad av en av våra rekryterare.

Vi verkar inom området ”PropTech” och är ett tajt litet gäng (okej, kanske inte så litet nu längre) som älskar allt som har med fastighetsdata och teknologi att göra. Idag är vi över 70 medarbetare i 3 länder och har över 900 företag, däribland fastighetsägare och investerare, banker och konsulter, som kunder.
Att vi har kul ihop och trivs tillsammans är grunden till att vi har nöjda kunder.

Information om kundföretaget
Datscha AB är ett software as a service-leverantör (SaaS) av webbaserade tjänster för information och analys av kommersiella fastigheter. Datscha grundades 1996 och verkar i dagsläget på tre marknader, Sverige, Storbritannien och Finland. De flesta av Datschas kunder är verksamma inom finans- eller fastighetsmarknaden

Dina arbetsuppgifter
Som DevOps Engineer hos Datscha arbetar du med automatisering, pipelines och löpande förbättringsarbete, tillsammans med utvecklare och testare och andra tekniker för att skapa en smidig leveransprocess.


Vi söker dig som
Gillar att ha varierande arbetsuppgifter och har en solid grundkunskap i windowsmiljöer men gärna även linux/unix-operativ och att erfarenhet av att jobba med t.ex. Powershell och andra scriptingspråk.
Vi ser att du har en akademisk examen och att har hunnit jobba några år, men viktigast av allt är att du har rätt inställning och vill utvecklas!
Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Fakta
START: Enligt överenskommelse
OMFATTNING: Heltid
ANSTÄLLNINGSFORM: Tillsvidare
ORT: Luleå
SISTA ANSÖKNINGSDAG: 2022-01-14

headline: DevOps engineers to ATG
description.text:
ATG is now recruiting two Senior DevOps engineers to join our Operations department.

About the role
You will work with highly skilled colleagues in an inspiring and changing market. Your competence will be challenged in designing, sharing and implement improving solutions for both our and other teams. You will work with technologies such as Linux, Kubernetes (OpenShift) and GitHub. 

Therefore, to be successful in this position, we believe that you have a solid understanding of how development work works in order to be able to conduct constructive cooperation with other teams in the organization. We also believe that you have a good understanding of modern container-based technology. Both within OnPrem-solutions and cloud-based infrastructure.

Our hunger for gitops, infrastructure-as-code and full continuous deployment makes our team build a high competency in running services with high reliability in a highly automated fashion. These learnings, and the ones we pick up from our competent product teams, we try to funnel back into the organization through different mediums. This includes holding brown-bags, internal courses and workshops with different themes.

Your responsibilities as Devops engineer
• Provide stable and reliable infrastructure baselines for the Development teams in collaboration with IT Operations
• Support for the common environments used by Development teams and continuously develop them to smoothen the delivery pipeline and maintain a five nine uptime for our production environment.
• Support the Development teams to grow and deliver healthy SW, by facilitating tools and process alignment.
• Interact with distributed Development teams.

What’s in it for you?
Our culture is open, transparent, and fun with a flat structure.
Our values: Progressive, Respectful and Ownership it is a part of everything we do at ATG. When we recruit to ATG we are looking for people who have genuine interest for their domain, who actively contribute to results, thrive in a diverse environment, and take ownership for deliveries.

We are offering you, just to mention a few:

– Competitive salary package
– Comfortable working conditions
– Remote work options
– Flexible working hours
– 30 days of paid vacation per year
– Work -life balance
– Personal trainer and gym facilities at the office
– Top-quality working equipment
– ITP1 (pension plan)
– Opportunity to work with like-minded individuals in a modern and fast-paced environment.
– Visa sponsorship and support with relocation

We empower modern, digital businesses to build, adapt and thrive in the digital age. We empower smart, passionate, curious minds to collaborate, innovate and thrive in a modern, dynamic organization which we hope you’re interested in joining.
Come and join a company that values both its customers and its employees very highly!


I have a background in the telecom and finance industry, providing platforms to business-critical applications with minimal down-time. I enjoy solving business needs with new technical solutions. As a manager I encourage an open environment with cooperation and discussion and delegate responsibility to the subject matter expert. In addition, I think it is important to have fun at work!

I am looking forward to your application.
Apply today!

Please note that all application should go through our recruitment portal, so please apply accordingly. Personality tests and background check are a part of the recruitment process. All applications will be reviewed earliest by 15th of January 2022 due to Christmas Holidays.

We have made our media choice for recruitment and therefore avoid contact with advertisers or sellers of other recruitment or consultancy services.
We are looking for a person with a few years working experience of/ within:
• Development (preferable Java)
• Kubernetes

• Test and release framework (Jenkins)
• Reporting and monitoring tools (Grafana, Prometheus, elastic search)
• Agile way of working
• Requirement gathering, documentation
• Storage and messaging experience
• Git/Github

• Openshift **

Meritorious if you previously worked with:**
• Docker
• Ansible
• Puppet

We put a lot of emphasis on your personality in this recruitment, therefore we believe you are a person who is curious, self-driven, also a good team-player. This job requires that you are pragmatic and persistent to be able to achieve goals. We like to see that you enjoy working in a diverse, self-managing team where you are open for new learnings and you share knowledge. 

This is us

With us you’ll be part of an innovative environment and with the help of the latest tech you’ll develop the best gaming experience. We enjoy collaborating and with us you’ll get the space to affect your way of work. Here you’ll find curious, new thinking employees and leaders - which are important qualities to be able to develop and be developed. As well as energy, courage and motivation.

Both the physical and the mental health create balance in life. We see it as a given to give the support and tools that are necessary. Your choice of workplace and way of work is flexible and we emphasise self leadership.

We care about each other and we respect each other's inequalities at ATG. And we want our customers to feel good and have fun while playing. We also care about the games well being, i.e. the athletes and the horses - and the society around us. We are not motivated and driven by profits and all surplus goes back to our owners, Svensk Travsport and Svensk Galopp - a good cause that we take pride in.

headline: Senior Developer with Devops
description.text:
Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

It is in everything we do. From delivering a premium service to our operators, to creating an entertaining experience for the end user; we are unwavering in our mission to create the worlds’ leading sports betting experience.

Senior Developer with Devops experience

Kambi Development is constantly growing, and we are looking for more skilled people to further strengthen our development teams' ability to turn user stories into shippable code. We're dedicated to value driven development, think lean software development is a great way of achieving that, and use agile processes to support our efforts along the road.

Our team consists of 3 developers and one tester and are now looking to grow that, We believe in passion for quality, taking ownership, being inventive and having a mindset that is open to giving and receiving feedback to improve as individuals. You will work in our office at Juvelen in central Uppsala, tapping into the spirit of starting up something new while being part and work in close cooperation with our Stockholm office and other offices around the world.

This is what we are looking for

• You are used to build scalable and maintainable systems that runs and fails gracefully.
• Use code reviewing and automated tests to ensure a high-quality product.
• Know your way around containerization and orchestration.
• Knowledge in migrating to cloud.
• Apply their technical skills and curiosity to the product development process.
• Monitor our products in production, finding ways of improving them.
• Continuous integration and releasing our tested code into production.

This is some tech we work with

• Java 11+
• Kotlin
• Kafka
• ZooKeeper
• PostgreSQL
• LinuxAnsible
• AWS
• K8S/EKS
• Terraform
• JavaScript & React knowledge is a plus
• Git
• Kibana
• Docker

• IntelliJ
• Grafana/Graphite

We would like you to

• Have at least 5 years of professional experience as a Java developer
• Have good experience of working in an agile team developing, deploying and
• owning business critical systems
• Have demonstrated that you have the mindset and skills to become an
• effective part of a cross-functional, self-organizing, self-managing team
• Be technically brilliant (or getting there)
• Have both theoretical and practical knowledge of agile and/or lean software
• development
• Have the ability to write clean, well-structured and readable code


You'll like Kambi if you:

• Find technically complex systems thrilling
• Take pride in being good at what you do and doing it well
• Enjoy working in a self-organizing, self-managing team
• Thinks business value delivered is what defines great development
• Think common sense goes a long way

• Work closely together within their development team
• Write testable software in collaboration with our testers
• Continuously improve our way of working
• Support our Product Owners with technical insight

If you want to be part of a dedicated community of developers in central Uppsala, then please apply with a cover letter and your CV.

#LI-LG1

headline: Amazing 3D Experience DevOps
description.text:
Scania is currently undergoing an exciting transformation from a traditional truck manufacturer to a provider of complete sustainable transport solutions. IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.

Globalisation, digitalisation and mobility are examples of trends that are affecting our business environment. We are increasing our ability to make use of our information assets and utilize new technology. New possibilities enable us to share data with each other, apply machine learning and artificial intelligence.



If you are an Amazing person with DevOps skills who wants to work at an Amazing company then keep reading! Also, do not forget to check out our nice benefits further down.

What to expect
You will join a DevOps team that, among other things, works with finding elegant solutions within development and support for R&D. We work close to our customers and are involved in the entire system development process, from concept development to implementation and production. 

You will play a central role in our DevOps team and will have many contacts around the Scania organisation. You will be involved in requirements, development, testing and release management. Together with the other teams, you will work in close cooperation with product and process owners on issues relating to functional guidelines – in both the short and long term.

Then this may be the ideal opportunity for you!

Your profile
We are currently looking for someone who is passionate about agile working methods, loves development and enjoys the challenge of getting people and technology to function as a team to achieve optimal results. You also see opportunities for personal development in a technology-intensive global company.

In a perfect world you are a DevOps Engineer with 2000 years of experience. Our focus is though, besides your skills, your remarkable personality. With us, you don’t need to put on a mask. Come as you are and be yourself!

We would also very much like if you have the interest and ability to handle technical coordination within our area. Scania uses the Dassault Systems application portfolio, knowledge and prior experience of the platform is an advantage. You need to be proficient in written and spoken English, since it’s our corporate language.

If you also like to challenge our current processes and technical solutions, please do so! We’re open minded and want to benefit from your experiences!

In addition, if you also have some of the following skills, we’ll make sure you’ll never have to worry about coffee or tea
• Commitment and motivation to work in an agile DevOps team.




• Knowledge of Oracle databases.
• Knowledge from using GitLab/Perforce and Jenkins.
• Knowledge of test automation.
• Technical coordination skills

As a person, we believe that you are results-oriented, organised and have good planning skills. You view continuous improvement as part of your daily work. You will also have good cooperative and communication skills. It is also important that you are able to take the initiative and work independently.

Location
Scania headquarter is located less than 40 km south of Stockholm city. It is easily accessible by regional train, commuter train, bus or car. 

What’s in it for you
Although we are a competent and professional team, we do not take ourself too seriously! We offer you a fun, interesting, challenging and developing journey together with engaged colleagues within IT and business. In this exciting and dynamic surrounding you can influence the future IT landscape within the TRATON organization.

In addition to exciting career and personnel development opportunities, we offer Scania employees a competitive salary and other benefits, such as a company car, performance bonuses, a pension plan, flexible working hours, lunch at reduced prices and much more.

We can also offer support for the relocation to Sweden and even accommodation in Södertalje.


Kindly apply as soon as possible with CV and cover letter, but no later than 2nd of January 2022, since selection and interviews might be held throughout the whole application period.

We are really looking forward to your application!

For more information



Scania is a part of Traton Group and one of the world´s leading manufacturers of trucks and buses for heavy transport applications. Scania is also leading provider of industrial and marine engines. Service-related products account for a growing proportion of the company´s operations, assuring Scania customers of cost-effective transport solutions and maximum uptime. Scania also offers financial services.

headline: DevOps Engineer to Swedbank
description.text:
Then the key-role as DevOps Engineer to Swedbank’s team “Pega CoE” might be the right next step for you.

You will lead the DevOps journey for the Pega application, help building Continuous Delivery pipelines, improve the area of test automation and achieve Software-Defined Everything (SDx). Sounds interesting? 


In this role as DevOps Engineer you will be part of an experienced team – the Pega Centre of Excellence (CoE) team at Swedbank. As DevOps Engineer, you will play a central role in the prioritized and strategic vision for Swedbank overall.

Your will get the opportunity to:
  Deliver platform services and expertise guidance to the development teams.
 Securing a stable platform by proactive drive development, monitoring, configuring and troubleshooting of the Pega platform.
 Be responsible for development and lifecycle of the Pega DevOps pipelines.
 Act as a consultant for questions in DevOps and cloud strategy.
 Collaborate with external vendor (Pegasystems) to taking the next step for the DevOps journey.

You will work across seven business areas and be part of leading the DevOps journey for the Pega application(s). It is a great opportunity to get to know many different parts of the bank and to continuously get personal as well as technical development. You will be placed at Swedbank’s HQ in Sundbyberg.

Is this you?

  Experience from working as a DevOps Engineer, in a leading position

 Extensive experience in SW development life cycle

 Deep understanding of application structure including hardware and integrations to systems

Knowledge on cloud technologies like Azure and AWS are meritorious. Experience from working with a BPM tool is not mandatory but also an advantage.

Personality wise, it is important that you have great communication skills as you will be in contact with many different departments internally as well as external consultants and vendors. It is important that you are pedagogic and comfortable in facilitating workshops. You are a true team-player who gets energy of achieving common goals but are also self-driven and used to take own initiatives. You are curious and driven by learning new things and to develop.


In this process Swedbank is working with Level Recruitment.
